snippet.title: Home Cafe Marchâ˜•ï¸ Strawberry Ade, Strawberry Latte, Green Tea Latte | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
+To make fruit syrup
-Shortcut : Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide, etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar, and a splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

snippet.description:
Todayâ€™s menu is best ever French toast.
I already showed you guys in 'what I ate in a monthâ€™ video.
But I wanna make this recipe again, also wanna show you this recipe again! Itâ€™s THE BEST way to make French toastğŸ¥°

The key point of make this recipe is thick bread.
I used white bread, but you can use whole wheat bread or any kind of bread you can get.
And the next point is the ratio of basic ingredients, milk-sugar-egg-cinnamon.
If you follow my recipe, you can make 3 thick slices of bread of French toast. Wanna 1 portion of this, use 1/3~1/2 of the recipe.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
white bread
3 eggs
90ml(1/3cup plus 2tsp) milk
25g(5tsp) sugar
5g(1tsp) vanilla extract
1g(1/2tsp) ground cinnamon

unsalted butter 
Icing sugar
berries
vanilla ice cream
honey

1. Slice the bread about 3cm(1 inch).
2. Mix the eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon until well combined.
3. Soak the bread into egg mixture.
4. In a pan with low heat, put the butter and fry until it gets golden brown.
5. Serve with vanilla ice cream, berries, and icing sugar. Also, drizzle some honey or maple syrup.

snippet.title: Singapore Chilli Crab ğŸŒ¶ğŸ¦€ ì‹±ê°€í¬ë¥´ ì¹ ë¦¬í¬ë© | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey :) Todayâ€™s recipe is Singapore Chilli Crab.

In this recipe, i used store-bought chilli crab paste, brand â€˜prima tasteâ€™. In Korea, you can find quite easily in any grocery store. Or if you go to Singapore, itâ€™s in everywhere! (i think)

I didnâ€™t follow the instruction perfectly, but it was really goodğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ Of course, eat chilli crab in Singpore is best option. But like me, who miss the taste of Singapore, you will love this!
I used blue crab and shrimp for this. Blue crab is the easiest crab to find in Korea. If i can found big one, i would use thatğŸ˜­

In the instructions, they used peanut oil. But i didnâ€™t have it and couldnâ€™t found easily, so I used just plain normal veggie oil. And it turns out great!

And with this chilli crab, i ate whit spring onion-egg fired rice, which you can find easily in Chinese cuisine (or some other countries nearby).
For make this, put a veggie oil in a pan on medium-high heat. and put the chopped spring onion and garlic. Frying for about minute or so. and put the cooked rice and frying again. Season with salt and pepper.


**Some might be â€˜what the hackâ€™ that what i did to the crabâ€¦ğŸ˜‚
Actually, it was my first time to cut the crab. I knew i was wrong while is eating thisğŸ˜… But good thing is I can eat the fried rice in that crab shell better than clean cutting one!
But i think i have to make another video with crab, because now i know how to cut crabsğŸ˜‚

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
vegetable oil
2 crabs
5~6 shrimps
470ml water
chilli crab paste
chilli crab premix
30ml water, for chilli crab premix
2 eggs, lightly beaten
coriander leaves

prima taste - Singapore Chilli Crab

1. In a pan, drizzle the vegetable oil and put crabs and shrimps. Cover the lid and cook for about 2~3min on a medium to high heat, until crabs and shrimps are cooked. When itâ€™s cooked, transfer the seafoods to the another bowl
2. Put the chilli crab sauce on a pan and mix on a medium heat. And put the seafoods again and mix well. Pour the water and cover the lid, until water is boiling..
3. Mix the chilli crab premix with water and pour onto the pan. Mix nicely.
4. Beat the egg and pour the eggs. Mix again and remove form heat. Serve with coriander leaves.

snippet.title: Haileyâ€™s Home Cafe December â˜•ï¸ Frozen Hot Chocolate, Irish Coffee, Eggnog | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey with another monthly cafe at home in December.
In this month, I made frozen hot chocolate, Irish coffee and eggnog.

First I heard â€˜frozen hot chocolateâ€™, It reminds me some Koreans saying in cafe â€˜Can I get warm ice americano?â€™. ğŸ˜‚
But after I taste it, I can see why this name is such a mess. It taste like hot chocolate, but it is ice! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚
If I live in Australia, I would drink in every ChristmasğŸ˜†

I heard what is Irish coffee when I was teenager, maybe middle school student. So my dream â€˜wasâ€™ drink Irish coffee. And my wish came true in 2018ğŸ˜‚ 
Taste was not same as what I thought in teenager, but Korea is freakin cold as northern Europe, so I can fully understand why Irish made this!

And lastly, eggnog.
Actually in Korea, eggnog is not that famous drinks. I think because of the name â€˜eggâ€™nog. But it was not that bad, and actually it was good!
But I think itâ€™s too heavy for me, so with coffee or some rum, It would be nice!
And Iâ€™m not prefer to use raw egg, so I cooked and instead of meringue top of the drink, I used whipped cream. 

This is my last video in 2018. Iâ€™m not sure that Iâ€™ll continuing this type of video. 
If you have any other opinions or recommendations, comment down below! It will be very helpful!ğŸ˜‚
And Iâ€™ll studying more English for communicate with you guysğŸ˜†
Right now, my English is quite mess, but I hope you understand! Hope you had great 2018, and I will see you guys in next year! Happy new year everyoneğŸ˜˜

snippet.title: Haileyâ€™s Home Cafe November â˜•ï¸ Spanish Hot Chocolate, Cream Cheese Latte, Einspanner | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey with another monthly cafe at home in November.
In this month, I made spanish hot chocolate, cream cheese latte, and pink einspanner.

Iâ€™ll upload how to make spanish hot chocolate in next month!

When you heard â€˜cream cheese latteâ€™, you may think that doesn't go well with.
Because Iâ€™m the one thought like that. ğŸ˜‚ But itâ€™s really really good.
Have you heard salt coffee? I heard when iâ€™ve been Taiwan for trip, and itâ€™s so delicious. Yes, as you can see, salt and cream cheese is definitely different. I donâ€™t know whatâ€™s wrong with my tongue, but this latte reminds me that salt coffee that i tried in Taiwan. 

And lastly, pink einspanner.
If you following my youtube channel or instagram for awhile, you know Iâ€™m obsessed with einspanner in this year. 
For make this color, I used freeze-drying strawberry powder and little bit of food coloring. If you donâ€™t have, you can replace with strawberry resin or any other ingredients you have! 


This video is with Foodie, especially now filter â€˜creamaâ€™.
You can see the difference before & after with filter!

This filter has unique grainy- feeling into it, and makes the color much more delicious. 
I recommend to use this filter to take coffee. Result will be great!

And this is free app, so you can find this in your App Store!

snippet.title: Haileyâ€™s Monthly Cafeâ˜•ï¸ August : Plum Ade, Ice Chocolate Latte, Blueberry Ade | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers!
In this month, I made plum ade, ice chocolate latte and blueberry ade.

Instruction of plum ade and blueberry ade syrup is bottom of this description box. Hope you check out the recipe.
In this summer, I made plum, apricot, peach and blueberry syrup. All syrups left 1/3, so I eat them more slowly for autumn. 
I hate hot summer weather, but I like summer fruit. I wanna be with them more :)))

When I made ice chocolate latte, chocolate syrup was run out so I made. And homemade one is almost same as store bought. 
I just mixed water 1 : sugar 1 : cocoa powder 0.7 ratio and microwave 40 sec, and it turned out so well. I think I donâ€™t need to buy chocolate syrup anymore XD

ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf

âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Haileyâ€™s Monthly Cafe June) : http://bit.ly/2KXujnn
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Menu
Plum ade : ice, slice of lemon, rosemary, plum syrup, soda water
Ice chocolate latte : ice, chocolate syrup, chocolate milk with coffee, lightly whipped heavy cream
Blueberry ade : slice of preserved lemon, ice, blueberries, blueberry syrup, soda water

+To make fruit syrup
-Shortcut : Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar and splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hour, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

snippet.title: What I Ate in AugustğŸ´ The Best French Toast, Bulgogi & Chilled Cucumber Soup | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, Itâ€™s Hailey.
In what I ate in August Iâ€™ll be showing you how to make the most best french toast and bulgogi & chilled cucumber soup (called oi-naengguk in Korean).

Iâ€™m not that like to eat rice. But at that time when I filmed this video, I was think like 
Oh Itâ€™s quite been a long time since I didnâ€™t eat rice. 
So I made Korean cuisine meal, bulgogi and chilled cucumber soup.
I think bulgogi is quite well known kfood, but chilled cucumber soup is not.
This soup is usually eat hot summer like these days.
You may weird that clear-cold soup with rice, but not that bad as you think. 
If you donâ€™t know what is wakame, itâ€™s edible seaweed, called mi-yeok in Korean. 

French toast in this video is the best recipe ever in my life.
I always change when I make french toast for best ratio.
But this, itâ€™s my final destination of french toast journey ğŸ˜‚
I think ratio was great, but that thick bread is important to make best recipe.
If you donâ€™t like that sweet french toast, I think 4tsp of sugar is enough to make. 


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(What I ate in July) : http://bit.ly/2w3qOWP
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Menu
+Bulgogi & Chilled Cucumber Soup(Oi-naengguk)
*Bulgogi
Ingredients : Ingredients : 250g(8.8oz) beef brisket, 1/2 onion, 1/2 leek, 30g(2Tbsp) soy sauce, 15g(1Tbsp) sugar, 15g(1Tbsp) mirim(rice wine), 20g(1Tbsp) minced garlic, 8g(1/2Tbsp) sesame seed oil, sesame seeds, ground pepper

1. Cut the beef to bite size, and cut onion and leek.
2. To make sauce, mix soy sauce, sugsr, mirim, minced garlic, sesame seed oil, sesame seeds and ground pepper.
3. Mix the beef and onion with sauce.
4. Frying bulgogi with greased pan. When the bulgogi turned almost cook. Turn off the heat, add leek into a pan.


*Chilled Cucumber Soup(Oi-naengguk)
Ingredients : 1 cucumber, handful of soaked wakame, 700ml(3cups) kelp-infused water, 17g(1Tbsp) salt, 60g(4Tbsp) sugar, 20g(4tsp) vinegar, red pepper, sesame seeds

Before you make: soak dried wakame into the water
1. Except middle of cucumber(seed part), slice thinly. Slice red pepper either.
2. Mix all ingredients together.
3. Put it in a fridge, serve when it is chilled.


+French Toast
Ingredients : 3 eggs, 90ml(1/3cup plus 2tsp) milk, 25g(5tsp) sugar, 5g(1tsp) vanilla extract, 1g(1/2tsp) ground cinnamon, unsalted butter, white bread, icing sugar, fruits

1.In a bowl, mix eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon. 
2.After soak the white breads into the egg mixture, frying on the buttered pan.
3.Decorate with icing sugar and fruit (optional).

snippet.title: Natto Okonomiyaki ë‚˜ë˜ ì˜¤ê¼¬ë…¸ë¯¸ì•¼ë¼ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, itâ€™s Hailey. 
Todayâ€™s menu is natto okonomiyaki.
In these days, many people are spend the time for watch World Cup 2018. Especially in Korea, most of the games are in midnight. So lods of people are watching the game with midnight snack and beer. 

So, this video, I made more healthier version of midnight snack. If you guys donâ€™t know, natto is fermented food from Japan. And natto is known for healthy food in your body.

I use bean sprout for this recipe, if you want to make like more original, substitute to shredded cabbage.
Hope you like this video, and Iâ€™ll see you in next video :) 


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(cold chicken noodle soup, chogyeguksu) : http://bit.ly/2MuAXC2
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients 
2 handfuls of bean sprouts
1pack 'Pulmuone' natto
chopped chives
1cup Korean pancake mix
1/3cup water
1 egg
2 slices chopped bacon
vegetable oil
okonomiyaki sauce
mayonnaise
katsuobushi

1. In a bowl, put Korean pancake mix, water and egg, and mix until well combined.
2. In the mixture, add bean sprouts, chopped chives, chopped bacon and natto.
3. Turn on the heat and grease the pan. Put okonomiyaki mixture and frying until slightly golden brown.
4. On well-frying okonomiyaki, put some okonomiyaki sauce and mayonnaise. And sprinkle one katsuobushi on top.

snippet.title: What I Ate in MayğŸ´ : All About Brunch / Naengmyeon, Egg Mayo Toast, Avocado Toast | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, Iâ€™m back again with what I ate in May.
I prepared 3 types of food again, it is kimchi-naengmyeon, egg mayo toast and avocado toast.
I ate a lot of toasts in this month. I like toast so much, but I think i need to try more various foods.

Kimchi-Naengmyeon is one of my favorite Korean foods.
Naengmyeon means cold(â€˜naengâ€™ in Korean) + noodle(â€˜myronâ€™ in Korean).
It may sounds little bit strange I guess, cold noodle.
But I love to eat this naengmyeon especially in summer.
This kimchi-naengmyeon from â€˜Ourhomeâ€™ taste so good, so I eat once a week at least.
If you can find this, I really recommend to try it.

Egg mayo toast was on a trend at 2017, in Korea. 
It is really easy recipe but you know, it looks so good even if only seeing this recipe.
And maybe you think why my color of bread is green. I add mugwort powder when i made that bread.

This avocado toast is reminds me guacamole. Avocado and tomatoes, sooo nice combination.
I bought avocado just before I film this one. But it ripened just right. (yayyy)

snippet.title: What I Ate in April ğŸ´ : Avocado Salad, Tteokbokki, BLT Sandwich | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, Itâ€™s Hailey!
I didinâ€™t upload what I ate in march, so I combine with april. 

This tteobokki recipe is one of my FAVORITE recipe.
Itâ€™s actually similar taste with Korean tteobokki restaurant, â€˜shinjeon tteobokki(ì‹ ì „ë–¡ë³¶ì´)â€™.
They are selling that fried fish cake, and it taste amazing. If you donâ€™t like fish cake, than I really recommend to try this. It will change your mind (I hope..)!
My cabbage was very sweet, so it was perfect to add 5Tbsp of sugar.
But if you donâ€™t like vegetables or cabbage, add 6Tbsp of sugar will be fine.

Avocado salad is inspired by McDonaldâ€™s. 
They donâ€™t sell salads in Korea, so in Winter Olympic, it was my first try to eat salad in McDonald's.
It was really simple ingredients but taste just really great. So I thought I need to share with my viewers!(And of course, I make this A LOT)

Iâ€™ll come back in June(or end of May) with what I ate in May!
I hope you liked this video! :)

1. Put egg whites in a bowl and whip. When the egg white starts to foam, add sugar divided into 3 times while whipping. Whisk until the meringue turns shiny and doesnâ€™t fell off when you turn upside down the bowl.

Fig ade : fig syrup, ice, lemon, fig, sparkling water, thyme(herb)
Peach latte : homemade canned peach, ice, milk(+milk foam)
Fig yogurt : homemade granola(video will upload soon!), yogurt, fig, diced apple, thyme(herb)

+To make a fruit syrup
-Fast : Cut the fruits into small sizes. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide, etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar, and a splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small sizes. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

snippet.title: Home Cafe Januaryâ˜•ï¸ Pink Hot Chocolate, Strawberry Apple Tea, Chocolate Latte | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey again :)
For first month of 2019, I made pink hot chocolate, strawberry apple tea and chocolate latte.
You guys may know, I made chocolate latte a lot.
For make choc latte, you need chocolate syrup. If the reason why you go to cafe is for grab a choc latte, stop buying it.
You can make chocolate latte at home!
It taste like same as store bought oneğŸ˜†
If you want to see how to make, check out monthly home cafe Septemberâ€™s description box! (http://bit.ly/2OggssW)
Itâ€™s my go-to recipe! Please try it ğŸ˜Š
Strawberry apple tea is literally â€™strawberry appleâ€™ tea.
I used strawberry apple syrup, which I made, and some hot water.
You can use hot water like me, but using fruit flavored tea also good! Itâ€™ll get more fruity flavor. Or you can use soda water etc.
For make strawberry apple syrup, check out how to make fruit syrup down below ğŸ™‚
I love pink or red-ish color on foods, so I made pink hot chocolate!
Actually it made with plain white chocolate. I just add some red food coloring in it.
You can use strawberry flavored pink chocolate, but I used white chocolate because I like its own white choc flavor.
To make this, simmer with white chocolate, red food coloring and milk on the pot.
I donâ€™t have specific measurement, because you know, sometimes craving more sweet, but sometimes itâ€™s not.ğŸ˜‚
On top of drink, I put some shredded pink chocolate. Of course, you donâ€™t have to. You can put some lightly whipped cream if you want, but for me, Iâ€™m not fan of put whipped cream on white hot chocolate.ğŸ˜‚

Hope you like this video,
And happy lunar new year! :)

ğŸŒ™Menu
+Chocolate latte
Ice, chocolate syrup, milk, strong coffee, lightly whipped cream(with sugar)
+Strawberry apple tea
Preserved strawberry & apple syrup, hot water, rosemary
+Pink hot chocolate
White chocolate, red food coloring, milk, shredded pink chocolate

+To make fruit syrup
-Shortcut : Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar, and a splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

snippet.title: Singapore Chilli Crab ğŸŒ¶ğŸ¦€ ì‹±ê°€í¬ë¥´ ì¹ ë¦¬í¬ë© | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey :) Todayâ€™s recipe is Singapore Chilli Crab.

In this recipe, i used store-bought chilli crab paste, brand â€˜prima tasteâ€™. In Korea, you can find quite easily in any grocery store. Or if you go to Singapore, itâ€™s in everywhere! (i think)

I didnâ€™t follow the instruction perfectly, but it was really goodğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ Of course, eat chilli crab in Singpore is best option. But like me, who miss the taste of Singapore, you will love this!
I used blue crab and shrimp for this. Blue crab is the easiest crab to find in Korea. If i can found big one, i would use thatğŸ˜­

In the instructions, they used peanut oil. But i didnâ€™t have it and couldnâ€™t found easily, so I used just plain normal veggie oil. And it turns out great!

And with this chilli crab, i ate whit spring onion-egg fired rice, which you can find easily in Chinese cuisine (or some other countries nearby).
For make this, put a veggie oil in a pan on medium-high heat. and put the chopped spring onion and garlic. Frying for about minute or so. and put the cooked rice and frying again. Season with salt and pepper.


**Some might be â€˜what the hackâ€™ that what i did to the crabâ€¦ğŸ˜‚
Actually, it was my first time to cut the crab. I knew i was wrong while is eating thisğŸ˜… But good thing is I can eat the fried rice in that crab shell better than clean cutting one!
But i think i have to make another video with crab, because now i know how to cut crabsğŸ˜‚

ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o

âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
âœ¨ I'm not native English speaker, sorry for my bad English description.
âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!
 

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
vegetable oil
2 crabs
5~6 shrimps
470ml water
chilli crab paste
chilli crab premix
30ml water, for chilli crab premix
2 eggs, lightly beaten
coriander leaves

prima taste - Singapore Chilli Crab

1. In a pan, drizzle the vegetable oil and put crabs and shrimps. Cover the lid and cook for about 2~3min on a medium to high heat, until crabs and shrimps are cooked. When itâ€™s cooked, transfer the seafoods to the another bowl
2. Put the chilli crab sauce on a pan and mix on a medium heat. And put the seafoods again and mix well. Pour the water and cover the lid, until water is boiling..
3. Mix the chilli crab premix with water and pour onto the pan. Mix nicely.
4. Beat the egg and pour the eggs. Mix again and remove form heat. Serve with coriander leaves.

snippet.title: Salty Crackers with Cheese : Christmas Party Food | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello itâ€™s Hailey :)
This time, I made salty cracker, which perfect for Christmas party.
In holiday season, you may drink tons of wine(or juice lol) with friends or family.
The cheese platter is a great match for wine. So hope you enjoy this recipe.

In this video, I used camembert, brie and some semi-hard cheese(canâ€™t remember what the name isğŸ˜…).
All three of them were delicious with the crackers!!

For make this, it took less then 30 min, and you can keep the dough in the fridge for about 1 week or so. So how about make salty cracker for home partyğŸ˜†

âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!
 

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
87g(2/3cup minus 1Tbsp) all-purpose flour
1/2Tbsp(7g) sugar
2g(1/4tsp) salt
23g(1 1/2Tbsp) unsalted butter
40ml(8tsp) water
 
Before you make : preheat the oven 400F / 200C
1. Using food processor, blend with flour, sugar, salt and unsalted butter.. Add  water blend again.
2. Divide it into 2 sized pieces and roll the dough as thin as you can.

snippet.description:
For this what i ate in October video, I made peanut butter banana toast, apple toast and corn cheese toast.
Not only Korean, also many of other people take picture for IG. 
If you following my IG, you may know Iâ€™m one of that people.
I wanna take pic more like instagramy, but always blame my cursed hands.ğŸ˜‚

Anyways, this recipes are also taste really good.
In this time, I didnâ€™t add instructions in down below. Because i think it is really easy and you can follow easily if you watch the video.

My love, peanut butter with banana. You donâ€™t need any heats for this recipe. For ice cream, I used chestnut flavored ice cream. But I think that ice cream is more goes well with apple toast. I recommend chocolate or vanilla flavor!

I didnâ€™t know because originally, cheese is from western. But 'corn cheeseâ€™ is more like Korean-ish food. 
Almost original way to make corn cheese is not using whole grain mustard. But using mustard, it gets not too much cheesy taste i would say.
So, if you have it, use it. If you don't, itâ€™s totally fine to not use.

In this time, I made salmon natto rice bowl & salmon salad, which perfect for fall.

snippet.title: Haileyâ€™s Monthly Cafeâ˜•ï¸September : Einspanner, Ice Chocolate Latte, Vanilla Americano | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, Itâ€™s Hailey again :)
In September, I made einspanner, ice chocolate latte and vanilla ice americano.

I made einspanner with warm-hot coffee, so it feels like perfect to drink in fall.
For make whipped cream, i used 80ml(1/3cup) heavy cream, 5g(1tsp) suagr, and dash of rum.
Using rum or whisky to make whipped cream makes more tastier.
I don't know any other countries drinks einspanner much like korea, but famous cafe for about einspanner in korea, i think most of cafes are using liquor to make whipped cream.
Liquor really makes more better! Hope you really try it.

I made latte with chocolate syrup. 
For make chocolate syrup, mix water 1 : sugar 1 : cocoa powder 0.7 ratio and microwave 40 sec, and it turned out so well. You donâ€™t need to buy chocolate syrup anymore.

Vanilla ice americano is sooo much huge right? ğŸ˜‚
This month, I had so much work to do. So I almost slept 3~4 hours per a day for about week or so. This coffee was lifesaver to meğŸ˜­
For make vanilla syrup, add 160ml(2/3cup), 100g(1/2cup) sugar, and 1/2 to 1 vanilla bean into the pan and boil until all sugar is melted. Store in fridge until use. 

Hope you have a great October, and Iâ€™ll see you in next video :)

1. Add instant dry yeast and sugar to warm milk, stir, and soak for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, glutinous rice powder, salt and milk-yeast mixture, and vegetable oil and hand knead for 13~15 minutes. Knead the dough until smooth. Cover it with a wrap, and let it rise at room temperature for 2 hours.
3. After dividing the dough by 50~60g, and make a the dough into the ball shape while holding the subdivided dough by palm and attaching the hand blade to the floor. Let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
4. Roll the dough into the long string (25~30cm, 10~11inches). Gently hold both ends of the dough with your palms, and push both ends in opposite directions. Hold both ends of the dough and put the dough up to make a twisted shape. Pinching both ends so as not to loosen the shape of the donuts.
5. Let the dough rise at room temperature for about 1 hour.
6. Heat the oil to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit) and fry until the color of the donuts turns golden brown. Cool the finished donut in a cooling rack.

-Castella Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Finely powder the castella with a sieve.
2. After applying strawberry jam or raspberry jam to the donut, apply castella powder to finish.

-Sugar Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Mix sugar and cinnamon powder.
2. Roll the donuts in sugar cinnamon mixture to finish.

/ INSTRUCTIONS ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë²• /
-ë¸Œë¦¬ì˜¤ìŠˆ ë„ë„›
1. Put warm water, instant yeast, and sugar in a cup, mix well, and let it sit for 10 minutes. Prepare lemon zest by grate the lemon.
2. Put the bread flour, egg, salt, and yeast mixture together in a bowl. Knead by hand for 2~3 minutes and clump them together, but until there is a little flour left. Add butter and hand knead for 17~20 minutes until the dough is soft and shiny (especially in winter, it needs to be kneaded longer). If kneading for more than 15 minutes continues but still sticky, add 1 teaspoon of flour at a time and knead until soft and shiny. Cover it and let it rise in the refrigerator for 12~18 hours, or in a warm place for 2 hours.
*Note: It's okay to use a stand mixer
3. Punch down to remove air bubbles from the dough, divide the dough into 70g(2.4oz, about 11 pieces). Put the dough on the table and round it with your wrists and fingertips on the table. Make a ball of all the remaining dough.
4. Spread out the rounded dough into a flat circle shape using your palm or a rolling pin. Let them rise the dough at room temperature for about 2 hours.
5. Put cooking oil on medium-low heat until 180~190 Degrees Celsius(355~375 Degrees Fahrenheit) for 5-6 minutes. When the temperature is reached, reduce to low heat and fry the donuts. Fry each side for 1 minute and 30 seconds to 2 minutes until golden brown. Cool the fried donuts on a cooling rack.

1. In a bowl or cup, add soft flour, sugar, vanilla extract, egg yolk, and matcha powder. Mix well. If it is too thick, pour in milk little by little and mix until it is no lumps.
2. Heat the remaining milk over low heat. When the outer part of the pot starts to boil, remove it from the heat.
3. Pour the milk into the egg yolk mixture. Continue stirring while pouring the milk. Transfer it back to the pot and put it on low heat. Mix well and cook for 6 to 8 minutes until the custard cream is thickened.
4. When the cream becomes thick, take it off the heat, then add unsalted butter and mix well. Cover the custard cream with plastic wrap. Make sure the surface of the custard cream touches the wrap. Otherwise, the outer part will be getting harden. Let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
5. Whisk the whipped cream and sugar until stiff peak. Then add cold custard cream and mix lightly. Transfer it to a piping bag.

1. In a bowl, put bread flour, sugar, salt, instant yeast, eggs, and warm water. 
Knead for 2~3 min, it came out one dough but a little bit of flour is still left, Add butter, and knead again until the dough is smooth and shiny, for 17~20min. (Especially in wintertime). Wrap the dough, and leave it for 1hour~1hour half min in a warm place.
*note : you can use a stand mixer to make.
2. Punch down the dough to release the air, and divide the dough into 50g(1.7oz, 12 donuts). To shape into balls, place the ball on the work surface and rest the side of your hand next to it so your palm and fingers are cupped around it. Do the same process on the rest of the dough.

And add condensed milk, and whip until it gets a stiff peak. Transfer into the piping bag and store it in the fridge until use.
5. Heat the cooking oil, about 180-200C / 365~400F, about 6m in medium-low heat. When the oil reaches that heat, turn the heat to low. Frying them until getting golden brown, I fried for 1min 30sec~2min for each side. After frying, chill in a cooling rack. 
7. With a knife, slice the donut in half but leave the edge of the donut. Fill the cream with a spatula or spoon. Sprinkle some icing sugar to finish.

snippet.title: Raspberry Cream Donuts Recipe ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ í¬ë¦¼ ë„ë„› | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
*donuts (12 donuts)
ë”°ëœ»í•œ ë¬¼ 75g(1/3cup minus 1tsp) lukewarm water
ê°•ë ¥ë¶„ 350g(2 3/4cup plus 1Tbsp) bread flour
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2Tbsp) sugar
ì†Œê¸ˆ 5g(1/2tsp) salt
ì¸ìŠ¤í„´íŠ¸ ì´ìŠ¤íŠ¸ 4g(1tsp) instant yeast
ê³„ë€ 2 eggs
ë§ë‘í•œ ìƒíƒœì˜ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 65g(4 1/2Tbsp) unsalted butter(softened)

*raspberry cream (for 6 donuts)
ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬(ì‚°ë”¸ê¸°) ì¼ í˜¹ì€ í“¨ë ˆ 90g(6T) raspberry jam or puree
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 320g(1 1/4cups) heavy cream
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2T) sugar

ì„¤íƒ• (90g)6T sugar
ì¥ì‹ìš© ëƒ‰ë™ í˜¹ì€ ìƒ ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ Extra fresh or frozen raspberry for decor

ì‹ìš©ìœ  Cooking oil


1. In a bowl, put bread flour, sugar, salt, instant yeast, eggs, and lukewarm water. Using a stand mixer, knead in medium-low speed, until it came out in one dough, about 2 min.
2. While set at low speed, add softened unsalted butter, 15g(1Tbsp) at a time. When all butter is combined, set to medium speed, until dough is smooth and shiny, about 12-15min using stand mixer. Wrap the bowl, and let it rise for 1-2 hours until double in size. 
*note: if you donâ€™t have a stand mixer, you can make by your hand :)
3. Punch down the dough to release the air, and divide the dough into 50g(1.7oz, 12 donuts). To shape into balls, place ball on the work surface and rest the side of your hand next to it so your palm and fingers are cupped around it. Do the same process on the rest of the dough.
4. Roll out the ball-shaped doughs into a flat round shape. Place onto the 11.5cm(4.5inch) square parchment paper. Let it rise for 2 hours in room temp.
5. While doughs getting rise, weâ€™re gonna prepare raspberry cream. Place heavy cream, sugar, and raspberry jam into the bowl, and whip until it gets stiff peak, about 3-4min. Transfer into the piping bag and store it in the fridge until use.
6. Heat the cooking oil, about 180-200C / 365~400F, about 6m in medium-low heat. When oil reach on that heat, turn the heat to low. Frying them until getting golden brown, I fried for 1min 30sec~2min for each side. After frying, chill in a cooling rack. After that, roll the donuts in sugar. 
7. With a chopstick or reusable straw, etc.. make a hole to give some space for raspberry cream. And Fill the donuts with raspberry cream, which made earlier. Decorate with raspberry to each donut.

snippet.title: Raspberry Cream Donuts Recipe ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ í¬ë¦¼ ë„ë„› | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
*donuts (12 donuts)
ë”°ëœ»í•œ ë¬¼ 75g(1/3cup minus 1tsp) lukewarm water
ê°•ë ¥ë¶„ 350g(2 3/4cup plus 1Tbsp) bread flour
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2Tbsp) sugar
ì†Œê¸ˆ 5g(1/2tsp) salt
ì¸ìŠ¤í„´íŠ¸ ì´ìŠ¤íŠ¸ 4g(1tsp) instant yeast
ê³„ë€ 2 eggs
ë§ë‘í•œ ìƒíƒœì˜ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 65g(4 1/2Tbsp) unsalted butter(softened)

*raspberry cream (for 6 donuts)
ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬(ì‚°ë”¸ê¸°) ì¼ í˜¹ì€ í“¨ë ˆ 90g(6T) raspberry jam or puree
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 320g(1 1/4cups) heavy cream
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2T) sugar

ì„¤íƒ• (90g)6T sugar
ì¥ì‹ìš© ëƒ‰ë™ í˜¹ì€ ìƒ ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ Extra fresh or frozen raspberry for decor

ì‹ìš©ìœ  Cooking oil


1. In a bowl, put bread flour, sugar, salt, instant yeast, eggs, and lukewarm water. Using a stand mixer, knead in medium-low speed, until it came out in one dough, about 2 min.
2. While set at low speed, add softened unsalted butter, 15g(1Tbsp) at a time. When all butter is combined, set to medium speed, until dough is smooth and shiny, about 12-15min using stand mixer. Wrap the bowl, and let it rise for 1-2 hours until double in size. 
*note: if you donâ€™t have a stand mixer, you can make by your hand :)
3. Punch down the dough to release the air, and divide the dough into 50g(1.7oz, 12 donuts). To shape into balls, place ball on the work surface and rest the side of your hand next to it so your palm and fingers are cupped around it. Do the same process on the rest of the dough.
4. Roll out the ball-shaped doughs into a flat round shape. Place onto the 11.5cm(4.5inch) square parchment paper. Let it rise for 2 hours in room temp.
5. While doughs getting rise, weâ€™re gonna prepare raspberry cream. Place heavy cream, sugar, and raspberry jam into the bowl, and whip until it gets stiff peak, about 3-4min. Transfer into the piping bag and store it in the fridge until use.
6. Heat the cooking oil, about 180-200C / 365~400F, about 6m in medium-low heat. When oil reach on that heat, turn the heat to low. Frying them until getting golden brown, I fried for 1min 30sec~2min for each side. After frying, chill in a cooling rack. After that, roll the donuts in sugar. 
7. With a chopstick or reusable straw, etc.. make a hole to give some space for raspberry cream. And Fill the donuts with raspberry cream, which made earlier. Decorate with raspberry to each donut.

snippet.title: Korean Mozzarella Cheese Ball from scratch : No Bake Recipe í™ˆë©”ì´ë“œ ëª¨ì§œë ë¼ ì¹˜ì¦ˆë³¼ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers! Todayâ€™s recipe is Korean Mozzarella Cheese Ball from scratch.
Itâ€™s crunchy and chewy outside, warm and flavorful cheese inside of it.

You can see cheese ball, especially from BHC(the chicken restaurant in Korea) in lots of mukbang.
In Korea, people are making a copycat of that with selling glutinous-doughnut pre-mix.
But because of it's product form Korea, so If you are not live in here, it's hard to find. So I thought why not show you guys how to make cheese ball without pre-mix!
Itâ€™s not perfectly same taste and texture, mine is more crunchy texture than BHC one.

For water, I wrote 60~80ml. Amount of water is really making difference with what brand of glutinous flour is, and what atmosphere you make.
If your dough is too dry, itâ€™s hard to roll the dough with mozzarella cheese. It easily breaks apart. 
And If itâ€™s too wet, It has another problem. 
The dough has to be like babyâ€™s buttâ€¦ you know? ğŸ˜­
I canâ€™t fully explain about it, but it has to be moist like proper bread dough!

Another important ingredient is salt. 
Glutinous flour is not like normal wheat flour(I mean, bread flour, all-purpose flour etcâ€¦).
It REALLY NEEDS SALT.
If you donâ€™t add it, it tastes like nothing. No taste at all ğŸ˜‚

I added only mozzarella cheese, but with adding little bit of cream cheese, it will better.
Mozzarella cheese can substitute with string cheese :)


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(No Flour! Red Velvet Cheese Brownie) : http://bit.ly/2Xh4DbW
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
âœ¨ I'm not a native English speaker, sorry for my bad English description.
âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!

 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients
100g(2/3cup) glutinous flour
25g(2 1/2Tbsp) all-purpose flour
2g(1/4tsp) salt
15g(1Tbsp) sugar
0.5g(1/8tsp) baking powder
15g(1Tbsp) unsalted butter
60~80ml(1/3~1/4cup) hot water

Mozzarella cheese

1. In a bowl, mix well with adding glutinous flour, all-purpose flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder.
2. Add little amount of hot water and mix. If it gets crumbly, add butter and mix with your hand (not knead, really)
3. Add water and mix until it clumps into a dough. And rest the dough for about 30 min.
4. Cut the mozzarella cheese into a cube shape.
5. Divide the dough for about 20~25g (1 heaping Tbsp) and roll with mozzarella cube.
6. Put the oil 160~170C / 320~340F and frying for about 7~8min, until golden brown.

5. ê¼¬ì¹˜ë‚˜ ì´ì‘¤ì‹œê°œ ë“±ì„ ì´ìš©í•´ ìœ—ë©´ì— ëª¨ì–‘ì„ ë‚¸ë‹¤.
6. ì˜ˆì—´í•œ ì˜¤ë¸ì—ì„œ 30ë¶„~35ë¶„ê°„ ìœ—ë©´ì´ ë…¸ë¦‡í•´ì§ˆ ë•Œ ê¹Œì§€ êµ½ëŠ”ë‹¤. (êµ¬ì›€ìƒ‰ì´ ë§ì´ ë‚˜ë©´ ê°ˆë ˆíŠ¸ ë° ë£¨ì•„ ìœ„ì— í˜¸ì¼ ë“±ìœ¼ë¡œ ë®ì–´ êµ½ëŠ”ë‹¤.


âœ¨Making puff pastry:
1. Cut the cold butter into cubes.
2. Put all-purpose flour, salt and butter in a bowl and mix with a scraper as like cutting butter.
3. Add water little by little and knead the dough into one lump. Add water, adjusting it just enough to make it clump together.
4. Divide the finished dough in half (optional), then wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5. Sprinkle flour on the rested dough, and then spread the dough into a rectangular shape. Fold the dough into thirds and rest in the fridge for 20 minutes (repeat 3 times in total).

âœ¨Making almond cream:
1. Put room temperature unsalted butter in a bowl and loosen it. Add sugar and mix, then add eggs and mix again. Add almond powder and mix gently. Put the finished almond cream in a piping bag.

âœ¨Making galette de rois:
1. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Spread puff pastry thinly (2-4mm). Cut the dough using an 18cm round mold.
3. Squeeze the almond cream, leaving about 1cm of the edge of the puff pastry. Brush the edges with egg yolk, then cover with another puff pastry.
4. Use a butter knife to shape the edges of the galette de rois. Coat the top with egg yolk. Leave for 1~2min to harden.
5. Use a skewer or toothpick to shape the top.
6. Bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes until the top is golden. (If the color is too burnt, cover the galette de rois with foil, etc., and bake.

1. Put the all purpose flour, salt, and cold unsalted butter in the food processor and blend until the butter is fully blended. Add water little by little, and blend until it clumps together. Donâ€™t add all the water at once.
(Please check out this video for how to make pastry dough by hand (https://bit.ly/39ZAKow))
2. Lightly sprinkle with flour and roll out to a rectangle. Fold the dough into thirds and let it rest in the refrigerator for 10~15 minutes.
3. Take the dough out of the fridge, roll out into a rectangle, and fold it into thirds. Repeat the process once more.
4. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Roll out the pastry dough into 1cm (0.4 inch). Cut it into a rectangular shape, and then poke a hole with fork in the place where the jam will be placed. Spread strawberry or raspberry jam. Bake for 35-40 minutes in a preheated oven to finish.

1. Chop the cold unsalted butter.
2. Add all-purpose flour, salt, and butter to the food processor and blend for about 30 seconds.
3. Add water little by little and turn the food processor until it clumps together. Do not add all the water, just add it to until it clumps. Wrap it, and refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes.
4. Take the dough out of the fridge, sprinkle lightly with flour, and roll out with a rolling pin to make a rectangle. Fold the bottom and top short ends of your dough towards the center of the rectangle. Top ends should be shorter than bottom. Fold the top half over onto the bottom half, so you have 4 layers of dough in a thick square, wrap it and refrigerate for 20min.
5. When it's came out of the fridge, give it a 90-degree turn, and flatten the dough into a rectangle. Fold the dough into thirds, like a letter, then let it rest in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Repeat this process one more time (a total of 2 times). When it is final fold, let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

1. In a saucepan, put sugar, water, and cinnamon stick, and bring it on to medium-low heat. When it starts to boil, let it boil for another 1 min and remove it from the heat. Leave it at room temp until use(cinnamon syrup).
2. In another pan, put 260ml(1cup plus 4tsp) of milk, and simmer in low heat until the edge starts to boil. Put 40ml(2 1/2Tbsp) of milk and all-purpose flour into the bowl, and mix until well combined. Stream the hot milk into the milk-flour mixture while mixing. And pour the cinnamon syrup in it and mix. Leave for 5~10 min until itâ€™s warm, not hot.
3. When the milk mixture is getting slightly cooled down, add egg yolks, and mix well. Strain the mixture before use.

1. Preheat the oven to 230 Degrees Celsius(450 Degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Roll out the puff pastry from the refrigerator into a 0.4-0.5 cm(about 0.2 inches) thick rectangle. Roll the dough into a cylinder shape and cut it into 12 equal parts.
3. Put the cut puff pastry in the muffin mold and spread the dough to an even thickness.
4. Fill the muffin pan with 2 tablespoons of custard cream, then bake in a preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes until dark burnt spots appear.

/ INGREDIENTS & METHODS /
-1 croquembouche

*Double the recipe to make tall croquembouche

*ìŠˆ / í¼í”„ í˜ì´ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¦¬ Puff / Choux pastry

*ì»¤ìŠ¤í„°ë“œ í¬ë¦¼ Custard Cream

*Puff / Choux pastry
1. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius(375 Fahrenheit). Line the baking tray with parchment paper.
2. Put unsalted butter, salt, sugar, and water in a pot. Turn the heat to medium, and melt the butter. When butter is melted, remove from the heat, add cake flour. Mix until well combined.
3. In medium heat, gently cook the dough. Stir for 4~5min to evenly cooked. Once it came out in one dough, remove it from the heat. And transfer into the bowl to chill faster. Chill for 3~5min in room temp.
4. Crack the eggs in a cup or bowl, and gently whisk. Slowly add the beaten eggs into the cooked dough, and mix. The choux pastry will smooth, shiny, and kinda thick texture. Transfer into the piping bag.
5. Pipe the batter onto the baking tray with parchment paper on. Each of the choux pastry should 3 inches apart, at least. Spraying the water over the choux pastry. Press down the pointy part of the choux pastry. Bake in the preheated oven for 20min. Donâ€™t open it while still bake.

5. ë°˜ì£½ì„ ìœ ì‚°ì§€ ìœ„ì— ì§œì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê° ìŠˆì˜ ìµœì†Œ 6~7cm ê°„ê²©ì„ ë‘ê³  ì§œì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ìŠˆì˜ ìœ—ë©´ì— ë¬¼ì„ ë¿Œë ¤ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ë¾°ì¡±í•œ ëª¨ì–‘ì´ ìˆìœ¼ë©´ ì†ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°€ë³ê²Œ ë‹¤ë“¬ì–´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆì—´í•œ ì˜¤ë¸ì— 20ë¶„ê°„ êµ¬ì›Œì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ì ˆëŒ€ êµ½ëŠ” ì¤‘ì—ëŠ” ì˜¤ë¸ì„ ì—´ì§€ ë§ˆì„¸ìš”.


*Custard Cream
1. In a bowl or cup, mix cake flour, sugar, vanilla extract, and egg yolks. Mix until well combined.
2. Simmer the milk on low heat. When it starts to boil on edge of the pot, remove it from the heat.
3. Pour the hot milk into the egg yolk mixture. Whisk gently while pouring the milk. Transfer it into the pot, and turn the heat to low. Cook for 6~8min, until the custard cream is thickened.
4. When itâ€™s thickened, turn off the heat and add unsalted butter. Mix to well combined. Wrap the custard cream, the wrap should touch the surface of the custard cream. If not, the custard cream gets harden. Chill it in the fridge, at least 2 hours.
5. Whip the heavy cream with 15g sugar, until it gets a stiff peak. And add chilled custard cream, and mix lightly. Transfer into the piping bag.

5. ìƒí¬ë¦¼ê³¼ ì„¤íƒ•ì„ ë‹¨ë‹¨í•œ ë¿”ì´ ìƒê¸¸ ë•Œê¹Œì§€ íœ˜í•‘ í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ì°¨ê°€ìš´ ì»¤ìŠ¤í„°ë“œ í¬ë¦¼ì„ ë„£ê³  ê°€ë³ê²Œ ì„ì–´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì§¤ì£¼ë¨¸ë‹ˆì— ì˜®ê²¨ë‹´ì•„ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤.


*Assembly

1. Chop the cold unsalted butter.
2. In a bowl, put all-purpose flour, salt, and butter, mix all together. Using a scraper, mix like cutting butter until it is pea-sized. 
3. Add water, little at a time, knead until came out one dough. Donâ€™t add water at once, add until just combined. Refrigerate for 30 min.
4. When itâ€™s come out of the fridge, lightly dust with flour, and roll into a rectangle shape. Fold in thirds, like a letter. Refrigerate for 10~15min. Repeat this process two times more (3 times in total). In the last fold, refrigerate up to 20 min.

1. Peel off the apple, and chop finely.
2. In a pot, melt the unsalted butter on medium heat. When butter is completely melted, put chopped apples, and stir for 2 min. Add light brown sugar and cinnamon stick, mix and stir for an additional 2 min. Save 1/8cup of apple juice for later.
3. In water, put starch and mix. Put the starch mixture into the apple mixture, and stir for 2 min until water is dissolved. Turn off the heat, and let it cool until use.

1. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius(400 Fahrenheit). In a bowl, mix egg and water.
2. Roll the chilled dough for about 0.5cm (0.2inch). And cut it in a round shape with a round cookie cutter or mug. Roll the dough a bit to make an oval shape.
3. Put 1~2tsp of apple filling on the middle of the dough. Water the edge of the dough, and fold in half. Press a bit to prevent leaking. 
4. Using chopstick or skewer, make 2~3 holes. Brush the egg wash, and bake for 20~25min in a preheated oven.
5. After bake, brush the saved apple syrup on top of the apple turnover.

ğŸ§¡Custard Cream
ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Recipe : [https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY](https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY)

ğŸ§¡Cookies for Cookie Choux
1. Put sugar, room temp unsalted butter, and cake flour in a bowl and mix with a spatula until the flour is no longer visible.
2. Put the dough on a silicone mat or parchment paper, and cover it with plastic or parchment paper.
3. Roll out to 0.3cm thickness using a rolling pin and refrigerate for 30 min.
4. After refrigeration, cut with a 5cm circular cutter.

ğŸ§¡Choux(Puff Pastry) for Cookie Choux
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put milk, water, salt, sugar, and unsalted butter in a saucepan and heat over low heat until the butter is completely melted.
3. When the butter is all melted, turn off the heat and add cake flour. Mix with a spatula until no more flour is visible.
4. Put back on low heat and mix with a spatula until the dough becomes a smooth lump.
5. Remove the dough from the heat, then transfer to a bowl. Allow the dough to cool at room temperature for 5~8 min.
6. Add eggs little by little and mix until the texture is thick. Transfer the batter to a piping bag.
7. Squeeze into 4-5cm size on parchment paper. Place cookie dough on top of it.
8. Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes until the top turns golden brown. Cool the finished cookie choux on a cooling rack.

ğŸ§¡Assembly
1. Prepare strawberries by washing them and removing the stems.
2. Cut 1/3 of the cookie choux top part using a bread knife.
3. Squeeze some custard cream inside the cookie choux and put strawberry on top. Then, completely fill the inside of the cookie choux with custard cream. Cover the cut cookie choux lid.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
50g(3 1/2tbsp) unsalted butter

Pinch of salt

2 eggs

-option
Melted dark chocolate
Melted white chocolate
Melted pink(strawberry flavor) chocolate

Before you make : Preheat the oven to 180C / 355F
1. In a pot, put water, salt, and unsalted butter. Melt the butter in low heat.
2. When the butter is all melted, remove from the heat. Add rice flour and mix.
3. Place back to the stove, and mix in low heat. When butter comes out from the dough, itâ€™s time to remove the heat.
4. Add eggs, one at a time, mix until smooth.
5. Transfer the batter into a piping bag. Squeeze the batter on a baking sheet, about 5cm(2inch) round shape. Bake for 30~35min. While it is bake, donâ€™t open the oven.
6. In a bowl, put heavy cream, black sesame paste, and sugar. Mix until it gets a stiff peak. Transfer into the piping bag.
7. Slice the top of the puff, on that, decorate with chocolate. (I tried to make into the Halloween-ish design, but it failed.) And fill the puff with black sesame cream. Place the top of the puff and finish.

snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey :)
Todayâ€™s recipe is cream puff with strawberry inside. 

Cream puff with full of strawberry flavor inside, it tastes like heaven. 
You can make the strawberry compote with a fresh one, but like me, you can use frozen one.
So you can enjoy this recipe throughout the year!

Cream puff is though to make one. You have to through lots of processes,, Iâ€™m a kinda lazy person but I love my recipe(lol) so I make them a lot.

And with this cream puff recipe, I never failed with that. So hope you make it well ğŸ˜†
If you think this recipe is too hard to make, you can skip the â€˜whipped creamâ€™. 
I hope you like this recipe! Itâ€™s one of the best recipes in 2019 :)

âœ¨ I'm not a native English speaker, sorry for my bad English description.
âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!
 

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
Pate sucree(â€˜cookie partâ€™ of cream puff) : 70g(5Tbsp) unsalted butter, 70g(1/3cup) white sugar, 70g(1/2cup) pastry flour

cream puff : 45g(3Tbsp plus 1tsp) unsalted butter, 60g(1/4cup) milk, 60g(1/4cup) water, 2g(1/4tsp) salt, 5g(1tsp) white sugar, 70g(1/2cup) pastry flour, 2 eggs

Strawberry compote : 200g(7oz) strawberries, 50g(1/4cup) sugar, 5g(1tsp) vanilla extract, 15g(1Tbsp) lemon juice

Strawberry cream : 1/2 of strawberry compote, 120g(1/2cup) heavy cream, 1 gelatin sheet

Whipped cream : 80g(1/4cup) heavy cream, 3g(1/2tsp) vanilla extract, 8g(1Tbsp) icing sugar

*ë§Œë“¤ê¸° ì „ : ë²„í„°ëŠ” ì‹¤ì˜¨ì— ë³´ê´€í•˜ì—¬ ë¶€ë“œëŸ¬ìš´ ìƒíƒœë¡œ ì¤€ë¹„í•´ ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê³„ë€ì€ ì‹¤ì˜¨ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¤€ë¹„í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤.
1. Pate sucree(â€˜cookie partâ€™ of cream puff)
 In a bowl, whisk the unsalted butter. Add sugar and pastry flour, mix until well combined. Keep the dough in the fridge at least 2 hours. After chill, roll the dough to less than 0.1~0.2 inch( and freeze for about 15 min.

2. Cream puff
 In a pan, put water, milk, salt, sugar, and butter. Put it in low heat and stir until all butter is melted. 
 Add pastry flour and mix until combined into one dough.
 When it gets smooth and shiny texture, turn off the heat and transfer into another bowl.
 Add eggs small amount at a time and mix.

3. Bake cookie choux
 Put the cream puff dough into the piping bag, and make the 6~7 cream puff. 
 Cut the â€˜pate sucreeâ€™ into a round shape and put it over the top of cream puff dough.
 Bake 180C / 355F to 30~35, until it gets golden brown. When it comes out into the oven, put onto the cooling rack until chilled enough. 

4. Strawberry compote
 In a pan, put strawberry, sugar, vanilla extract and lemon juice on a medium to low heat. Mix about 4~5 minutes, until moist comes out. 
 After remove from the heat, blend roughly using a food processor.
 Put half of the compote in the piping bag, and fridge until use.

5. Strawberry cream
 Whip the heavy cream and mix with half of the compote. Transfer into the piping bag.

5. Whipped cream
 In a bowl, put heavy cream, vanilla extract and icing sugar, mix until it gets a stiff peak.

6. Assemble strawberry cookie chow
 Bottom of cookie choux, make a hole with a chopstick or anything long and sharp thing and pipe the strawberry compote through the hole just a little bit. Rest of the part is filled with strawberry cream. 
 On top of cookie choux, pipe the whipped cream and finish with a halved strawberry.

2. í‘¸ë”© ìš©ê¸°ì— ìº¬ë¼ë©œ ì‹œëŸ½ì„ ë¶€ì–´ì¤€ë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  í‘¸ë”© í˜¼í•©ë¬¼ì„ ë§Œë“¤ê¸° ì „ ê¹Œì§€ ëƒ‰ì¥ê³ ì— ë„£ì–´ ë³´ê´€í•œë‹¤.
3. ìš°ìœ , ì„¤íƒ•, ë°”ë‹ë¼ë¹ˆì„ ëƒ„ë¹„ì— ë„£ê³  ì•½ë¶ˆì—ì„œ ìš°ìœ ì˜ ê°€ì¥ìë¦¬ê°€ ì‚´ì§ ë“ì„ ë•Œê¹Œì§€ ë“ì¸ë‹¤.
4. ê³„ë€ 2ê°œë¥¼ ë³¼ì— ë„£ê³ , ê±°í’ˆê¸°ë¡œ ì˜ í’€ì–´ì¤€ë‹¤. ë“ì¸ ìš°ìœ  í˜¼í•©ë¬¼ì„ ì¡°ê¸ˆì”© ë„£ì–´ê°€ë©° ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤.
5. í‘¸ë”© í˜¼í•©ë¬¼ì„ ì²´ì— ê±¸ëŸ¬ë‚¸ ë‹¤ìŒ, í‘¸ë”© ìš©ê¸°ì— ì˜®ê²¨ë‹´ëŠ”ë‹¤. ìœ—ë©´ì— ê±°í’ˆì´ ìƒê²¼ì„ ê²½ìš° ê±·ì–´ë‚¸ë‹¤.
6. í‘¸ë”© ìš©ê¸°ê°€ ì™„ì „íˆ ë“¤ì–´ê°ˆ í¬ê¸°ì˜ ëƒ„ë¹„ë¥¼ ì¤€ë¹„í•œë‹¤. ëƒ„ë¹„ ëšœê»‘ì„ ë©´ë³´ë¡œ ê°ì‹¸ ì¤€ë¹„í•œë‹¤. 
7. ëƒ„ë¹„ì— í‚¤ì¹œíƒ€ì˜¬/í–‰ì£¼/ë©´ë³´ë¥¼ ê¹”ê³ , í‘¸ë”© ìš©ê¸°ë¥¼ ë‹´ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë”°ëœ»í•œ ë¬¼(ì„­ì”¨ 50-60ë„)ì„ í‘¸ë”© ìš©ê¸°ì˜ 1/3 ë†’ì´ë§Œí¼ ì±„ìš°ê³ , ì¤‘ë¶ˆì— ì˜¬ë ¤ 12~15ë¶„ê°„ ë“ì¸ë‹¤. ë¶ˆì„ ëˆ ë‹¤ìŒ, 3~5ë¶„ê°„ ëšœê»‘ì„ ë®ì€ ì±„ë¡œ ëœ¸ ë“¤ì¸ë‹¤. 
8. ì™„ì„±ëœ í‘¸ë”©ì€ ëƒ„ë¹„ì—ì„œ êº¼ë‚´ 1ì‹œê°„ ê°€ëŸ‰ ì‹¤ì˜¨ì—ì„œ ì‹íŒ ë‹¤ìŒ, ëƒ‰ì¥ê³ ì—ì„œ 6ì‹œê°„ ì´ìƒ ì°¨ê°‘ê²Œ ì‹íŒë‹¤.

1. Put 15g (1 tbsp) of sugar and water in a pan and heat over low heat until golden brown. Do not stir the sugar at this time. When it turns golden brown~brown, turn off the heat, add 15g (1 tbsp) of water and swirl the pan well.
2. Pour caramel syrup into the pudding pan. Then put it in the refrigerator until you make the pudding mixture.
3. Put milk, sugar and vanilla bean in a pot and boil over low heat until the edges of the milk boil slightly.
4. Put 2 eggs in a bowl and beat well with a whisk. Add the boiled milk mixture little by little and mix.
5. After sieving the pudding mixture, transfer to a pudding pan. If bubbles form on the top, remove them.
6. Prepare a pot the size of which will completely fit the pudding pan. Prepare the pot by wrapping the lid of the pot with a cotton cloth.
7. Lay a kitchen towel/dishcloth/cotton cloth on the pot and place the pudding pan. Fill the pudding pan with warm water (50-60 degrees Celsius) to 1/3 the height of the pudding pan, and boil over medium heat for 12~15 minutes. Turn off the heat and simmer with the lid on for 3-5 minutes.
8. Remove the finished pudding from the pot and cool it at room temperature for about 1 hour, then cool it in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.
9. Serve with ice cream or syrup according to your taste.


ğŸµ Shades of Spring - Kevin MacLeod

1. íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ í‹€ì— ìœ ì‚°ì§€ë¥¼ ê¹ë‹¤. ì˜¤ë¸ì„ ì„­ì”¨ 175ë„(í™”ì”¨ 350ë„) ë¡œ ì˜ˆì—´í•œë‹¤.
2. ê·¸ë¦‡ì— ì‹¤ì˜¨ì˜ ë²„í„°ë¥¼ ë„£ê³  íœ˜í•‘ê¸°ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ì €ì†ì—ì„œ ê°€ë³ê²Œ í’€ì–´ì¤€ë‹¤. 
3. ì„¤íƒ•ì„ ë„£ê³  ì•½ 1ë¶„ 30ì´ˆê°„ ì¤‘ì†ìœ¼ë¡œ íœ˜í•‘í•œë‹¤. ê³„ë€ì„ í•˜ë‚˜ì”© ë„£ì–´ê°€ë©° íœ˜í•‘í•œë‹¤.
4. ë°•ë ¥ë¶„, ë² ì´í‚¹íŒŒìš°ë”ë¥¼ ì²´ì³ ë„£ê³ , ì†Œê¸ˆ, ì½”ì½”ë„›ê°€ë£¨, ì½”ì½”ë„›ë°€í¬ë¥¼ ë„£ê³  ìŠ¤íŒ¨ì¶œëŸ¬ë¡œ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë‚ ê°€ë£¨ê°€ ë³´ì´ì§€ ì•Šì„ ë•Œ ê¹Œì§€ ìŠ¤íŒ¨ì¶œëŸ¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ë– ì˜¬ë¦¬ë“¯ì´ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤.
5. ìœ ì‚°ì§€ë¥¼ ê¹ íŒ¬ì— ë°˜ì£½ì„ ë¶“ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë°˜ì£½ì€ ë³´íŠ¸ ëª¨ì–‘, Uìë¡œ ì±„ì›Œë„£ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë‚˜ì´í”„ í˜¹ì€ ì¹¼ì„ ì´ìš©í•´ ë°˜ì£½ì˜ í•œê°€ìš´ë° ì„¸ë¡œì„ ì„ ê¸‹ëŠ”ë‹¤. ì˜ˆì—´í•œ ì˜¤ë¸ì—ì„œ 45~50ë¶„ê°„ êµ½ëŠ”ë‹¤. (ì´ì‘¤ì‹œê°œë¥¼ ë°˜ì£½ì— ê½‚ì•˜ì„ ë•Œ ë°˜ì£½ì´ ë¬»ì–´ë‚˜ì§€ ì•Šì„ ë•Œ ê¹Œì§€).
6. êµ¬ìš´ íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ëŠ” ì‹¤ì˜¨ì—ì„œ ì¶©ë¶„íˆ ì‹íŒ ë‹¤ìŒ, í‹€ì—ì„œ ë¶„ë¦¬í•œë‹¤.
7. ìŠˆê°€íŒŒìš°ë”, ì½”ì½”ë„›ë°€í¬ë¥¼ ê·¸ë¦‡ì— ë„£ê³  ì˜ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤. (ì½”ì½”ë„› ì•„ì´ì‹±)
8. ì½”ì½”ë„› ì•„ì´ì‹±ì„ ì½”ì½”ë„› íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ ìœ—ë©´ì— ë°”ë¥´ê³ , ì½”ì½”ë„›ë¡±ì„ ë¿Œë¦°ë‹¤. ì²´ë¦¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ì¥ì‹í•œë‹¤.

1. Place parchment paper on the pound cake pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put room temp butter in a bowl and use a whipper to gently beat it at low speed.
3. Add sugar and whip on medium speed for about 1 min 30 sec. Add eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Sift in the cake flour, add baking powder, salt, coconut powder, and coconut milk and mix with a spatula. Use a spatula to mix until no raw flour is visible.
5. Pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper. Fill the batter into a boat-shaped, U-shape. Use a knife to draw a vertical line in the middle of the batter. Bake in a preheated oven for 45-50 minutes. (Until the dough no longer sticks when you insert a toothpick into the batter).
6. After the baked pound cake is sufficiently cooled to room temperature, remove it from the pan.
7. Put icing powder and coconut milk in a bowl and mix well. (Coconut Icing)
8. Apply coconut icing on coconut pound cake and sprinkle coconut long. Garnish with cherries.


/ MUSIC /
Running Errands - TrackTribe

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare a 15cm(6-inch) round pan with parchment paper.
2. Put white chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I stir and microwave every 30 sec - 30 sec - 20 sec)
3. When the white chocolate is completely melted, add the sifted cake flour and cheddar cheese powder and mix evenly.
4. Whip the eggs in a bowl. When the eggs start to bubble, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until ivory-colored (about 3 min 30 sec).
5. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Pour in all remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly.
6. Pour the finished batter into a pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
7. Put the white chocolate in a microwaved bowl and melt the chocolate. Add cheddar cheese powder to the melted chocolate and mix, then add room temperature heavy cream and mix evenly. Pour the finished cheddar cheese ganache over the yellow cheese gateau chocolat.
8. Put whipped cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until it gets soft peak. Put the whipped cream on top of the finished cheddar cheese gateau chocolat.

1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put unsalted butter and dark chocolate in a microwaveable bowl, and microwave until chocolate and butter are all melted.
3. Add the egg to the chocolate mixture and mix.
4. Add brown sugar and mix. Sift in the cake flour and mix evenly to complete.

- Cheesecake
1. Put the room temp cream cheese in a bowl and loosen it lightly. Add sugar and mix once more.
2. Add 1 egg and mix, then add sifted cake flour and lemon juice and mix again.
3. Add fresh cream and mix to complete.
4. Put the brownie batter on a pan lined with parchment paper and put the cheesecake batter on it to complete it.
5. Bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 min. After cooling the baked cheesecake brownie to room temperature, store it in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before eating.

ğŸ§¡Cookies for Cookie Choux
1. Put sugar, room temp unsalted butter, and cake flour in a bowl and mix with a spatula until the flour is no longer visible.
2. Put the dough on a silicone mat or parchment paper, and cover it with plastic or parchment paper.
3. Roll out to 0.3cm thickness using a rolling pin and refrigerate for 30 min.
4. After refrigeration, cut with a 5cm circular cutter.

ğŸ§¡Choux(Puff Pastry) for Cookie Choux
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put milk, water, salt, sugar, and unsalted butter in a saucepan and heat over low heat until the butter is completely melted.
3. When the butter is all melted, turn off the heat and add cake flour. Mix with a spatula until no more flour is visible.
4. Put back on low heat and mix with a spatula until the dough becomes a smooth lump.
5. Remove the dough from the heat, then transfer to a bowl. Allow the dough to cool at room temperature for 5~8 min.
6. Add eggs little by little and mix until the texture is thick. Transfer the batter to a piping bag.
7. Squeeze into 4-5cm size on parchment paper. Place cookie dough on top of it.
8. Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes until the top turns golden brown. Cool the finished cookie choux on a cooling rack.

ğŸ§¡Assembly
1. Prepare strawberries by washing them and removing the stems.
2. Cut 1/3 of the cookie choux top part using a bread knife.
3. Squeeze some custard cream inside the cookie choux and put strawberry on top. Then, completely fill the inside of the cookie choux with custard cream. Cover the cut cookie choux lid.

ğŸ‹ sponge cake
1. Prepare 2 cake pans with parchment paper or butter. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Sift the cake flour and baking powder.
2. Put soft unsalted butter in a bowl and whip until soft like mayonnaise texture.
3. Add sugar and mix. Then add the eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Add the sifted dry ingredients and milk and mix evenly.
5. Transfer the batter to each cake pan and bake in a preheated oven for 25~30 minutes until the inside is completely cooked.

ğŸ‹  lemon curd
1. Prepare zest by grinding the peel of 1 lemon that has been washed. Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the lemon juice.
2. Mix lemon zest, sugar, egg and lemon juice in a bowl.
3. Mix the lemon mixture with double boiler until it feels lumpy (about 7 minutes).
4. When it gets lumpy texture, remove from the double boiler and mix with unsalted butter.
5. Cover the finished lemon curd with cling film and refrigerate until completely cooled.

ğŸ‹ Whipped cream & finishing victoria sponge cake
1. Put heavy cream and sugar together in a bowl and whip at high speed until it gets stiff peak.
2. Flatten the top of the sponge cake.
3. Place lemon curd and whipped cream on the sponge cake, then place the sponge cake on top. On top of that, put lemon curd and whipped cream again, and put strawberries and decorative thyme (herb) on top to complete it.

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare 15cm round pan with parchment paper.
2. Sift the cake flour and cocoa powder.
3. Put dark chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I mixed every 40-30 sec I microwaved, 1000w)
4. When the chocolate is completely melted, add the cake flour and cocoa powder and mix evenly.
5. Whip the eggs in another bowl. When the eggs start to foamy, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add half of the remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until they are fluffy and get ivory-colored.
6. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Then pour the chocolate mixture over the remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly to complete.
7. Pour the batter into a round pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 27~30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
8. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until gets soft peak.
9. Put whipped cream and strawberries on top of the Gateau au chocolat.

âœ¨Making puff pastry:
1. Cut the cold butter into cubes.
2. Put all-purpose flour, salt and butter in a bowl and mix with a scraper as like cutting butter.
3. Add water little by little and knead the dough into one lump. Add water, adjusting it just enough to make it clump together.
4. Divide the finished dough in half (optional), then wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5. Sprinkle flour on the rested dough, and then spread the dough into a rectangular shape. Fold the dough into thirds and rest in the fridge for 20 minutes (repeat 3 times in total).

âœ¨Making almond cream:
1. Put room temperature unsalted butter in a bowl and loosen it. Add sugar and mix, then add eggs and mix again. Add almond powder and mix gently. Put the finished almond cream in a piping bag.

âœ¨Making galette de rois:
1. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Spread puff pastry thinly (2-4mm). Cut the dough using an 18cm round mold.
3. Squeeze the almond cream, leaving about 1cm of the edge of the puff pastry. Brush the edges with egg yolk, then cover with another puff pastry.
4. Use a butter knife to shape the edges of the galette de rois. Coat the top with egg yolk. Leave for 1~2min to harden.
5. Use a skewer or toothpick to shape the top.
6. Bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes until the top is golden. (If the color is too burnt, cover the galette de rois with foil, etc., and bake.

1. Prepare by sieving the all-purpose flour.
2. Put cream cheese and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix well.
3. Add sugar, salt, and vanilla extract and mix with a whisk.
4. Add the sifted all-purpose flour and mix with a spatula until it forms a lump, then divide the dough into two pieces and rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
5. For the filling, mix brown sugar, sugar, cinnamon powder, and chopped walnuts.
6. After resting the dough, sprinkle flour on the table and spread it thinly into a 22-24cm circle.
7. Put the apricot jam on top and sprinkle the filling on it.
8. Cut the dough into 12-16 equal parts, and roll it up from the outside.
9. Rest the rugelach in the refrigerator for 30 min before baking.
10. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
11. Before baking, sprinkle sugar on the top of the Rugelach and bake in a preheated oven for 15~20 minutes.

1. ë”°ëœ»í•œ ë¬¼ì— ì„¤íƒ•ì„ ë…¹ì—¬ ì¸„ëŸ¬ìŠ¤ ì‹œëŸ½ì„ ì¤€ë¹„í•œë‹¤.

- Basic Financier
1. Put the butter in a pot and heat it over medium heat until the color of the butter darkens. Cooldown until the temp drops below 50 degrees Celsius (120 degrees Fahrenheit, mine took 10-15 minutes).
2. Sift the cake flour and almond powder together.
3. Mix egg whites and sugar in a bowl, then add the sifted dry ingredients and mix.
4. Divide the butter into 2 times and mix. Put the finished batter in a piping bag and rest for at least 1 hour in the fridge.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Grease the pan with butter.
6. Fill 70-80% of the pan with the batter.
7. Bake in a preheated oven for 13~15 minutes.

- Fig & Cream Cheese Financiers
1. Prepare semi-dried figs by cutting them into appropriate sizes.
2. After step (6) of basic financier, place semi-dried figs and a small amount of cream cheese on top.
3. Bake in a preheated oven for 13 ~15 minutes.

- Churros Financiers
1. Prepare churros syrup by dissolving sugar in warm water.
2. Prepare churros sugar mix by mixing sugar and cinnamon powder.
3. Apply churros syrup on the finished basic financiers and roll over the churros sugar mix.

1. Place parchment paper on a square pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Crumble: Put the cake flour, almond powder, sugar, and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix by hand.
3. Mix until it becomes lumpy like wet sand, refrigerate until use.
4. Berry Cheesecake: Combine cream cheese and sugar in a bowl and mix until smooth mayonnaise-like texture.
5. Add eggs and mix, then add cake flour and lemon juice and mix evenly.
6. Add heavy cream and mix to finish.
7. Put the mixed berries and sugar in a bowl and mix evenly.
8. Put half of the crumble in a square pan, and press it firmly on the bottom. Place the cheesecake batter on it, and evenly place the mixed berry-sugar mixture. Lastly, add the remaining crumble.
9. Bake in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes. After taking it out from the oven, cool it sufficiently in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours before slice.

Samba Isobel - Kevin MacLeod

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Roll Dough
1. Add instant dry yeast to warm water and leave for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, sugar, salt, eggs, and yeast-water and mix lightly. When it starts to lump, add the melted unsalted butter and knead by hand for 17-20 minutes.
3. When the dough becomes soft and smooth, put it in a bowl, cover it, and let it rise at room temperature for 1.5 to 2 hours.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Caramel
1. Put brown sugar, unsalted butter, and milk in a pan and heat over medium heat. Stir in between until all the sugar is dissolved.
2. When sugar is completely dissolved, remove from heat and pour into pan. Place chopped pecans on top.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan rolls - assembly
1. After rise, use a rolling pin to flatten the dough into 16*20 inches (40*50cm).
2. Spread melted butter on the dough, and sprinkle brown sugar, cinnamon powder, and pecans.
3. After rolling the dough, pinch the end of the dough. Cut the dough into 7-9 equal parts using a knife or dental floss.
4. Place the dough on the pan with pecan caramel. Cover the top with cling film and let it rise at room temperature for 1 hour.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
6. After it rises, bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes.
7. Cool the baked caramel pecan rolls slightly, then turn them over in a plate and serve.

Shades of Spring - Kevin MacLeod

ìŠ¤í”„ë§í´ Sprinkles

*Puff / Choux pastry
1. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius(375 Fahrenheit). Line the baking tray with parchment paper.
2. Put unsalted butter, salt, sugar, and water in a pot. Turn the heat to medium, and melt the butter. When butter is melted, remove from the heat, add cake flour. Mix until well combined.
3. In medium heat, gently cook the dough. Stir for 4~5min to evenly cooked. Once it came out in one dough, remove it from the heat. And transfer into the bowl to chill faster. Chill for 3~5min in room temp.
4. Crack the eggs in a cup or bowl, and gently whisk. Slowly add the beaten eggs into the cooked dough, and mix. The choux pastry will smooth, shiny, and kinda thick texture. Transfer into the piping bag.
5. Pipe the batter onto the baking tray with parchment paper on. Each of the choux pastry should 3 inches apart, at least. Spraying the water over the choux pastry. Press down the pointy part of the choux pastry. Bake in the preheated oven for 20min. Donâ€™t open it while still bake.

1. In a bowl or cup, mix cake flour, sugar, vanilla extract, and egg yolks. Mix until well combined.

6. Pour the batter over the pan, and bake for 45~50min in a preheated oven. When itâ€™s fully baked, remove the pan when itâ€™s still hot.
7. In another bowl, put cream cheese and vanilla extract, and whisk. Put the icing sugar, and fold until fully combined. And add milk, a little bit at a time, to make the consistency you want.

1. Pour the milk into the pot, and heat up the milk in medium heat.

1. Put egg whites in a bowl and whip. When the egg white starts to foam, add sugar divided into 3 times while whipping. Whisk until the meringue turns shiny and doesnâ€™t fell off when you turn upside down the bowl. 
2. In meringue, add sieved almond flour and icing sugar, and mix gently. Divide the batter in half, add the red and green food coloring each of the batter. Fold gently until falls into a stair shape and the stair-shaped mark lasts 6~8sec when you dropped the batter from the spatula.
3. Transfer the batter into the piping bag, and squeeze it onto the baking sheet. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius(355 degrees Fahrenheit), and bake at 150 degrees Celsius(300 degrees Fahrenheit) for 15min. When itâ€™s come out the oven cools down completely.
4. Crush the cookies into small pieces. Place your favorite buttercream (I used Creme Anglais) on the flat side of the macaron, place the crushed cookies on top of that, and cover with another macaron

snippet.title: Haileyâ€™s Home Cafe December â˜•ï¸ Frozen Hot Chocolate, Irish Coffee, Eggnog | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey with another monthly cafe at home in December.
In this month, I made frozen hot chocolate, Irish coffee and eggnog.

First I heard â€˜frozen hot chocolateâ€™, It reminds me some Koreans saying in cafe â€˜Can I get warm ice americano?â€™. ğŸ˜‚
But after I taste it, I can see why this name is such a mess. It taste like hot chocolate, but it is ice! ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚
If I live in Australia, I would drink in every ChristmasğŸ˜†

I heard what is Irish coffee when I was teenager, maybe middle school student. So my dream â€˜wasâ€™ drink Irish coffee. And my wish came true in 2018ğŸ˜‚ 
Taste was not same as what I thought in teenager, but Korea is freakin cold as northern Europe, so I can fully understand why Irish made this!

And lastly, eggnog.
Actually in Korea, eggnog is not that famous drinks. I think because of the name â€˜eggâ€™nog. But it was not that bad, and actually it was good!
But I think itâ€™s too heavy for me, so with coffee or some rum, It would be nice!
And Iâ€™m not prefer to use raw egg, so I cooked and instead of meringue top of the drink, I used whipped cream. 

This is my last video in 2018. Iâ€™m not sure that Iâ€™ll continuing this type of video. 
If you have any other opinions or recommendations, comment down below! It will be very helpful!ğŸ˜‚
And Iâ€™ll studying more English for communicate with you guysğŸ˜†
Right now, my English is quite mess, but I hope you understand! Hope you had great 2018, and I will see you guys in next year! Happy new year everyoneğŸ˜˜

Stollen wasnâ€™t sweet than I thought. And because lots of marzipan and nuts, It has savory flavour.

I only put ground cinnamon, but you also put ground ginger or any spice you like :)

1. Chop the cold unsalted butter.
2. Add all-purpose flour, salt, and butter to the food processor and blend for about 30 seconds.
3. Add water little by little and turn the food processor until it clumps together. Do not add all the water, just add it to until it clumps. Wrap it, and refrigerate the dough for 30 minutes.
4. Take the dough out of the fridge, sprinkle lightly with flour, and roll out with a rolling pin to make a rectangle. Fold the bottom and top short ends of your dough towards the center of the rectangle. Top ends should be shorter than bottom. Fold the top half over onto the bottom half, so you have 4 layers of dough in a thick square, wrap it and refrigerate for 20min.
5. When it's came out of the fridge, give it a 90-degree turn, and flatten the dough into a rectangle. Fold the dough into thirds, like a letter, then let it rest in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Repeat this process one more time (a total of 2 times). When it is final fold, let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

1. In a saucepan, put sugar, water, and cinnamon stick, and bring it on to medium-low heat. When it starts to boil, let it boil for another 1 min and remove it from the heat. Leave it at room temp until use(cinnamon syrup).
2. In another pan, put 260ml(1cup plus 4tsp) of milk, and simmer in low heat until the edge starts to boil. Put 40ml(2 1/2Tbsp) of milk and all-purpose flour into the bowl, and mix until well combined. Stream the hot milk into the milk-flour mixture while mixing. And pour the cinnamon syrup in it and mix. Leave for 5~10 min until itâ€™s warm, not hot.
3. When the milk mixture is getting slightly cooled down, add egg yolks, and mix well. Strain the mixture before use.

1. Preheat the oven to 230 Degrees Celsius(450 Degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Roll out the puff pastry from the refrigerator into a 0.4-0.5 cm(about 0.2 inches) thick rectangle. Roll the dough into a cylinder shape and cut it into 12 equal parts.
3. Put the cut puff pastry in the muffin mold and spread the dough to an even thickness.
4. Fill the muffin pan with 2 tablespoons of custard cream, then bake in a preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes until dark burnt spots appear.

1. Chop the cold unsalted butter.
2. In a bowl, put all-purpose flour, salt, and butter, mix all together. Using a scraper, mix like cutting butter until it is pea-sized. 
3. Add water, little at a time, knead until came out one dough. Donâ€™t add water at once, add until just combined. Refrigerate for 30 min.
4. When itâ€™s come out of the fridge, lightly dust with flour, and roll into a rectangle shape. Fold in thirds, like a letter. Refrigerate for 10~15min. Repeat this process two times more (3 times in total). In the last fold, refrigerate up to 20 min.

1. Peel off the apple, and chop finely.
2. In a pot, melt the unsalted butter on medium heat. When butter is completely melted, put chopped apples, and stir for 2 min. Add light brown sugar and cinnamon stick, mix and stir for an additional 2 min. Save 1/8cup of apple juice for later.
3. In water, put starch and mix. Put the starch mixture into the apple mixture, and stir for 2 min until water is dissolved. Turn off the heat, and let it cool until use.

1. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius(400 Fahrenheit). In a bowl, mix egg and water.
2. Roll the chilled dough for about 0.5cm (0.2inch). And cut it in a round shape with a round cookie cutter or mug. Roll the dough a bit to make an oval shape.
3. Put 1~2tsp of apple filling on the middle of the dough. Water the edge of the dough, and fold in half. Press a bit to prevent leaking. 
4. Using chopstick or skewer, make 2~3 holes. Brush the egg wash, and bake for 20~25min in a preheated oven.
5. After bake, brush the saved apple syrup on top of the apple turnover.
