snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
10~12 servings
-pastry crust
ì¤‘ë ¥ë¶„ 280g(2cups) all-purpose flour
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2Tbsp) sugar
ì†Œê¸ˆ 8g(1tsp) salt
ì°¨ê°€ìš´ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„°(ê¹ëšì°ê¸° í•´ ì¤€ë¹„) 170g(3/4cup) chilled unsalted butter (cube-sized)
ê³„ë€ 2 eggs

-corn cheese filling
í†µì¡°ë¦¼ ì˜¥ìˆ˜ìˆ˜ 340g(12oz) canned corn
ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 15g(1Tbsp) unsalted butter
ì†Œê¸ˆ 2g(1/4tsp) salt
ë§ˆìš”ë„¤ì¦ˆ 30g(2Tbsp) mayonnaise
ëª¨ì§œë ë¼ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ 220g(1cup) mozzarella cheese
í›„ì¶”ê°€ë£¨ Ground pepper

ëª¨ì§œë ë¼ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ Extra mozzarella cheese or any kind of cheese you prefer
íŒŒìŠ¬ë¦¬ Parsley

1. In a bowl, put all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, and cube-sized chilled unsalted butter. Using the scraper, cut the butter(or rub with fingers) into small piece, like pea-sized.
2. Add eggs and mix until came out one dough.
3. Chill it in a fridge for about 1 hour.
4. Drain the canned corn, and mix with butter, salt, mayo, mozzarella cheese, and ground pepper. Set aside in room temp before use.
5. Preheat the oven for 200C / 400F.
6. Divide the dough into 8~10 pieces, and roll the dough on a floured surface. Place it into the cavity of a muffin pan. Use finger, press the dough to evenly flatten against the bottom and sides of the cavity. Make sure as even as you can.
7. Fill the crust shell with corn cheese filling. Sprinkle extra cheese and parsley. Bake in the oven for 20~22 min or air frying 190C / 375F for 25min.

snippet.title: Blueberry Tart Recipe : ë¸”ë£¨ë² ë¦¬ íƒ€ë¥´íŠ¸ ë§Œë“¤ê¸°
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
-sweet pastry (5-6 servings)
 íƒ€ë¥´íŠ¸ì§€ (5-6ê°œ ë¶„ëŸ‰)
ì°¨ê°€ìš´ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 73g cold unsalted butter
ìŠˆê°€íŒŒìš°ë” 50g icing sugar
ê³„ë€ ë…¸ë¥¸ì 1 egg yolk
ì¤‘ë ¥ë¶„ 145g all-purpose flour
ì†Œê¸ˆ í•œê¼¬ì§‘ Pinch of salt
ë°”ë‹ë¼ ìµìŠ¤íŠ¸ë™ 1g(1/4tsp) vanilla extract

-custard cream (2-3 servings)
 ì»¤ìŠ¤í„°ë“œ í¬ë¦¼ (2ê°œë¶„ëŸ‰)
ë°•ë ¥ë¶„ 30g(2 1/2Tbsp) cake flour
ì„¤íƒ• 70g sugar 
ìš°ìœ  200ml milk 
ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 25g unsalted butter 
ê³„ë€ ë…¸ë¥¸ì 2 egg yolk
ë°”ë‹ë¼ìµìŠ¤íŠ¸ë™ 3g(1/2tsp) vanilla extract

-whipped cream (2-3 servings)
 íœ˜í•‘í•œ í¬ë¦¼ (2-3ê°œ ë¶„ëŸ‰)
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 150ml heavy cream or whipping cream
ì„¤íƒ• 15g sugar

ë² ë¦¬ ì¼ berry jam
ë¸”ë£¨ë² ë¦¬ blueberries
ì¥ì‹ìš© ë¡œì¦ˆë§ˆë¦¬ rosemary for garnish


[1] Making sweet pastry
1. Put chilled unsalted butter, icing sugar, salt, and vanilla extract in a bowl, and using whipper/food processor/scraper, mix until crumbly.
2. Add all-purpose flour and mix until butter is about pea size. And add egg yolk, and knead until no flour is seen and comes into one dough.
3. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

[2] Making custard cream
1. In a bowl, put cake flour, sugar, and egg yolk. Whisk until no flour seen.
2. Pour milk and vanilla extract in a pot, and simmer until the edge of the pot is slightly boiling.
3. While whisking the yolk mixture, slowly pour hot milk. When the milk is halfway mixed, pour the rest of the milk and mix well.
4. Put it back to the stove. In low heat, simmer the custard cream. Keep stirring using a spatula, for 4-6min.
5. When the custard cream is getting thick, add butter and mix well. When butter is completely mixed, remove from the heat.
6. Transfer to the airtight container, and wrap the surface of the custard cream. Refrigerate until use.

[3] Shaping sweet pastry & bake
1. Preheat the oven to 165C/330F.
2. Divide the dough into 4-5 pieces, and knead lightly.
3. Roll out the dough, and carefully place onto an 8.5cm(3.5inch) perforated tart rings. Scrape down the edge with a knife, and fill out some empty space if there is.
4. Bake 20-25min in the preheated oven until it gets golden brown. Remove from the tart ring when it is completely chilled.

[4] Assembling
1. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip. Transfer into the piping bag.
2. Transfer the custard cream into the piping bag.
3. In baked tart pastry, put custard cream and berry jam. And pipe the whipped cream into a cone shape. Cover the whipped cream with blueberries, pipe again onto the top of the cone in a circle shape. Decorate with rosemary, etc.

snippet.title: ğŸ Apple Crumble Recipe ğŸ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
= INGREDIENTS =
 (16.5cm square pan / 6.5inch)
-Crumble
50g unsalted butter (room temp)
150g(1cup plus 1Tbsp) pastry flour
10g(2tsp) sugar
35g(2Tbsp plus 1tsp) brown sugar

-Apple filling
2 apples
15g(1Tbsp) unsalted butter
40g(2 1/2Tbsp) sugar
3g(1tsp) ground cinnamon

sugar
Vanilla ice cream

1. In a food processor, put every crumble ingredients. Purse to mix, until like wet sand texture. Refrigerate at least 30 min.
2. Peel the apples, and cut into bite-size. In a pot, put diced apples, unsalted butter, sugar, and ground cinnamon. In medium-low heat, boil down until apples getting soft.
3. In a square pan, put apple filling. Sprinkle crumbles, and sprinkle some sugar on top. Bake 180C / 355F for 30~40min. It depends on how big your crumbles are. 
4. Serve with vanilla ice cream before it cools down.

snippet.description:

âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!

 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients(3í˜¸ íŒŒì´ 2ê°œ or 3í˜¸ íŒŒì´ì™€ ë¯¸ë‹ˆíŒŒì´ 6ê°œ)
+tart crust
200g(1 1/2cup) all-purpose flour
100g(7Tbsp) unsalted butter
80g(1/4cup plus 2Tbsp) sugar
1 egg
2g(1/2tsp) baking powder
2g(1/4tsp) salt
 
+Lemon filling
2 lemon(for zest & lemon juice)
50g(1/4cup plus 2Tbsp) corn starch
100g(1/2cup) sugar
3 egg yolk
40g(2 2/3Tbsp, 1.4oz) unsalted butter
480ml(2cup) water
 
+Meringue
3 egg white
80g(1/3cup) sugar
5g(1tsp) lemon juice
1g(1/4tsp) vanilla extract
 
Before you make : Using a grinder, zest the lemon. After that, halve the lemon and squeeze.
1. In a bowl, whisk the butter. And add sugar and egg. Mix until well combined. Shift all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Mix with butter mixture.
2. When the dough is combined together, rest in the fridge for about 30min~1hour.
3. In a pan, put corn starch, sugar, egg and lemon juice. Mix until no lumps in the pan. Turn the low heat and stir.
4. When the filling is thick enough, turn off the heat and add lemon zest and unsalted butter, and mix.
5. Halve the dough, and roll the dough into a disk shape. Put the dough onto the tart pan and cut. Using a fork, make the hole to the bottom of the tart pan.
6. Cover the dough with pie weights and bake 180C / 355F for about 20min.
7. When the tart crust is Cool down enough, fill with the lemon filling.
8. Put the egg white in the bowl, and whip with sugar. Add lemon juice and vanilla extract and whip until it gets a stiff peak.
9. Put the meringue into the tart and using a torch, brown the surface of the meringue.

snippet.title: Lemon Bar ë ˆëª¬ë°” | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, Itâ€™s Hailey :)
Todayâ€™s menu is lemon bar.
It is one of highly recommend recipes to try in summer. 

Lemon bar is not that popular dessert in Korea. 
But if you like lemon or sour and sweet dessert, you need to try this.
You can eat with meringue like lemon meringue pie if you want. It is my favorite way to eat with meringue :))))


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Oreo Icebox Cake) : http://bit.ly/2M7REHw
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients  (20X20cm pan / 8X8inch pan)
+Crust 
210g(1 1/2cup) pastry flour
100g(1/2cup) sugar
170g(3/4cup) unsalted butter
pinch of salt

+Filling
200g(1cup) sugar
20g(2Tbsp) pastry flour
2g(1/4tsp) salt
170g(1/2cup) lemon juice
20g(2Tbsp) lemon zest
2 egg yolks
powdered sugar

Before make the lemon bar : Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8x8 pan with foil and spray with nonstick spray.
1. Mix the flour, sugar, salt and unsalted butter together with using food processor.
2. Press the dough into the pan. Bake for 20 minutes.
3. While the crust is baking, beat the filling ingredients until light texture.
4. Pour onto the hot crust and bake for another 25 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar right before serving.

snippet.title: Green Grape Tart ì²­í¬ë„ íƒ€ë¥´íŠ¸ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers! Itâ€™s Hailey again.
This time I made tart again. But for more fresh and fruity taste, I made green grape tart.
Most of green tart recipes are having almond cream layer, but I donâ€™t wanna heavy layer in it, so I only made with cream cheese filling layer.
But It wasnâ€™t that cheesy taste, so I really liked that!
If you think that filling is too much, you can make half of the filling recipe.


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Baked Cheese Tart) : http://bit.ly/2GMKjpW
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients (1 tart : 6inch/16.5cm pan)
+tart shell
90g(2/3cup) pastry flour
pinch of salt
45g(3Tbsp) cold unsalted butter
15g(1Tbsp) cold water

+cream cheese filling
80g(2.8oz) cream cheese
250ml(1cup) heavy cream
45g(3Tbsp) sugar

green grape
syrup
pistachio

1. In a food processor, combine all tart shell ingredients and mix until well combined.
2. Transfer the dough to a work surface and press the dough into a flat disk. And Press the dough over a tart pan (6inch/16.5cm) and press it downwards.
3. Use a fork to poke holes at the dough. Bake 170~180C / 350F to 15min.
4. Place the cream cheese, heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until medium to stiff peaks. Put the filling into a piping bag.
5. Fill the tart shell with the filling cream, and place the green grape.
6. For decor, brush with some syrup and sprinkle some crushed pistachio.

snippet.title: Baked Cheese Tart ë² ì´í¬ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ íƒ€ë¥´íŠ¸ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viwers! This time, I made baked cream cheese tart.
Because of rich cream cheese flavor, Iâ€™m pretty sure you canâ€™t stop eating.
It really goes with coffee. But it is rich flavor than sweet flavor, so it goes well with ade or juice too. 

On top of tart, It mayl good with cream cheese whipping cream, But I like more classical flavor, so I didnâ€™t put it.  
How about making this one that suits the weather these days!


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Haileyâ€™s Monthly Cafe March) : http://bit.ly/2q9EEnL
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients 
*tart shell
90g(2/3cup) pastry flour
pinch of salt
45g(3Tbsp) cold unsalted butter
15g(1Tbsp) cold water

*cheese filling
200g(7oz) cream cheese
60g(1/4cup plus 2tsp) sugar
10g(2tsp) lemon juice
30g(1oz) egg
10g(1Tbsp) pastry flour
50g(3 1/2Tbsp) heavy cream

1. In a food processor, combine all tart shell ingredients and mix until well combined.
2. Transfer the dough to a work surface and press the dough into a flat disk. And Press the dough over a tart pan (6inch/16.5cm) and press it downwards.
3. Use a fork to poke holes at the dough. Bake 170~180C / 350F to 15min.
4. Place the cream cheese in a bowl and place the bowl in a boiling water and mix until all cream cheese is melted.
5. Remove from the heat and mix with sugar and lemon juice.
6. Add shifted flour and egg and mix.
7. Lastly, add heavy cream and mix until well-combined.
8. Pour the mixture into the tart pan and tap several times for remove the air bubble. (or swirl few times with toothpick)
9. Bake 160C / 325F to 40 min until cheese tart gets golden brown. (If the color of the tart isnâ€™t golden brown, bake 170C / 340F to 5 min)

1. Put 15g (1 tbsp) of sugar and water in a pan and heat over low heat until golden brown. Do not stir the sugar at this time. When it turns golden brown~brown, turn off the heat, add 15g (1 tbsp) of water and swirl the pan well.
2. Pour caramel syrup into the pudding pan. Then put it in the refrigerator until you make the pudding mixture.
3. Put milk, sugar and vanilla bean in a pot and boil over low heat until the edges of the milk boil slightly.
4. Put 2 eggs in a bowl and beat well with a whisk. Add the boiled milk mixture little by little and mix.
5. After sieving the pudding mixture, transfer to a pudding pan. If bubbles form on the top, remove them.
6. Prepare a pot the size of which will completely fit the pudding pan. Prepare the pot by wrapping the lid of the pot with a cotton cloth.
7. Lay a kitchen towel/dishcloth/cotton cloth on the pot and place the pudding pan. Fill the pudding pan with warm water (50-60 degrees Celsius) to 1/3 the height of the pudding pan, and boil over medium heat for 12~15 minutes. Turn off the heat and simmer with the lid on for 3-5 minutes.
8. Remove the finished pudding from the pot and cool it at room temperature for about 1 hour, then cool it in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.
9. Serve with ice cream or syrup according to your taste.

- Brownies
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put unsalted butter and dark chocolate in a microwaveable bowl, and microwave until chocolate and butter are all melted.
3. Add the egg to the chocolate mixture and mix.
4. Add brown sugar and mix. Sift in the cake flour and mix evenly to complete.

- Cheesecake
1. Put the room temp cream cheese in a bowl and loosen it lightly. Add sugar and mix once more.
2. Add 1 egg and mix, then add sifted cake flour and lemon juice and mix again.
3. Add fresh cream and mix to complete.
4. Put the brownie batter on a pan lined with parchment paper and put the cheesecake batter on it to complete it.
5. Bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 min. After cooling the baked cheesecake brownie to room temperature, store it in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before eating.

- Basic Financier
1. Put the butter in a pot and heat it over medium heat until the color of the butter darkens. Cooldown until the temp drops below 50 degrees Celsius (120 degrees Fahrenheit, mine took 10-15 minutes).
2. Sift the cake flour and almond powder together.
3. Mix egg whites and sugar in a bowl, then add the sifted dry ingredients and mix.
4. Divide the butter into 2 times and mix. Put the finished batter in a piping bag and rest for at least 1 hour in the fridge.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Grease the pan with butter.
6. Fill 70-80% of the pan with the batter.
7. Bake in a preheated oven for 13~15 minutes.

- Fig & Cream Cheese Financiers
1. Prepare semi-dried figs by cutting them into appropriate sizes.
2. After step (6) of basic financier, place semi-dried figs and a small amount of cream cheese on top.
3. Bake in a preheated oven for 13 ~15 minutes.

- Churros Financiers
1. Prepare churros syrup by dissolving sugar in warm water.
2. Prepare churros sugar mix by mixing sugar and cinnamon powder.
3. Apply churros syrup on the finished basic financiers and roll over the churros sugar mix.

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (325 degrees Fahrenheit). Sift the cake flour, baking soda, and salt to prepare.
2. Put the butter in a bowl and use a whipper to gently beat it. Add sugar and mix well, then add eggs one at a time. When adding the last egg, add vanilla extract and mix well.
3. Pour half of the sifted flour mixture into the dough and mix. When it is half mixed, add half of the milk and mix well. Pour in the remaining flour mixture and milk and mix thoroughly. Add sprinkles to the finished batter and fold lightly to finish.
4. Use an ice cream scoop or spoon, placing the batter into the pan. Bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (325 degrees Fahrenheit) for 14~15 minutes. Chill the whoopie pie after bake. 
5. Place the whoopie pie on a microwavable plate, and place a marshmallow on top. Microwave them for 10~20sec until the marshmallows are getting soft. Place a whoopie pie on top of the soft marshmallow to complete the whoopie pie. (Sprinkle sprinkles onto the marshmallow if you prefer)

1. Put the biscuits in a zipper bag and crush them with a rolling pin. Transfer the crushed biscuits to a bowl, then add unsalted butter and mix well. Pour cookie crumbs on a cake pan lined with parchment paper or cake collar. Press firmly with the tip of the rolling pin or a spoon. 2. Add gelatin powder to water and bloom for 5 minutes. Microwave the bloomed gelatin before use.
3. Put the whipped cream in a bowl and whip until stiff peak.
4. Put the cream cheese and sugar in another bowl, and whip the cream cheese until it dissolves with the mayo-like texture. Then, add the melted gelatin to the microwave and mix again. Add the raspberry purÃ©e and mix evenly. Add the whipped cream and mix evenly with a spatula.
5. Pour the raspberry cheesecake mixture into a cake pan with cookie crumble. Tap lightly to even out the top. Store in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
6. When the raspberry cheesecake is completely hardened, decorate the top with whipped cream and raspberry.

1. Put LA MERE POULARD lemon palets and salt in a food processor and pulse until fine crumb (you can put it in a zip pack and crush it with a rolling pin). Then, add melted unsalted butter and pulse once more.
2. Pour milk into gelatin powder and soak at room temperature for 5 minutes.
3. Put the whipped cream in a bowl and whip until a stiff peak.
4. In a different bowl, put the cream cheese and sugar, and mix well, then melt the soaked gelatin in a microwave or in a water bath and mix with the cream cheese. Mix in yogurt as well. Finally, mix the whipped cream together.
5. Fill the cookie crust to about 1/4 the height of the mold. Press firmly with a cup with a flat bottom or a measuring cup. And fill the finished cheesecake into a mold. Tap few times to make the top flat.
6. Decorate the hardened cheesecake with whipped cream and cookies.

1. Put instant dry yeast and warm water A in a bowl and leave it for 5 minutes.
2. Mix the yeast water with bread flour A, sugar, olive oil A, and then add warm water B and mix well.  Lightly loosen the large chunks, and then let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
3. Add salt and bread flour B and mix with a spoon or spatula until no flour is seen. Then add basil pesto and mix lightly.  Let it rise at room temperature for 2 hours.
4. After arranging the air bubbles with the rise focaccia with your finger, put the cherry tomatoes cut in half and sprinkle some olive oil. Bake in an oven preheated to 200 degrees Celsius(395 degreed Fahrenheit) for 25 to 30 minutes until golden.

1. Put dark chocolate, white chocolate, and blueberry flavor chocolate in a large piping bag. Seal it with tape.
2. Put piping bags with chocolate in a large bowl and pour hot water. Sit for 5 minutes until the chocolate is melted.
3. When the chocolate is completely melted, cut the piping bag and then add 1~2 tablespoons of chocolate to the half-sphere silicone mold. Apply evenly with a spoon / spatula / brush. Let it set in the fridge for 5 minutes, then apply again. Apply a total of 3-4 times to make a solid half-sphere.
4. Put the oven tray at 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit) for 5 minutes to prepare it hot. Separate the chocolate from the silicone mold.
5. Add 1~2 tablespoons of hot chocolate mix, dehydrated marshmallows, and sprinkles inside the half-sphere chocolate.
6. Place the other half of the chocolate on a hot oven tray, melt it slightly, and place it on top of the chocolate with hot chocolate. If there is a gap, it is good to apply melted chocolate to completely sealed. Sprinkle chocolate and sprinkles on the top to finish.

1. Put water in a pot and heat it over medium heat. When the water starts to boil, remove it from the heat. In another pot or bowl, prepare ice water.
2. Place a glass, stainless steel bowl on a pot, and then temper the chocolate.
First, melt the chocolate to 40~45 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 45~50 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate), then cool down the temp with ice-cold water until 25~26 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 27~28 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate). In warm water, melt the chocolate by raising the temperature to 29~30 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration) and 31~32 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate) using a hot water bath. Prepare the tempered chocolate in a piping bag.

* Melting temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Cooling temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Working temperature
White Chocolate / Raspberry Inspiration: 40 ~45 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 25~26 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 29~30 degrees Celsius
Dark chocolate: 45~50 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 27~28 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 31~32 degrees Celsius

3. Squeeze the chocolate into the bark chocolate mold and decorate it with dried fruit (orange chips, grapefruit chips, raspberry holes, strawberry slices) or Oreos, pretzel, nuts (almonds).
*Oreo Chocolate: Crush 4~5 Oreos. Add the crushed oreo to 80 g of tempered white chocolate and mix together. Fill in the bark chocolate mold to harden.

1. Pour the milk into the pot, and heat up the milk in medium heat.
2. Put sugar, salt, starch, vanilla extract, and egg yolks into the bowl, whisk until well combined. While mixing, pour the hot milk slowly.
3. Put the egg yolk mixture back into the pot, and gently stir for 1~2min in medium heat. lower the heat to low, and stir an additional 1~2min. Turn off the heat, add unsalted butter and mix well.
4. Transfer the custard cream into the bowl, and wrap the custard. Make sure the plastic wrap can touch the surface of the custard cream (It prevents harden the surface). Keep it in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
5. When the custard cream is fully chilled, In a pudding container, place custard cream, 00, and chopped bananas as much as you want. Refrigerate up to 2 hours.

1. Using an electronic mixer, whip the heavy cream, for 2min at high speed. Add biscoff spread, and whip for 30sec~1min. And add condensed milk, fold with a spatula until well combined.
2. Cover the pan with plastic wrap. Spread the cream in the bottom and side of the pan. Place the cookies vertically. Spread the cream on each of the cookies, and repeat until thereâ€™s no gap inside the pan. When it filled, cover the top of the cookies with cream. Refrigerate for 2 hours at least. Store the leftover cream in the fridge.
3. Take out from the pan, decorate with leftover cream.

1. Put egg whites in a bowl and whip. When the egg white starts to foam, add sugar divided into 3 times while whipping. Whisk until the meringue turns shiny and doesnâ€™t fell off when you turn upside down the bowl. 
2. In meringue, add sieved almond flour and icing sugar, and mix gently. Divide the batter in half, add the red and green food coloring each of the batter. Fold gently until falls into a stair shape and the stair-shaped mark lasts 6~8sec when you dropped the batter from the spatula.
3. Transfer the batter into the piping bag, and squeeze it onto the baking sheet. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius(355 degrees Fahrenheit), and bake at 150 degrees Celsius(300 degrees Fahrenheit) for 15min. When itâ€™s come out the oven cools down completely.
4. Crush the cookies into small pieces. Place your favorite buttercream (I used Creme Anglais) on the flat side of the macaron, place the crushed cookies on top of that, and cover with another macaron

1. Put 15g (1 tbsp) of sugar and water in a pan and heat over low heat until golden brown. Do not stir the sugar at this time. When it turns golden brown~brown, turn off the heat, add 15g (1 tbsp) of water and swirl the pan well.
2. Pour caramel syrup into the pudding pan. Then put it in the refrigerator until you make the pudding mixture.
3. Put milk, sugar and vanilla bean in a pot and boil over low heat until the edges of the milk boil slightly.
4. Put 2 eggs in a bowl and beat well with a whisk. Add the boiled milk mixture little by little and mix.
5. After sieving the pudding mixture, transfer to a pudding pan. If bubbles form on the top, remove them.
6. Prepare a pot the size of which will completely fit the pudding pan. Prepare the pot by wrapping the lid of the pot with a cotton cloth.
7. Lay a kitchen towel/dishcloth/cotton cloth on the pot and place the pudding pan. Fill the pudding pan with warm water (50-60 degrees Celsius) to 1/3 the height of the pudding pan, and boil over medium heat for 12~15 minutes. Turn off the heat and simmer with the lid on for 3-5 minutes.
8. Remove the finished pudding from the pot and cool it at room temperature for about 1 hour, then cool it in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.
9. Serve with ice cream or syrup according to your taste.


ğŸµ Shades of Spring - Kevin MacLeod

1. Strawberry Sauce: Put strawberries in a bowl and mash them, then add sugar and lemon juice and mix. Store at room temperature until the sugar dissolves, about 1 hour.
2. Prepare 2-3 strawberries by cutting them in half without cutting the stems. Chop the rest of the strawberries.
3. Mascarpone Cream : Lightly mix room temperature mascarpone cheese with a spatula.
4. Add sugar to the whipped cream and whip about 80% with a hand mixer.
5. Add 1/3 of whipped cream to mascarpone cheese and mix lightly with a spatula. Add the rest of the whipped cream and mix evenly. Prepare the finished cream by putting it in a piping bag.
6. Spread about 2 tablespoons of strawberry sauce in a container, and put 2 ladyfingers on top. On top of that, put strawberry sauce and put chopped strawberries. Squeeze the mascarpone cream on top and clean the top with a spatula. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
7. Finished tiramisu with sugar powder and halved strawberries.

1. Put the biscuits in a zipper bag and crush them with a rolling pin. Transfer the crushed biscuits to a bowl, then add unsalted butter and mix well. 1. Put LA MERE POULARD lemon palets and salt in a food processor and pulse until fine crumb (you can put it in a zip pack and crush it with a rolling pin). Then, add melted unsalted butter and pulse once more.
2. Pour milk into gelatin powder and soak at room temperature for 5 minutes.
3. Put the whipped cream in a bowl and whip until a stiff peak.
4. In a different bowl, put the cream cheese and sugar, and mix well, then melt the soaked gelatin in a microwave or in a water bath and mix with the cream cheese. Mix in yogurt as well. Finally, mix the whipped cream together.
5. Fill the cookie crust to about 1/4 the height of the mold. Press firmly with a cup with a flat bottom or a measuring cup. And fill the finished cheesecake into a mold. Tap few times to make the top flat.
6. Decorate the hardened cheesecake with whipped cream and cookies.

1. Add instant dry yeast and sugar to warm milk, stir, and soak for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, glutinous rice powder, salt and milk-yeast mixture, and vegetable oil and hand knead for 13~15 minutes. Knead the dough until smooth. Cover it with a wrap, and let it rise at room temperature for 2 hours.
3. After dividing the dough by 50~60g, and make a the dough into the ball shape while holding the subdivided dough by palm and attaching the hand blade to the floor. Let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
4. Roll the dough into the long string (25~30cm, 10~11inches). Gently hold both ends of the dough with your palms, and push both ends in opposite directions. Hold both ends of the dough and put the dough up to make a twisted shape. Pinching both ends so as not to loosen the shape of the donuts.
5. Let the dough rise at room temperature for about 1 hour.
6. Heat the oil to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit) and fry until the color of the donuts turns golden brown. Cool the finished donut in a cooling rack.

-Castella Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Finely powder the castella with a sieve.
2. After applying strawberry jam or raspberry jam to the donut, apply castella powder to finish.

-Sugar Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Mix sugar and cinnamon powder.
2. Roll the donuts in sugar cinnamon mixture to finish.

/ INSTRUCTIONS ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë²• /
-ë¸Œë¦¬ì˜¤ìŠˆ ë„ë„›
1. Put warm water, instant yeast, and sugar in a cup, mix well, and let it sit for 10 minutes. Prepare lemon zest by grate the lemon.
2. Put the bread flour, egg, salt, and yeast mixture together in a bowl. Knead by hand for 2~3 minutes and clump them together, but until there is a little flour left. Add butter and hand knead for 17~20 minutes until the dough is soft and shiny (especially in winter, it needs to be kneaded longer). If kneading for more than 15 minutes continues but still sticky, add 1 teaspoon of flour at a time and knead until soft and shiny. Cover it and let it rise in the refrigerator for 12~18 hours, or in a warm place for 2 hours.
*Note: It's okay to use a stand mixer
3. Punch down to remove air bubbles from the dough, divide the dough into 70g(2.4oz, about 11 pieces). Put the dough on the table and round it with your wrists and fingertips on the table. Make a ball of all the remaining dough.
4. Spread out the rounded dough into a flat circle shape using your palm or a rolling pin. Let them rise the dough at room temperature for about 2 hours.
5. Put cooking oil on medium-low heat until 180~190 Degrees Celsius(355~375 Degrees Fahrenheit) for 5-6 minutes. When the temperature is reached, reduce to low heat and fry the donuts. Fry each side for 1 minute and 30 seconds to 2 minutes until golden brown. Cool the fried donuts on a cooling rack.

1. In a bowl or cup, add soft flour, sugar, vanilla extract, egg yolk, and matcha powder. Mix well. If it is too thick, pour in milk little by little and mix until it is no lumps.
2. Heat the remaining milk over low heat. When the outer part of the pot starts to boil, remove it from the heat.
3. Pour the milk into the egg yolk mixture. Continue stirring while pouring the milk. Transfer it back to the pot and put it on low heat. Mix well and cook for 6 to 8 minutes until the custard cream is thickened.
4. When the cream becomes thick, take it off the heat, then add unsalted butter and mix well. Cover the custard cream with plastic wrap. Make sure the surface of the custard cream touches the wrap. Otherwise, the outer part will be getting harden. Let it rest in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
5. Whisk the whipped cream and sugar until stiff peak. Then add cold custard cream and mix lightly. Transfer it to a piping bag.

1. Put dark chocolate, white chocolate, and blueberry flavor chocolate in a large piping bag. Seal it with tape.
2. Put piping bags with chocolate in a large bowl and pour hot water. Sit for 5 minutes until the chocolate is melted.
3. When the chocolate is completely melted, cut the piping bag and then add 1~2 tablespoons of chocolate to the half-sphere silicone mold. Apply evenly with a spoon / spatula / brush. Let it set in the fridge for 5 minutes, then apply again. Apply a total of 3-4 times to make a solid half-sphere.
4. Put the oven tray at 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit) for 5 minutes to prepare it hot. Separate the chocolate from the silicone mold.
5. Add 1~2 tablespoons of hot chocolate mix, dehydrated marshmallows, and sprinkles inside the half-sphere chocolate.
6. Place the other half of the chocolate on a hot oven tray, melt it slightly, and place it on top of the chocolate with hot chocolate. If there is a gap, it is good to apply melted chocolate to completely sealed. Sprinkle chocolate and sprinkles on the top to finish.

snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
-12 donuts
-ë„ë„› 12ê°œ

*Donuts ë„ë„›
ë”°ëœ»í•œ ë¬¼ 75g(1/3cup minus 1tsp) lukewarm water
ê°•ë ¥ë¶„ 350g(2 3/4cup plus 1Tbsp) bread flour
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2Tbsp) sugar

ë§ë‘í•œ ìƒíƒœì˜ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 65g(4 1/2Tbsp) unsalted butter(softened)

*Condensed whipped cream ì—°ìœ í¬ë¦¼
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 500ml(2cups plus 2Tbsp) heavy cream
í¬ë¦¼ì¹˜ì¦ˆ 40g(4tsp) cream cheese

ìŠˆê°€íŒŒìš°ë” Icing sugar

1. In a bowl, put bread flour, sugar, salt, instant yeast, eggs, and warm water. 
Knead for 2~3 min, it came out one dough but a little bit of flour is still left, Add butter, and knead again until the dough is smooth and shiny, for 17~20min. (Especially in wintertime). Wrap the dough, and leave it for 1hour~1hour half min in a warm place.
*note : you can use a stand mixer to make.
2. Punch down the dough to release the air, and divide the dough into 50g(1.7oz, 12 donuts). To shape into balls, place the ball on the work surface and rest the side of your hand next to it so your palm and fingers are cupped around it. Do the same process on the rest of the dough.
3. Roll out the ball-shaped dough into a flat round shape. Place onto the 11.5cm(4.5inch) square parchment paper. Let it rise for 2 hours in room temp.
4. While doughs getting a rise, weâ€™re gonna prepare the whipped cream. Place heavy cream, sugar, and cream cheese into the bowl, and whip until it gets soft peak, about 2-3min. And add condensed milk, and whip until it gets a stiff peak. Transfer into the piping bag and store it in the fridge until use.
5. Heat the cooking oil, about 180-200C / 365~400F, about 6m in medium-low heat. When the oil reaches that heat, turn the heat to low. Frying them until getting golden brown, I fried for 1min 30sec~2min for each side. After frying, chill in a cooling rack. 
7. With a knife, slice the donut in half but leave the edge of the donut. Fill the cream with a spatula or spoon. Sprinkle some icing sugar to finish.

1. Put water in a pot and heat it over medium heat. When the water starts to boil, remove it from the heat. In another pot or bowl, prepare ice water.
2. Place a glass, stainless steel bowl on a pot, and then temper the chocolate.
First, melt the chocolate to 40~45 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 45~50 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate), then cool down the temp with ice-cold water until 25~26 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 27~28 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate). In warm water, melt the chocolate by raising the temperature to 29~30 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration) and 31~32 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate) using a hot water bath. Prepare the tempered chocolate in a piping bag.

* Melting temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Cooling temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Working temperature
White Chocolate / Raspberry Inspiration: 40 ~45 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 25~26 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 29~30 degrees Celsius
Dark chocolate: 45~50 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 27~28 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 31~32 degrees Celsius

3. Squeeze the chocolate into the bark chocolate mold and decorate it with dried fruit (orange chips, grapefruit chips, raspberry holes, strawberry slices) or Oreos, pretzel, nuts (almonds).
*Oreo Chocolate: Crush 4~5 Oreos. Add the crushed oreo to 80 g of tempered white chocolate and mix together. Fill in the bark chocolate mold to harden.

1. Pour the milk into the pot, and heat up the milk in medium heat.
2. Put sugar, salt, starch, vanilla extract, and egg yolks into the bowl, whisk until well combined. While mixing, pour the hot milk slowly.
3. Put the egg yolk mixture back into the pot, and gently stir for 1~2min in medium heat. lower the heat to low, and stir an additional 1~2min. Turn off the heat, add unsalted butter and mix well.
4. Transfer the custard cream into the bowl, and wrap the custard. Make sure the plastic wrap can touch the surface of the custard cream (It prevents harden the surface). Keep it in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
5. When the custard cream is fully chilled, In a pudding container, place custard cream, 00, and chopped bananas as much as you want. Refrigerate up to 2 hours.

1. Using an electronic mixer, whip the heavy cream, for 2min at high speed. Add biscoff spread, and whip for 30sec~1min. And add condensed milk, fold with a spatula until well combined.
2. Cover the pan with plastic wrap. Spread the cream in the bottom and side of the pan. Place the cookies vertically. Spread the cream on each of the cookies, and repeat until thereâ€™s no gap inside the pan. When it filled, cover the top of the cookies with cream. Refrigerate for 2 hours at least. Store the leftover cream in the fridge.
3. Take out from the pan, decorate with leftover cream.

1. Put egg whites in a bowl and whip. When the egg white starts to foam, add sugar divided into 3 times while whipping. Whisk until the meringue turns shiny and doesnâ€™t fell off when you turn upside down the bowl. 
2. In meringue, add sieved almond flour and icing sugar, and mix gently. Divide the batter in half, add the red and green food coloring each of the batter. Fold gently until falls into a stair shape and the stair-shaped mark lasts 6~8sec when you dropped the batter from the spatula.
3. Transfer the batter into the piping bag, and squeeze it onto the baking sheet. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius(355 degrees Fahrenheit), and bake at 150 degrees Celsius(300 degrees Fahrenheit) for 15min. When itâ€™s come out the oven cools down completely.
4. Crush the cookies into small pieces. Place your favorite buttercream (I used Creme Anglais) on the flat side of the macaron, place the crushed cookies on top of that, and cover with another macaron

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Roll Dough
1. Add instant dry yeast to warm water and leave for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, sugar, salt, eggs, and yeast-water and mix lightly. When it starts to lump, add the melted unsalted butter and knead by hand for 17-20 minutes.
3. When the dough becomes soft and smooth, put it in a bowl, cover it, and let it rise at room temperature for 1.5 to 2 hours.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Caramel
1. Put brown sugar, unsalted butter, and milk in a pan and heat over medium heat. Stir in between until all the sugar is dissolved.
2. When sugar is completely dissolved, remove from heat and pour into pan. Place chopped pecans on top.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan rolls - assembly
1. After rise, use a rolling pin to flatten the dough into 16*20 inches (40*50cm).
2. Spread melted butter on the dough, and sprinkle brown sugar, cinnamon powder, and pecans.
3. After rolling the dough, pinch the end of the dough. Cut the dough into 7-9 equal parts using a knife or dental floss.
4. Place the dough on the pan with pecan caramel. Cover the top with cling film and let it rise at room temperature for 1 hour.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
6. After it rises, bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes.
7. Cool the baked caramel pecan rolls slightly, then turn them over in a plate and serve.

1. Cut parchment paper into squares (about 13~15cm).
2. Combine bread flour, salt, sugar, dry yeast, and water and knead until the dough is smooth and shiny.
3. Cover with a wet kitchen cloth and let it rise at room temperature for 1.5~2 hours.
4. Divide the dough into 6 equal parts (about 75g) and round it, then cover with a kitchen cloth and let it sit for 10 minutes.
5. Roll the dough into an elongated shape using a rolling pin, then lay it horizontally and roll it up, pinching the ends.
6. One end is pointed, and the other end is flattened using a rolling pin, and then wrap the pointy end with the flat end to form a ring shape.
7. After forming, place it on parchment papers, cover with a wet kitchen cloth, and let it rise at room temperature for about 1 hour.
8. Boil water in a pot and add 1 tablespoon of honey. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
9. When the water starts to boil, add the bagels and blanch for 15-20 seconds per side, then put them on the pan.
10. Place sesame seeds on top according to your taste, and bake in an oven preheated to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit) for 12~13 minutes.

1. Put the dry ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Pour water and mix well with a spatula or spoon until no powder is visible. Cover a damp kitchen cloth and let it rise at room temperature for 30 minutes.
2. Use a spatula to pull up one side of the dough and fold it in half. Let it rest for another 30 minutes. Please do this process a total of 2~3 times. In last time, let it rise at room temperature for 3~4 hours (it is okay to leave it for 12 hours in the refrigerator).
3. When the dough has risen, sprinkle a generous amount of flour on the table and put the dough on it. Divide it into 3 equal parts, then use your hand to spread it out into rectangles. Then, fold the dough into thirds from the top, cover again with a damp kitchen cloth, and let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
4. After it risen, fold the dough from the top to the third point. Press lightly with your fingers to prevent it from loosening. Then, put the remaining 1/3 part of the bottom up and pinch it to finish. Grab the dough and roll gently to shape the baguette. Place the dough in an oven pan, cover it with a damp kitchen cloth, and let it rise at room temperature for 40 minutes.
5. Remove the cotton cloth and leave it at room temperature for 5~10 minutes to dry the surface of the dough. Then, they use a knife to make the coupe. After preheating the oven to 250 degrees Celsius(480 degrees Fahrenheit), lower the temperature to 230 degrees Celsius(445 degrees Fahrenheit)and bake for 15~18 minutes.

1. Put the biscuits in a zipper bag and crush them with a rolling pin. Transfer the crushed biscuits to a bowl, then add unsalted butter and mix well. Pour cookie crumbs on a cake pan lined with parchment paper or cake collar. Press firmly with the tip of the rolling pin or a spoon. Refrigerate the cookie crumble until the raspberry cheesecake is complete.
2. Add gelatin powder to water and bloom for 5 minutes. Microwave the bloomed gelatin before use.
3. Put the whipped cream in a bowl and whip until stiff peak.
4. Put the cream cheese and sugar in another bowl, and whip the cream cheese until it dissolves with the mayo-like texture. Then, add the melted gelatin to the microwave and mix again. Add the raspberry purÃ©e and mix evenly. Add the whipped cream and mix evenly with a spatula.
5. Pour the raspberry cheesecake mixture into a cake pan with cookie crumble. Tap lightly to even out the top. Store in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
6. When the raspberry cheesecake is completely hardened, decorate the top with whipped cream and raspberry.

1. Add sugar and instant dry yeast in warm water, and wait for 5 minutes.
2. In a bowl, put bread flour, cake flour, warm milk, salt, and yeast mixture in a bowl. Knead the dough for 12~15 minutes until it doesn't stick to your hands and becomes smooth. (If the dough still sticky even after 7 minutes or more kneading, add 5g of bread flour and knead. After 1~2 minutes, if it is still sticky, repeat this method.) When the dough is finished, put a wrap on a bowl and let it rise at room temperature for 1 hour 30 min.
3. While the dough is rising, cut the salted butter into elongated rectangles. Refrigerate salted butter until use.
4. When the dough has risen, place it on a cutting board or table and press down with your fingers to clear up the big air bubbles. Divide the dough into 8 equal parts. Make the dough into the ball shape while holding the subdivided dough by palm and attaching the hand blade to the floor. Let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
5. Make a cone shape by roll out one end of the dough by hand. Place the top of the cone facing up, then roll it to a certain thickness with a rolling pin. Make a shape with a scraper and push it into an elongated triangular shape. Put the cut salted butter on the bottom of the triangle and roll it around.
6. Place the finished salt bread dough in an oven pan with the end of the dough facing the bottom. Place a wrap or wet gauze/dishcloth on top, then let it rise at room temperature for a 1hour 30 min. When it has risen, apply milk wash pearl salt(pretzel salt) on top. Bake in an oven preheated to 200 degrees Celsius (395 degrees Fahrenheit)  for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.

1. Add instant dry yeast and sugar to warm milk, stir, and soak for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, glutinous rice powder, salt and milk-yeast mixture, and vegetable oil and hand knead for 13~15 minutes. Knead the dough until smooth. Cover it with a wrap, and let it rise at room temperature for 2 hours.
3. After dividing the dough by 50~60g, and make a the dough into the ball shape while holding the subdivided dough by palm and attaching the hand blade to the floor. Let it rise at room temperature for 15 minutes.
4. Roll the dough into the long string (25~30cm, 10~11inches). Gently hold both ends of the dough with your palms, and push both ends in opposite directions. Hold both ends of the dough and put the dough up to make a twisted shape. Pinching both ends so as not to loosen the shape of the donuts.
5. Let the dough rise at room temperature for about 1 hour.
6. Heat the oil to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit) and fry until the color of the donuts turns golden brown. Cool the finished donut in a cooling rack.

-Castella Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Finely powder the castella with a sieve.
2. After applying strawberry jam or raspberry jam to the donut, apply castella powder to finish.

-Sugar Ggwabaegi(twisted donuts)
1. Mix sugar and cinnamon powder.
2. Roll the donuts in sugar cinnamon mixture to finish.

snippet.title: Homemade Cinnabon Classic Cinnamon Roll ì‹œë‚˜ëª¬ë¡¤ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o

âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!

âœ¨ I'm not a native English speaker, sorry for my bad English description.
âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!

 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients 
-Dough
240g(1cup) warm water
2 eggs
75g(1/3cup) metled unsalted butter
630g(4 1/2cups) bread flour
8g(1tsp) salt
100g(1/2cup) sugar
10g(2 1/2tsp) dry yeast

-cinnamon sugar mix
145g(2/3cup) light brown sugar
6g(2tsp) ground cinnamon
56g(1/4cup) melted unsalted butter

-frosting
85g(3oz) cream cheese
56g(1/4cup) unsalted butter
240g(1 1/2cup) icing sugar
3g(1/2tsp) vanilla extract
Pinch of salt

1. In a mixer, put bread flour, salt, sugar, dry yeast, warm water and eggs. Mix until crumbly texture. And add melted unsalted butter and knead for 13-17min with mixer. If you make by your hand, knead up to 17~20min.
2. When surface of the dough is smooth and shiny, cover the dough with plastic wrap, and rise for 1 hour in room temp.
3. While dough is rising, prepare the cinnamon-sugar mixture. In a bowl, put light brown sugar and ground cinnamon. With spoon, mix until well combined.
4. Roll the dough into 16*20 inches. Spread the butter with brush or spoon, and sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture onto the buttered dough. Roll the dough, and pinch the end of the dough. Donâ€™t roll tightly. 
5. Cut the dough into 8~ pieces. Place the dough into 9*13 inch pan. Let it rise for 1~1hour 30min. While dough is rising, preheat the oven to 190C / 375F.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15~20min.(It could take up to 25min, It really depends on how close your dough is, or your pan.)
7. While the cinnamon rolls are baking, letâ€™s make the frosting. In a bowl, whip the cream cheese and unsalted butter. And add icing sugar, vanilla extract and salt. When the rolls are baked, spread the frosting over the hot rolls.

snippet.title: Matcha White Chocolate Scones : ë§ì°¨ í™”ì´íŠ¸ì´ˆì½œë¦¿ ìŠ¤ì½˜ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers, Itâ€™s Hailey.
Todayâ€™s menu is white chocolate matcha scone.
I wrote like matcha and green tea is same, so please keep that in mind.
Cuz when I made this, I added half matcha, half green tea powder.

When I made dough, I used food processor. But if you not, you can make with your hand. But make with your hand, you have to use cold butter and make the dough like crumbly.

With the scones, I ate with lightly whipped cream and sprinkle some matcha powder.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients 
210g(1 1/2cup) pastry flour
3g(3/4tsp) baking powder
10g(1 1/2tbsp) green tea powder
5g(1tsp) vanilla extract
80g(1/3cup) brown sugar
pinch of salt
110g(8 1/2Tbsp) unsalted butter
50g(1/4cup minus 2tsp) milk
130g(3/4cup, 4.6oz) white chocolate

1.Using food processor, mix pastry flour, baking powder, green tea powder, sugar, salt and unsalted butter.
2. Add vanilla extract, milk and mix until dough texture. Put white chocolate and mix.
3. Put the dough in the fridge at least 30min.
4. Make the dough into triangle shape and bake in the oven 180C / 350F for 20min

ğŸŒ™Ingredients 
360g(2 1/2cup) bread flour
18g(4tsp) sugar
6g(3/4tsp) salt
6g(1 1/2tsp) instant dry yeast
260g(1cup plus 4tsp) warm milk
15g(1Tbsp) unsalted butter

1. In warm milk, sprinkle instant dry yeast and let it set for 3 minutes.
2. In a bowl, put bread flour, sugar, salt and mix. After mix, add milk mixture and knead.
3. And add unsalted butter and knead until dough is smooth enough. Let it rise about 1 hour in a room temp.
4. After fully rise, separate the dough into 3 pieces, 210g approx. Make round shape and let it rise about 15min.
5. Fold the dough and put it in the bread pan, and let it rise about 1 hour in room temp.
6. Bake in the oven at 175C / 345F for 25~28min.
7. Put it out from the oven, and remove the bread from pan straight away.

snippet.title: Scones w/ Sweet Red Bean Paste & Butter : Anbutter Scone | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello Itâ€™s Hailey :) Todayâ€™s menu is anbutter (sweet red bean paste and butter) scone.
In Korea, anbutter with something like scone, daquoise, toast, etcâ€¦ are huge trend since last year I guess.
In lods of cafe, they are selling anbutter scone but I havenâ€™t try yet. So I made myself, and It taste really good.
Of course, I made sweet red bean paste too. How to make that bean paste will show in a next video. In a first time, I wanted to combine with this video. But it will be too long to watch, so I separate it.

In anbutter scone, it has huge chunk of butter inside. So if I use normal recipe of scone, it might be little bit greasy. So instead of butter, I use heavy butter in it. (It called fresh cream scone or siocona scone.)

If you wanna know what drinks I drunk in this video, check out my previous video (Haileyâ€™s monthly cafe : May http://bit.ly/2J7g1Dy)


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Haileyâ€™s Monthly Cafe : May) : http://bit.ly/2J7g1Dy
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients (6 pieces of scone)
200g(1cup plus 6Tbsp) bread flour
6g(1 1/2tsp) baking powder
30g(2Tbsp) sugar
200g(2/3cup plus 3Tbsp) heavy cream
1g(1/8tsp) salt

1 egg
unsalted butter
sweet red bean paste


1. In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, sugar and salt all together.
2. Pour the heavy cream and mix until combine all together. Put it in a fridge at least 1 hour.
3. In a flat surface, flatten the dough and divide into 6 pieces.Brush the beaten egg on the scone.
4. Bake in the oven 190C / 375F 12~15min.
5. Cut scone into the half. Spread sweet red bean paste on one side of scone, and top with chunk of unsalted butter. And top with the other side of scone.

snippet.title: Custard Bread ì»¤ìŠ¤í„°ë“œ ì‹ë¹µ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello viewers! Itâ€™s Hailey again.
In this video, I made custard bread. In South Korea, white bread with jam or cream inside is quite trend right now. Then I just thought, how about custard cream bread? and  I made this.
This dough is quite runny and sticky texture, so It might be hard to knead the dough. I prefer to use bread mixer type of thing. 
It taste was really nice. When I eating white bread, I always eat with jam or other spread. But this bread donâ€™t need spread thing!

For make a custard cream, I used microwave custard recipe, which I showed you in the past video. (http://bit.ly/20WVF2p)

And I will change my upload schedule to Wednesday and Saturday 20:00.
Today was too late to upload, but please understand.
See you in a next video!

ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Peanut Butter Chocolate Cupcakes) : http://bit.ly/2IGMyw1
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients (3 cube bread pan or 1 cube bread pan & bread pan)
400g(3cup and 2Tbsp) bread flour
5g(1/2tsp) salt
15g(1Tbsp) milk
25g(5tsp) sugar
17g(1 1/4Tbsp) unsalted butter
7g(1 3/4tsp) dry yeast
220ml(1cup plus 4tsp) water
custard cream

1. Put the yeast in a warm water
2. Mix bread flour, salt and sugar in a bowl, and slowly pour the yeast mixture and milk. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the butter and knead until dough gets smooth texture. (This dough will sticky and runny texture than other bread dough. But after bake, this, it has so moist texture I think.) Let it rise to 1~1hour 30min until double in size.
4. Divide into 3 pieces and let it rise for 15~20min.
5. Using a rolling pin, gently pat into large oval shape. Scoop the custard cream and put on the middle of the dough. Roll up the dough starting on the shortchanged end, into a cylinder shape. Pinch to seal the ends and place into cube pan. Let it rise until almost double in size, 1 hour.
6. Bake in the oven at 180C / 350F for 30~35min.

snippet.title: Green Tea CastellağŸŒ¿ ë…¹ì°¨ ì¹´ìŠ¤í…Œë¼ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
Hello, itâ€™s Hailey again!
In this time, I made green tea castella.

Maybe some people know that already, matcha and green tea is almost similar.
But matcha has more deeper taste, so I recommend to use matcha to make this!

You can substitute honey to corn syrup or any kind of sweet-syrup thing for this recipe!
Hope you like this video! And if you like it, be sure to thumbs up this video :)


ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o
 
âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(Green Grape Tart) : http://bit.ly/2Ik11RQ
 
âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!
 
 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients (1 castella pan, 7.8*4 inch / 20*10 cm)
40g(3Tbsp) vegetable oil
30g(2Tbsp) milk
22g(3 1/4tsp) honey
13g(2 1/2tsp) lemon juice
3 1/2 egg
75g(1/2cup plus 1/2Tbsp) bread flour
42g(4Tbsp) pastry flour
5g(1Tbsp) green tea powder
45g(1/4cup minus 1tsp) granulated sugar for egg yolk
80g(1/3cup plus 2tsp) granulated sugar for egg white
1/2tsp vanilla extract
unsalted butter

1. In a pan, put milk, lemon juice, vegetable oil, honey and bring it to heat until semi-boiling.
2. separate egg into egg white and yolk.
3. Make meringue with sugar and egg white.
4. Mix egg yolk, sugar and vanilla extract with electronic mixer.
5. Sieve bread flour, pastry flour and green tea powder
6. Fold dry ingredients into yolk mixture.
7. Fold meringue into yolk mixture.
8. Put mixture in a pan and bake 155C / 310F for 30~40min.
9. After out in the oven, put unsalted butter top and bottom of the castella and peel of the parchment paper.

snippet.description:
It is perfect weather to make bread these days, so I made steamed red bean paste bun.
Steamed bun is one of my favorite recipes made without oven.

Last video was more like sketchy, but this video is more detailed than last video. 
I hope you this video is helpful!

ğŸŒ™Ingredients (8~9 buns)
250g(1 3/4cup) all-purpose flour
3g(3/4tsp) baking powder
7g(1 3/4tsp) instant dry yeast
2g(1/4tsp) salt
20g(4tsp) sugar
50g(3Tbsp plus 1tsp) warm water
100g(1/3 cup plus 4tsp) milk
15g(1Tbsp) vegetable oil
red bean paste

1. In warm water, add yeast.
2. Combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt and sugar and pour yeast mixture and mix. And add vegetable oil and knead until soft texture.
3. Divide dough into 8 pieces (50~55g each).
4. Flatten the dough ball and place some filling in the center. Pinch the dough to hide fillings. Cover the bun and let it rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 30min to 1hour.
5. Steam the buns for 15 minutes over medium-low heat.

1. Put 15g (1 tbsp) of sugar and water in a pan and heat over low heat until golden brown. Do not stir the sugar at this time. When it turns golden brown~brown, turn off the heat, add 15g (1 tbsp) of water and swirl the pan well.
2. Pour caramel syrup into the pudding pan. Then put it in the refrigerator until you make the pudding mixture.
3. Put milk, sugar and vanilla bean in a pot and boil over low heat until the edges of the milk boil slightly.
4. Put 2 eggs in a bowl and beat well with a whisk. Add the boiled milk mixture little by little and mix.
5. After sieving the pudding mixture, transfer to a pudding pan. If bubbles form on the top, remove them.
6. Prepare a pot the size of which will completely fit the pudding pan. Prepare the pot by wrapping the lid of the pot with a cotton cloth.
7. Lay a kitchen towel/dishcloth/cotton cloth on the pot and place the pudding pan. Fill the pudding pan with warm water (50-60 degrees Celsius) to 1/3 the height of the pudding pan, and boil over medium heat for 12~15 minutes. Turn off the heat and simmer with the lid on for 3-5 minutes.
8. Remove the finished pudding from the pot and cool it at room temperature for about 1 hour, then cool it in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.
9. Serve with ice cream or syrup according to your taste.

*ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ ë¬´ìŠ¤ raspberry cheese mousse

ë¬¼ 52g(3 1/2Tbsp) water
í¬ë¦¼ì¹˜ì¦ˆ 150g(2/3cup) cream cheese

í”Œë ˆì¸ ìš”ê±°íŠ¸ 50g(3 1/2Tbsp) plain yogurt
ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ í“¨ë ˆ 90g(1/3cup plus 2tsp) raspberry puree
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 100g(1/3cup plus 2tsp) heavy cream
 
*í”Œë ˆì¸ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ ë¬´ìŠ¤ plain cheese mousse
íŒì ¤ë¼í‹´ 3 gelatin sheet (or ê°€ë£¨ì ¤ë¼í‹´ 12g(1Tbsp) gelatin powder)
í¬ë¦¼ì¹˜ì¦ˆ 150g(2/3cup) cream cheese
ì„¤íƒ• 23g(5tsp) sugar
í”Œë ˆì¸ ìš”ê±°íŠ¸ 8g(1/2Tbsp) plain yogurt
ìš°ìœ  15g(1Tbsp) milk
ë ˆëª¬ì¦™ 3g(1/2tsp) lemon juice
ìƒí¬ë¦¼ 100g(1/3cup plus 2tsp) heavy cream
 
*ë¼ì¦ˆë² ë¦¬ Extra Raspberry
 í—ˆë¸Œ Herbs
 
[Raspberry Puree]
1. In a pan, put frozen or fresh raspberry, sugar, and lemon juice. Bring It on medium heat, and keep stirring until all raspberries are mushed together about 6~8 min.
2. Strain seeds. Keep it in room temp until use.
 
[Raspberry Jelly]
1. In a pan, put raspberry puree and sugar, and bring heat to boil.
2. When it starts boiling, remove from the heat and add gelatin powder in it. Mix until all gelatin is melted.
3. Pour into the greased square pan, and chill it about 2 hours in fridge.
 
[Cookie Layer]
1. Put the digestive biscuit in a sealing bag, and smash with rolling pin until it is fine grain.
2. Transfer to the bowl, and add melted unsalted butter and whisk until texture is like wet sand.
3. In 6.5cm(2.5inch) round mousse pan, pack the cookie crumble tightly.
4. Refrigerate until use.
 
[Raspberry Cheese Mousse]
*Using gelatin powder: Soak the gelatin into 52g(3 1/2Tbsp) of water for 5 min.
Using gelatin sheet: Soak the gelatin into ice-cold water for 8-10min.
1. Lightly whip the heavy cream, for 1min 30 ~ 2min at high speed.
2. Put cream cheese, and sugar in the bowl, and whip until all combined.
3. Add plain yogurt, and raspberry puree and mix.
4. Microwave prepared gelatin until melted, about 30sec to 1 min. Add into the raspberry mousse mixture and mix.
5. Put lightly whipped cream and mix until well combined.
6. Pour into the mousse pan, about half of the pan. Refrigerate about 1 hour until semi harden.
 
[Plain Cheese Mousse]
*Using gelatin powder: Soak the gelatin into 52g(3 1/2Tbsp) of water for 5 min.
Using gelatin sheet: Soak the gelatin into ice-cold water for 8-10min.
1. Lightly whip the heavy cream, for 1min 30 ~ 2min at high speed.
2. Put cream cheese, and sugar in the bowl, and whip until all combined.
3. Add plain yogurt, lemon juice, and milk and mix.
4. Microwave prepared gelatin until melted, about 30sec to 1 min. Add into the raspberry mousse mixture and mix.
5. Put lightly whipped cream and mix until well combined.
 
[Assemble]
1. Cut the raspberry jelly about 4cm round.
2. Place the raspberry jelly onto the chilled raspberry cheese mousse.
3. On that, Pour the plain cheese mousse. Refrigerate 2 hours until fully harden.
4. Remove from the mousse pan, and decorate with raspberry and herb(thyme).

snippet.title: THREE INGREDIENTS Vanilla CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e Recipe w/ Vanilla Ice CreamğŸ¦: No Torch & Cream | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
4 servings
300g(2cups) vanilla ice cream*
4 egg yolks
60g(4Tbsp) sugar

Preheat the oven to 160C / 325F
1. Melt the vanilla ice cream using a stove or microwave(I used the microwave).
2. Put yolk into melted ice cream and mix, one at a time.
3. Transfer into the ramekin dish. Put the ramekins in tray or baking pan, and fill the baking tray with boiling water, about one third. Bake for 40-50min.
4. After came out of the oven, cool down for a 10-20min. Refrigerate until fully chilled.
5. In a pan, melt the sugar in medium-low heat. Once sugar is fully melted and browned, pour onto the ramekin and swirl to coat evenly. And let it sit for 1-2min.

*I used almost whole 500ml of ice cream. Make sure â€˜300gâ€™ is not same as â€˜300mlâ€™.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients

23g(1 1/2Tbsp) water

+Pudding
3 eggs
450g(2cup minus 2Tbsp) milk
75g(5Tbsp) sugar

1. In a pan, put sugar and water. Turn the heat to medium-low. When sugars all dissolved and gets golden brown to brown, turn off the heat and add water.   Pour the syrup into the ramekin.
2. In a pan or pot, put milk and sugar. Turn the heat too low. When sugars all dissolved and side of the milk gets slightly bubbly, remove the heat.
3. Crack the eggs and pour into the milk mixture. While putting the egg, keep stirring it to prevent the eggs get cooked. Strain the pudding mixture and pour into the ramekin.
4. Place the ramekins into the pot, and fill the pan with warm water. Using a cotton cloth or aluminum foil, cover the ramekins. Cover the pan with lid, turn the heat to high and steam it about 6 min. Turn off the heat and rest for about 1~2 min, with the lid on. After that, cool down in the room temp and put it in a fridge until serve (at least 3 hours).

2.5g(1/2tsp) vanilla extract
pinch of salt

+Strawberry sauce
160g(5.6oz) strawberries

4. Strain the mixture and pour into a glass  and refrigerate until set, up to 4 hours.
5. For make strawberry sauce, put all ingredients in the sauce pan and boil until all strawberries are mushy, for about 10 min. Strain the sauce and put it in a fridge until use.

Hello, Hailey again!
In this video, I made caramel crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e.

I really wanna make this since last year.
But for make creme brulee, you know, have to use torch.
I was so scared to use torch. But early this year, I learned how to use torch to the chef i worked with.
Since then, Iâ€™ve been making some grapefruit with caramelized sugar, and making a creme brÃ»lÃ©e like this!

Unlike the original creme brÃ»lÃ©e recipe, I also put egg white.
As you can see, It looks like slightly dense when i scooped.
It is not because of the egg white, thatâ€™s because burned the sugar overtime (taste great tho.)

Tho I put sugar on top of that, but itâ€™s not insanely-sweet. Because as you can see recipe down below, I didnâ€™t add much sugar on the pudding part. 
It taste like I can eat all of them in one day. You should try it!

sugar

1. In a pan, put heavy cream and vanilla bean. Put the low heat until it gets boil. 
2. Place the sugar into the pan, turn the medium-high heat until all sugar is melted. Don't stir it while heated.

5. Sieve the mixture and pour into the souffle pan.
6. Place the souffle pan into a large-oven pan. And fill with hot water. Bake 150C / 310F for 40~45min. 
7. Cool down the creme brÃ»lÃ©e completely. Before you eat, sprinkle some sugar on top and melt with torch.

snippet.description:
Hello, Itâ€™s Hailey.
Todayâ€™s menu is earl grey chocolate panna cotta.
You may know, earl grey and panna cotta are two of my favorite things to make with.
I LOVED this recipe, so I really want you guys try it!

Earl grey panna cotta is not that sweet recipe. itâ€™s good to eat with chocolate mousse.
But it is dessert, taste sweet, of course. So if you wanna eat less sweet than, reduce 1tsp of sugar.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients(ì•½ 4ì¸ë¶„)
+Earl Grey Panna Cotta
240ml(1cup) milk
6g(2tsp) gelatin powder
30g(2Tbsp) water
35g(2Tbsp plus 1tsp) sugar
2 earl grey teabags
240g(1cup) heavy cream
2.5g(1/2tsp) vanilla extract
pinch of salt

+Chocolate Mousse
100g(1/3cup plus 4tsp) heavy cream
100g(3.5oz) dark chocolate

1. Put the water into gelatin powder and let stand for 5 min.
2. Put the saucepan over a low heat with milk, sugar, salt and earl grey teabags.
3. When milk is simmering, turn off the heat and put off the teabags. Add gelatin, vanilla extract and heavy cream. Stir until all gelatin lumps are dissolved. 
4. Pour into a glass  and refrigerate until set, up to 4 hours.
5. In a bowl, put heavy cream and whip lightly. And add melted dark chocolate and mix until all corporate. 
6. Pour the mixture onto semi-firmed panna cotta. Refrigerate again at least 2~3 hours.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients

snippet.title: Avocado shaped Matcha Mousse : April fool's day ì•„ë³´ì¹´ë„ ë…¹ì°¨ë¬´ìŠ¤ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : http://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     http://bit.ly/2zdyjxf
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : http://bit.ly/1qjCp8o

âœ¨ Click here for my latest video(My Favorite Pancake Recipe) : http://bit.ly/2Gm9Ute

âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!


Hello, itâ€™s hailey again!
April 1st is just around the corner. In 2016, I made chicken shaped cake pop. Following 2016, I made avocado shaped matcha mousse!
This mousse is inspired by avocado cake in UNAS (dessert cafe in korea) 

For avocado shell, scoop the avocado meat and wash out. Donâ€™t dry completely, just wipe out some water with kitchen paper. If you dry completely, your avocado shell can be cracky. Store in fridge before you use it!

This mousse recipe is not that sweet, so itâ€™s goes well with red bean paste.
I think ganache will be more like avocado seed. But red bean paste is a proper use of matcha, so I used it!

If you just make matcha mousse without red bean paste, than I prefer to add more sugar for egg yolk! (25g(5tsp) will be fine)


ğŸŒ™Ingredients (4 mousse in a avocado)
6g(3 sheet) sheet gelatin
100g(1/3cup plus 4tsp) milk
5g(1 1/2tsp) matcha powder
1 egg (separated)
20g(4tsp) sugar (for egg white)
20g(4tsp) sugar (for egg yolk)
80g(1/3cup) heavy cream
red bean paste

1. Soak gelatin in cold water.
2. Mix matcha with milk in a pan, put on a low heat.
3. Mix egg yolk and sugar until pale.
4. Pour hot milk into the egg mixture.
5. Sieve the liquid into a pan, and place on a low heat until semi-boiling.
6. Remove form the heat and add gelatin. Leave to cool and whip the cream into soft peaks and fold into the matcha mixture.
7. Make meringue with the egg white and the sugar until soft peak, and fold into the matcha mixture.
8. Pour the mousse into a cup or bowl, and chill for about 2~3 hours.

snippet.title: Corn Cheese Tart Recipe ì½˜ì¹˜ì¦ˆ íƒ€ë¥´íŠ¸ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
10~12 servings
-pastry crust
ì¤‘ë ¥ë¶„ 280g(2cups) all-purpose flour
ì„¤íƒ• 30g(2Tbsp) sugar
ì†Œê¸ˆ 8g(1tsp) salt
ì°¨ê°€ìš´ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„°(ê¹ëšì°ê¸° í•´ ì¤€ë¹„) 170g(3/4cup) chilled unsalted butter (cube-sized)
ê³„ë€ 2 eggs

-corn cheese filling
í†µì¡°ë¦¼ ì˜¥ìˆ˜ìˆ˜ 340g(12oz) canned corn
ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„° 15g(1Tbsp) unsalted butter
ì†Œê¸ˆ 2g(1/4tsp) salt
ë§ˆìš”ë„¤ì¦ˆ 30g(2Tbsp) mayonnaise
ëª¨ì§œë ë¼ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ 220g(1cup) mozzarella cheese
í›„ì¶”ê°€ë£¨ Ground pepper

ëª¨ì§œë ë¼ ì¹˜ì¦ˆ Extra mozzarella cheese or any kind of cheese you prefer
íŒŒìŠ¬ë¦¬ Parsley

1. In a bowl, put all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, and cube-sized chilled unsalted butter. Using the scraper, cut the butter(or rub with fingers) into small piece, like pea-sized.
2. Add eggs and mix until came out one dough.
3. Chill it in a fridge for about 1 hour.
4. Drain the canned corn, and mix with butter, salt, mayo, mozzarella cheese, and ground pepper. Set aside in room temp before use.
5. Preheat the oven for 200C / 400F.
6. Divide the dough into 8~10 pieces, and roll the dough on a floured surface. Place it into the cavity of a muffin pan. Use finger, press the dough to evenly flatten against the bottom and sides of the cavity. Make sure as even as you can.
7. Fill the crust shell with corn cheese filling. Sprinkle extra cheese and parsley. Bake in the oven for 20~22 min or air frying 190C / 375F for 25min.

+To make a fruit syrup
-Fast : Cut the fruits into small sizes. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar, and a splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small sizes. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

snippet.title: Gluten Free âœ¨ Black Sesame Cream Puff w. rice flour : í‘ì„ì ìŠˆí¬ë¦¼ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
ğŸŒ™Subscribe  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/SweetHailey
ğŸŒ™ Instagram : @sweethailey_     â€ªhttp://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
ğŸŒ™ Blog  : â€ªhttp://bit.ly/1qjCp8o

âœ¨ Give this video a thumbs up if you enjoyed it!

âœ¨ I'm not a native English speaker, sorry for my bad English description.
âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!

 
ğŸŒ™Ingredients
50g(3 1/2tbsp) unsalted butter
100ml(1/3cup plus 4tsp) water
Pinch of salt
50g(1/3cup) rice flour
2 eggs

250ml(1cup) heavy cream
10g(1/2Tbsp) black sesame paste
25g(5tsp) sugar

-option
Melted dark chocolate
Melted white chocolate
Melted pink(strawberry flavor) chocolate

Before you make : Preheat the oven to 180C / 355F
1. In a pot, put water, salt, and unsalted butter. Melt the butter in low heat.
2. When the butter is all melted, remove from the heat. Add rice flour and mix.
3. Place back to the stove, and mix in low heat. When butter comes out from the dough, itâ€™s time to remove the heat.
4. Add eggs, one at a time, mix until smooth.
5. Transfer the batter into a piping bag. Squeeze the batter on a baking sheet, about 5cm(2inch) round shape. Bake for 30~35min. While it is bake, donâ€™t open the oven.
6. In a bowl, put heavy cream, black sesame paste, and sugar. Mix until it gets a stiff peak. Transfer into the piping bag.
7. Slice the top of the puff, on that, decorate with chocolate. (I tried to make into the Halloween-ish design, but it failed.) And fill the puff with black sesame cream. Place the top of the puff and finish.

âœ¨ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ëœ ë”ë³´ê¸°ë€ì„ ë³´ê³ ì‹¶ìœ¼ì‹œë‹¤ë©´ ìœ íŠœë¸Œ ì‚¬ìš©ì–¸ì–´ë¥¼ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ë°”ê¿”ì„œ í™•ì¸í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”!


ğŸŒ™Ingredients
120g(1 1/2cups) rolled oats
45g(1/4cup) pumpkin seeds
75g(1/2cup) roughly chopped almonds
66g(1/2cup) chopped dried prunes
35g(1/2cup) shredded coconut

1g(1/4tsp) ground cinnamon
2g(1/4tsp) salt
80g(1/4cup) maple syrup
55g(1/4cup) coconut oil

Before you make : Chop almonds and dried prunes. Preheat the oven in 160C / 320F
1. In a bowl, put rolled oats, pumpkin seeds, roughly chopped almonds, ground cinnamon, salt, maple syrup, and coconut oil. Stir to coat well.
2. Transfer the mixture to the pan and spread evenly. Bake for 15min.
3. When it came out in the oven, add shredded coconut and dried prunes, toss well until fully corporated. And back to the oven, bake another 5~10 min, until it gets golden brown color.
4. Chill it on a cooling rack. Store in an airtight container in room temp for up to 1 month.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
2 eggs
320g(1 1/3cup) milk
93g(2/3cup) pastry flour
10g(2tsp) melted unsalted butter
10g(2tsp) sugar
Pinch of salt

100g(1/3cup plus 4tsp) heavy cream
10g(2tsp) cream cheese
10g(2tsp) sugar

Figs
Fig jam
Honey
Herb(thyme)

Cooking oil

1. In a bowl, put flour, sugar, and salt. Whisk lightly. 
2. Add eggs and mix until well combined. And add milk, 2/3cup at a time. Pour melted unsalted butter and mix. Keep it in a fridge at least 30 min.
3. In medium-low heat, drizzle some cooking oil and coat with a kitchen towel. Pour the batter into a pan, very thinly. When the surface is dry, flip the crepe. And cook about another 1~1min 30sec. 
4. Put heavy cream, sugar, and cream cheese into a bowl or container. Whip until stiff peak.
5. Serve the crepes with cream cheese cream, fig, fig jam, honey and garnish with herbs.

ğŸŒ™Menu
Real Melonade : ice, melon syrup, melon(melon cube, melon slice), soda water, thyme
Affogato : yogurt ice cream, espresso coffee, rosemary, thyme, cocoa powder
Vanilla Marble Latte : ice, water, espresso coffee, milk
Peach Yogurt : granola, plain yogurt, peach, ice cream, thyme
Hong Kong Style Milk Tea : ice, black tea syrup, milk, espresso coffee

+To make fruit syrup
-Fast : Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. You can use any kind of sugar, glucose, oligosaccharide, etc.. I prefer to use half plain white sugar and half oligosaccharide. Turn the heat to low, mix fruits, sugar, and a splash of lemon juice all together until thickened (Make with less than 150g, it took 8min or less.)
-Preserved : Prepare the water bath jar. Cut the fruits into small size. Measure the fruits and prepare the same amount of sugar. In a bowl, mix fruits and sugar. Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

ğŸŒ™Ingredients
3 lemon
5 kiwi fruit
700g(3 1/2cup) sugar

Before you make
1. Sprinkle baking powder into the fruits and rub gently. Pour the water and let it set for 10~15 min. After that, in boiling water, add a tablespoon of vinegar and put a lemon for about 3~5sec and get that out. This process is to clean the skin of the fruit from the pesticide or bad chemicals.
2. In a pot, pour water(not VERY cold). Place the glass jar upside down. Bring it to boil. Once itâ€™s boiling, turn off the heat and remove the jar. Chill that out and let air-dry it.

1. Slice the lemon thinly.
2. Scoop the kiwi fruit, and dice it.
3. In a bowl, add sliced lemon and kiwi. Add sugar and mix nicely.
4. Once sugar gets all the moist, transfer into the dried jar.
5. Keep it in the fridge for 3~7 days, until all sugars are dissolved. And drink/eat with water, sparkling water, or soft drinks you like.

1. Strawberry Sauce: Put strawberries in a bowl and mash them, then add sugar and lemon juice and mix. Store at room temperature until the sugar dissolves, about 1 hour.
2. Prepare 2-3 strawberries by cutting them in half without cutting the stems. Chop the rest of the strawberries.
3. Mascarpone Cream : Lightly mix room temperature mascarpone cheese with a spatula.
4. Add sugar to the whipped cream and whip about 80% with a hand mixer.
5. Add 1/3 of whipped cream to mascarpone cheese and mix lightly with a spatula. Add the rest of the whipped cream and mix evenly. Prepare the finished cream by putting it in a piping bag.
6. Spread about 2 tablespoons of strawberry sauce in a container, and put 2 ladyfingers on top. On top of that, put strawberry sauce and put chopped strawberries. Squeeze the mascarpone cream on top and clean the top with a spatula. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
7. Finished tiramisu with sugar powder and halved strawberries.

1. Add gelatin powder to cold water and bloom for 5 minutes.
2. Put sugar, salt, and water in a pot and place on medium heat. Heat until all the sugar is dissolved.
3. When all the sugar is dissolved, add gelatin, swirl lightly, and turn off the heat.
4. Transfer the sugar mixture to a bowl and let it cool for 5-7 minutes.
5. Whip at high speed using a whipper. Add red food coloring in the middle and whip again. Whip for about 10 minutes, in total, until lumpy. Transfer the marshmallow to a piping bag.
6. After mixing starch and sugar powder, sprinkle lightly on parchment paper or a Teflon sheet.
7. Squeeze marshmallows into a heart shape. Then sprinkle starch and powdered sugar on the top.

1. Put dark chocolate, white chocolate, and blueberry flavor chocolate in a large piping bag. Seal it with tape.
2. Put piping bags with chocolate in a large bowl and pour hot water. Sit for 5 minutes until the chocolate is melted.
3. When the chocolate is completely melted, cut the piping bag and then add 1~2 tablespoons of chocolate to the half-sphere silicone mold. Apply evenly with a spoon / spatula / brush. Let it set in the fridge for 5 minutes, then apply again. Apply a total of 3-4 times to make a solid half-sphere.
4. Put the oven tray at 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit) for 5 minutes to prepare it hot. Separate the chocolate from the silicone mold.
5. Add 1~2 tablespoons of hot chocolate mix, dehydrated marshmallows, and sprinkles inside the half-sphere chocolate.
6. Place the other half of the chocolate on a hot oven tray, melt it slightly, and place it on top of the chocolate with hot chocolate. If there is a gap, it is good to apply melted chocolate to completely sealed. Sprinkle chocolate and sprinkles on the top to finish.

1. Put water in a pot and heat it over medium heat. When the water starts to boil, remove it from the heat. In another pot or bowl, prepare ice water.
2. Place a glass, stainless steel bowl on a pot, and then temper the chocolate.
First, melt the chocolate to 40~45 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 45~50 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate), then cool down the temp with ice-cold water until 25~26 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration), 27~28 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate). In warm water, melt the chocolate by raising the temperature to 29~30 degrees Celsius (white chocolate, raspberry inspiration) and 31~32 degrees Celsius (dark chocolate) using a hot water bath. Prepare the tempered chocolate in a piping bag.

* Melting temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Cooling temperature ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Working temperature
White Chocolate / Raspberry Inspiration: 40 ~45 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 25~26 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 29~30 degrees Celsius
Dark chocolate: 45~50 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 27~28 degrees Celsius ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» 31~32 degrees Celsius

3. Squeeze the chocolate into the bark chocolate mold and decorate it with dried fruit (orange chips, grapefruit chips, raspberry holes, strawberry slices) or Oreos, pretzel, nuts (almonds).
*Oreo Chocolate: Crush 4~5 Oreos. Add the crushed oreo to 80 g of tempered white chocolate and mix together. Fill in the bark chocolate mold to harden.

snippet.title: ONLY TWO INGREDIENTS! Heart Shaped Sugar Cookies : Valentine's Day Recipe | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
= INGREDIENTS =
215g(1 1/2cup) pancake pre-mix
100g(7Tbsp) unsalted butter (room temp)

Red food coloring (optional)
White chocolate (for decoration, optional)
Any kind of flour you have 

1. In a bowl, put butter and mix until creamy.
2. Add pancake mix and mix until combined. And put red food coloring, and mix.
3. On a floured surface, roll out the dough. Use a cookie cutter and cut as many as possible. Place the shapes on a cookie pan.
4. Refrigerate / freeze for 10min. Bake 180C / 355F for 8~10min.
5. After chilled, decorate with melted white chocolate
