snippet.title: Strawberry Chocolate Fondue : Valentine's Day Recipe ë”¸ê¸° ì´ˆì½” íë“€ | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
= INGREDIENTS =
16~20 strawberries
160g(1cup) strawberry-flavored chocolate (or pink couverture chocolate, candy melts, etc.)
50g(1/4cup) white chocolate (or candy melts)
Popping sugar
Sugar pearl sprinkles
Strawberry flavored cookie crunchy (cookie crunky in Korea)
white chocolate for decor

Before you make : washing and drying strawberries
1. Melt strawberry and white chocolate using a double boiler. 
2. Withholding the stem, dip the strawberry into the melted chocolate. And leave it on parchment paper.
  1) After dip in melted chocolate, dip again in a popping sugar.
  2) Dip again in strawberry-flavored cookie crunchy
  3) Sprinkle some sugar pearl sprinkles
  4) Drizzle some melted white chocolate
After decoration, leave it to cool down.

1. íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ í‹€ì— ìœ ì‚°ì§€ë¥¼ ê¹ë‹¤. ì˜¤ë¸ì„ ì„­ì”¨ 175ë„(í™”ì”¨ 350ë„) ë¡œ ì˜ˆì—´í•œë‹¤.

4. ë°•ë ¥ë¶„, ë² ì´í‚¹íŒŒìš°ë”ë¥¼ ì²´ì³ ë„£ê³ , ì†Œê¸ˆ, ì½”ì½”ë„›ê°€ë£¨, ì½”ì½”ë„›ë°€í¬ë¥¼ ë„£ê³  ìŠ¤íŒ¨ì¶œëŸ¬ë¡œ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë‚ ê°€ë£¨ê°€ ë³´ì´ì§€ ì•Šì„ ë•Œ ê¹Œì§€ ìŠ¤íŒ¨ì¶œëŸ¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ë– ì˜¬ë¦¬ë“¯ì´ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤.
5. ìœ ì‚°ì§€ë¥¼ ê¹ íŒ¬ì— ë°˜ì£½ì„ ë¶“ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë°˜ì£½ì€ ë³´íŠ¸ ëª¨ì–‘, Uìë¡œ ì±„ì›Œë„£ëŠ”ë‹¤. ë‚˜ì´í”„ í˜¹ì€ ì¹¼ì„ ì´ìš©í•´ ë°˜ì£½ì˜ í•œê°€ìš´ë° ì„¸ë¡œì„ ì„ ê¸‹ëŠ”ë‹¤. ì˜ˆì—´í•œ ì˜¤ë¸ì—ì„œ 45~50ë¶„ê°„ êµ½ëŠ”ë‹¤. (ì´ì‘¤ì‹œê°œë¥¼ ë°˜ì£½ì— ê½‚ì•˜ì„ ë•Œ ë°˜ì£½ì´ ë¬»ì–´ë‚˜ì§€ ì•Šì„ ë•Œ ê¹Œì§€).
6. êµ¬ìš´ íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ëŠ” ì‹¤ì˜¨ì—ì„œ ì¶©ë¶„íˆ ì‹íŒ ë‹¤ìŒ, í‹€ì—ì„œ ë¶„ë¦¬í•œë‹¤.
7. ìŠˆê°€íŒŒìš°ë”, ì½”ì½”ë„›ë°€í¬ë¥¼ ê·¸ë¦‡ì— ë„£ê³  ì˜ ì„ëŠ”ë‹¤. (ì½”ì½”ë„› ì•„ì´ì‹±)
8. ì½”ì½”ë„› ì•„ì´ì‹±ì„ ì½”ì½”ë„› íŒŒìš´ë“œì¼€ì´í¬ ìœ—ë©´ì— ë°”ë¥´ê³ , ì½”ì½”ë„›ë¡±ì„ ë¿Œë¦°ë‹¤. ì²´ë¦¬ë¥¼ ì´ìš©í•´ ì¥ì‹í•œë‹¤.

1. Place parchment paper on the pound cake pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put room temp butter in a bowl and use a whipper to gently beat it at low speed.
3. Add sugar and whip on medium speed for about 1 min 30 sec. Add eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Sift in the cake flour, add baking powder, salt, coconut powder, and coconut milk and mix with a spatula. Use a spatula to mix until no raw flour is visible.
5. Pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper. Fill the batter into a boat-shaped, U-shape. Use a knife to draw a vertical line in the middle of the batter. Bake in a preheated oven for 45-50 minutes. (Until the dough no longer sticks when you insert a toothpick into the batter).
6. After the baked pound cake is sufficiently cooled to room temperature, remove it from the pan.
7. Put icing powder and coconut milk in a bowl and mix well. (Coconut Icing)
8. Apply coconut icing on coconut pound cake and sprinkle coconut long. Garnish with cherries.


/ MUSIC /
Running Errands - TrackTribe

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare a 15cm(6-inch) round pan with parchment paper.
2. Put white chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I stir and microwave every 30 sec - 30 sec - 20 sec)
3. When the white chocolate is completely melted, add the sifted cake flour and cheddar cheese powder and mix evenly.
4. Whip the eggs in a bowl. When the eggs start to bubble, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until ivory-colored (about 3 min 30 sec).
5. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Pour in all remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly.
6. Pour the finished batter into a pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
7. Put the white chocolate in a microwaved bowl and melt the chocolate. Add cheddar cheese powder to the melted chocolate and mix, then add room temperature heavy cream and mix evenly. Pour the finished cheddar cheese ganache over the yellow cheese gateau chocolat.
8. Put whipped cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until it gets soft peak. Put the whipped cream on top of the finished cheddar cheese gateau chocolat.

1. Put the room temp cream cheese in a bowl and loosen it lightly. Add sugar and mix once more.
2. Add 1 egg and mix, then add sifted cake flour and lemon juice and mix again.
3. Add fresh cream and mix to complete.
4. Put the brownie batter on a pan lined with parchment paper and put the cheesecake batter on it to complete it.
5. Bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 min. After cooling the baked cheesecake brownie to room temperature, store it in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before eating.

ğŸ§¡Custard Cream
ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Recipe : [https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY](https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY)

ğŸ§¡Cookies for Cookie Choux
1. Put sugar, room temp unsalted butter, and cake flour in a bowl and mix with a spatula until the flour is no longer visible.
2. Put the dough on a silicone mat or parchment paper, and cover it with plastic or parchment paper.
3. Roll out to 0.3cm thickness using a rolling pin and refrigerate for 30 min.
4. After refrigeration, cut with a 5cm circular cutter.

ğŸ§¡Choux(Puff Pastry) for Cookie Choux
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put milk, water, salt, sugar, and unsalted butter in a saucepan and heat over low heat until the butter is completely melted.
3. When the butter is all melted, turn off the heat and add cake flour. Mix with a spatula until no more flour is visible.
4. Put back on low heat and mix with a spatula until the dough becomes a smooth lump.
5. Remove the dough from the heat, then transfer to a bowl. Allow the dough to cool at room temperature for 5~8 min.
6. Add eggs little by little and mix until the texture is thick. Transfer the batter to a piping bag.
7. Squeeze into 4-5cm size on parchment paper. Place cookie dough on top of it.
8. Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes until the top turns golden brown. Cool the finished cookie choux on a cooling rack.

ğŸ§¡Assembly
1. Prepare strawberries by washing them and removing the stems.
2. Cut 1/3 of the cookie choux top part using a bread knife.
3. Squeeze some custard cream inside the cookie choux and put strawberry on top. Then, completely fill the inside of the cookie choux with custard cream. Cover the cut cookie choux lid.

ğŸ‹ sponge cake
1. Prepare 2 cake pans with parchment paper or butter. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Sift the cake flour and baking powder.
2. Put soft unsalted butter in a bowl and whip until soft like mayonnaise texture.
3. Add sugar and mix. Then add the eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Add the sifted dry ingredients and milk and mix evenly.
5. Transfer the batter to each cake pan and bake in a preheated oven for 25~30 minutes until the inside is completely cooked.

ğŸ‹  lemon curd
1. Prepare zest by grinding the peel of 1 lemon that has been washed. Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the lemon juice.
2. Mix lemon zest, sugar, egg and lemon juice in a bowl.
3. Mix the lemon mixture with double boiler until it feels lumpy (about 7 minutes).
4. When it gets lumpy texture, remove from the double boiler and mix with unsalted butter.
5. Cover the finished lemon curd with cling film and refrigerate until completely cooled.

ğŸ‹ Whipped cream & finishing victoria sponge cake
1. Put heavy cream and sugar together in a bowl and whip at high speed until it gets stiff peak.
2. Flatten the top of the sponge cake.
3. Place lemon curd and whipped cream on the sponge cake, then place the sponge cake on top. On top of that, put lemon curd and whipped cream again, and put strawberries and decorative thyme (herb) on top to complete it.

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare 15cm round pan with parchment paper.
2. Sift the cake flour and cocoa powder.
3. Put dark chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I mixed every 40-30 sec I microwaved, 1000w)
4. When the chocolate is completely melted, add the cake flour and cocoa powder and mix evenly.
5. Whip the eggs in another bowl. When the eggs start to foamy, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add half of the remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until they are fluffy and get ivory-colored.
6. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Then pour the chocolate mixture over the remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly to complete.
7. Pour the batter into a round pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 27~30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
8. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until gets soft peak.
9. Put whipped cream and strawberries on top of the Gateau au chocolat.

âœ¨Making puff pastry:
1. Cut the cold butter into cubes.
2. Put all-purpose flour, salt and butter in a bowl and mix with a scraper as like cutting butter.
3. Add water little by little and knead the dough into one lump. Add water, adjusting it just enough to make it clump together.
4. Divide the finished dough in half (optional), then wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5. Sprinkle flour on the rested dough, and then spread the dough into a rectangular shape. Fold the dough into thirds and rest in the fridge for 20 minutes (repeat 3 times in total).

âœ¨Making almond cream:
1. Put room temperature unsalted butter in a bowl and loosen it. Add sugar and mix, then add eggs and mix again. Add almond powder and mix gently. Put the finished almond cream in a piping bag.

âœ¨Making galette de rois:
1. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Spread puff pastry thinly (2-4mm). Cut the dough using an 18cm round mold.
3. Squeeze the almond cream, leaving about 1cm of the edge of the puff pastry. Brush the edges with egg yolk, then cover with another puff pastry.
4. Use a butter knife to shape the edges of the galette de rois. Coat the top with egg yolk. Leave for 1~2min to harden.
5. Use a skewer or toothpick to shape the top.
6. Bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes until the top is golden. (If the color is too burnt, cover the galette de rois with foil, etc., and bake.

1. Prepare by sieving the all-purpose flour.
2. Put cream cheese and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix well.
3. Add sugar, salt, and vanilla extract and mix with a whisk.
4. Add the sifted all-purpose flour and mix with a spatula until it forms a lump, then divide the dough into two pieces and rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
5. For the filling, mix brown sugar, sugar, cinnamon powder, and chopped walnuts.
6. After resting the dough, sprinkle flour on the table and spread it thinly into a 22-24cm circle.
7. Put the apricot jam on top and sprinkle the filling on it.
8. Cut the dough into 12-16 equal parts, and roll it up from the outside.
9. Rest the rugelach in the refrigerator for 30 min before baking.
10. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
11. Before baking, sprinkle sugar on the top of the Rugelach and bake in a preheated oven for 15~20 minutes.

- Basic Financier
1. Put the butter in a pot and heat it over medium heat until the color of the butter darkens. Cooldown until the temp drops below 50 degrees Celsius (120 degrees Fahrenheit, mine took 10-15 minutes).
2. Sift the cake flour and almond powder together.
3. Mix egg whites and sugar in a bowl, then add the sifted dry ingredients and mix.
4. Divide the butter into 2 times and mix. Put the finished batter in a piping bag and rest for at least 1 hour in the fridge.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Grease the pan with butter.
6. Fill 70-80% of the pan with the batter.
7. Bake in a preheated oven for 13~15 minutes.

- Fig & Cream Cheese Financiers
1. Prepare semi-dried figs by cutting them into appropriate sizes.
2. After step (6) of basic financier, place semi-dried figs and a small amount of cream cheese on top.
3. Bake in a preheated oven for 13 ~15 minutes.

- Churros Financiers
1. Prepare churros syrup by dissolving sugar in warm water.
2. Prepare churros sugar mix by mixing sugar and cinnamon powder.
3. Apply churros syrup on the finished basic financiers and roll over the churros sugar mix.

1. Place parchment paper on a square pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Crumble: Put the cake flour, almond powder, sugar, and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix by hand.
3. Mix until it becomes lumpy like wet sand, refrigerate until use.
4. Berry Cheesecake: Combine cream cheese and sugar in a bowl and mix until smooth mayonnaise-like texture.
5. Add eggs and mix, then add cake flour and lemon juice and mix evenly.
6. Add heavy cream and mix to finish.
7. Put the mixed berries and sugar in a bowl and mix evenly.
8. Put half of the crumble in a square pan, and press it firmly on the bottom. Place the cheesecake batter on it, and evenly place the mixed berry-sugar mixture. Lastly, add the remaining crumble.
9. Bake in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes. After taking it out from the oven, cool it sufficiently in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours before slice.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Roll Dough
1. Add instant dry yeast to warm water and leave for 5 minutes.
2. Add bread flour, sugar, salt, eggs, and yeast-water and mix lightly. When it starts to lump, add the melted unsalted butter and knead by hand for 17-20 minutes.
3. When the dough becomes soft and smooth, put it in a bowl, cover it, and let it rise at room temperature for 1.5 to 2 hours.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan Caramel
1. Put brown sugar, unsalted butter, and milk in a pan and heat over medium heat. Stir in between until all the sugar is dissolved.
2. When sugar is completely dissolved, remove from heat and pour into pan. Place chopped pecans on top.

ğŸ§¡ Pecan rolls - assembly
1. After rise, use a rolling pin to flatten the dough into 16*20 inches (40*50cm).
2. Spread melted butter on the dough, and sprinkle brown sugar, cinnamon powder, and pecans.
3. After rolling the dough, pinch the end of the dough. Cut the dough into 7-9 equal parts using a knife or dental floss.
4. Place the dough on the pan with pecan caramel. Cover the top with cling film and let it rise at room temperature for 1 hour.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit).
6. After it rises, bake in a preheated oven for 30~35 minutes.
7. Cool the baked caramel pecan rolls slightly, then turn them over in a plate and serve.

1. Prepare parchment paper on the pan. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put the white chocolate and unsalted butter in a bowl and microwave until the chocolate is completely melted.
3. Add sugar and mix, then add earl grey tea and mix.
4. Add eggs and mix evenly.
5. Add the sifted cake flour and mix.
6. Pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper, and bake for 15 minutes in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Cover the top with foil and bake at the same temperature for 23-25 minutes.
7. Store baked brownies in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.

1. Prepare a 15Â cm (6-inch) round pan with parchment paper. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put cream cheese in a bowl and mix lightly. Add instant coffee and sugar and mix well.
3. Add eggs one by one and mix.
4. Add fresh cream and mix, and finally, add cornstarch and mix well.
5. After sieving the batter once, transfer it to the pan.
6. Bake in a preheated oven for 25 minutes, cool at room temperature for at least 1 hour, and then refrigerate overnight (more than 6 hours).
7. In a bowl, add whipped cream and sugar and whip at high speed until soft peak (about 2 minutes), then add mascarpone cheese and whip once more (about 30 seconds).
8. Icing mascarpone cream on top of cooled coffee basque cheesecake. Sprinkle with cocoa powder to finish.

1. Put dark chocolate, white chocolate, and blueberry flavor chocolate in a large piping bag. Seal it with tape.
2. Put piping bags with chocolate in a large bowl and pour hot water. Sit for 5 minutes until the chocolate is melted.
3. When the chocolate is completely melted, cut the piping bag and then add 1~2 tablespoons of chocolate to the half-sphere silicone mold. Apply evenly with a spoon / spatula / brush. Let it set in the fridge for 5 minutes, then apply again. Apply a total of 3-4 times to make a solid half-sphere.
4. Put the oven tray at 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit) for 5 minutes to prepare it hot. Separate the chocolate from the silicone mold.
5. Add 1~2 tablespoons of hot chocolate mix, dehydrated marshmallows, and sprinkles inside the half-sphere chocolate.
6. Place the other half of the chocolate on a hot oven tray, melt it slightly, and place it on top of the chocolate with hot chocolate. If there is a gap, it is good to apply melted chocolate to completely sealed. Sprinkle chocolate and sprinkles on the top to finish.

/ INGREDIENTS /
-strawberry pomegranate ade
Strawberry-inside ice, strawberry pomegranate syrup, thyme, strawberries, soda water

Ice, strawberry milk, matcha powder-mixed with hot water, matcha foam(80g heavy cream + 8g sugar + 1tsp matcha powder)

Ice, milk, black sesame cream(100g heavy cream + 10g sugar + 7g black sesame paste), espresso

Ice, lemon syrup, thyme, sliced lemons, soda water, cockscomb flower-infused tea

-marbled coffee
Small ice cubes, cold water, espresso, milk with 1tsp of heavy cream)

Ice, panda butter cookies, milk, espresso

-Macau style frothy coffee

Rest 5~10min to fruit juice is come out (This process makes syrup faster). Ladle the mixture into a jar and cover the lid. Rest in room temp for 5 hours, and put it in a fridge until all sugar is melted. Preserve oneâ€™s flesh is more fresh and meaty. And syrup texture is more clear, so I prefer to make this way.

= INGREDIENTS =
2tsp instant coffee
3tsp sugar
Hot water

150~200ml milk

1. In a cup, put instant coffee, sugar, and a little bit of hot water.
2. Stir about 7~10min, until frothy.
3. Pour 1tbsp hot water, and mix lightly. Add ice and milk.

- Brownies
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).

4. Add brown sugar and mix. Sift in the cake flour and mix evenly to complete.

- Cheesecake
1. Put the room temp cream cheese in a bowl and loosen it lightly. Add sugar and mix once more.
2. Add 1 egg and mix, then add sifted cake flour and lemon juice and mix again.
3. Add fresh cream and mix to complete.
4. Put the brownie batter on a pan lined with parchment paper and put the cheesecake batter on it to complete it.
5. Bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 min. After cooling the baked cheesecake brownie to room temperature, store it in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before eating.

ğŸ§¡Custard Cream
ğŸ‘‰ğŸ» Recipe : [https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY](https://youtu.be/ZZizKms_OxY)

ğŸ§¡Cookies for Cookie Choux
1. Put sugar, room temp unsalted butter, and cake flour in a bowl and mix with a spatula until the flour is no longer visible.
2. Put the dough on a silicone mat or parchment paper, and cover it with plastic or parchment paper.
3. Roll out to 0.3cm thickness using a rolling pin and refrigerate for 30 min.
4. After refrigeration, cut with a 5cm circular cutter.

ğŸ§¡Choux(Puff Pastry) for Cookie Choux
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put milk, water, salt, sugar, and unsalted butter in a saucepan and heat over low heat until the butter is completely melted.
3. When the butter is all melted, turn off the heat and add cake flour. Mix with a spatula until no more flour is visible.
4. Put back on low heat and mix with a spatula until the dough becomes a smooth lump.
5. Remove the dough from the heat, then transfer to a bowl. Allow the dough to cool at room temperature for 5~8 min.
6. Add eggs little by little and mix until the texture is thick. Transfer the batter to a piping bag.
7. Squeeze into 4-5cm size on parchment paper. Place cookie dough on top of it.
8. Bake in a preheated oven for 30-35 minutes until the top turns golden brown. Cool the finished cookie choux on a cooling rack.

ğŸ§¡Assembly
1. Prepare strawberries by washing them and removing the stems.
2. Cut 1/3 of the cookie choux top part using a bread knife.
3. Squeeze some custard cream inside the cookie choux and put strawberry on top. Then, completely fill the inside of the cookie choux with custard cream. Cover the cut cookie choux lid.

1. Prepare by sieving the all-purpose flour.
2. Put cream cheese and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix well.
3. Add sugar, salt, and vanilla extract and mix with a whisk.
4. Add the sifted all-purpose flour and mix with a spatula until it forms a lump, then divide the dough into two pieces and rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
5. For the filling, mix brown sugar, sugar, cinnamon powder, and chopped walnuts.
6. After resting the dough, sprinkle flour on the table and spread it thinly into a 22-24cm circle.
7. Put the apricot jam on top and sprinkle the filling on it.
8. Cut the dough into 12-16 equal parts, and roll it up from the outside.
9. Rest the rugelach in the refrigerator for 30 min before baking.
10. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
11. Before baking, sprinkle sugar on the top of the Rugelach and bake in a preheated oven for 15~20 minutes.

- Basic Financier
1. Put the butter in a pot and heat it over medium heat until the color of the butter darkens. Cooldown until the temp drops below 50 degrees Celsius (120 degrees Fahrenheit, mine took 10-15 minutes).
2. Sift the cake flour and almond powder together.
3. Mix egg whites and sugar in a bowl, then add the sifted dry ingredients and mix.
4. Divide the butter into 2 times and mix. Put the finished batter in a piping bag and rest for at least 1 hour in the fridge.
5. Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius (375 degrees Fahrenheit). Grease the pan with butter.
6. Fill 70-80% of the pan with the batter.
7. Bake in a preheated oven for 13~15 minutes.

- Fig & Cream Cheese Financiers
1. Prepare semi-dried figs by cutting them into appropriate sizes.
2. After step (6) of basic financier, place semi-dried figs and a small amount of cream cheese on top.
3. Bake in a preheated oven for 13 ~15 minutes.

- Churros Financiers
1. Prepare churros syrup by dissolving sugar in warm water.
2. Prepare churros sugar mix by mixing sugar and cinnamon powder.
3. Apply churros syrup on the finished basic financiers and roll over the churros sugar mix.

1. Place parchment paper on a square pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Crumble: Put the cake flour, almond powder, sugar, and unsalted butter in a bowl and mix by hand.
3. Mix until it becomes lumpy like wet sand, refrigerate until use.
4. Berry Cheesecake: Combine cream cheese and sugar in a bowl and mix until smooth mayonnaise-like texture.
5. Add eggs and mix, then add cake flour and lemon juice and mix evenly.
6. Add heavy cream and mix to finish.
7. Put the mixed berries and sugar in a bowl and mix evenly.
8. Put half of the crumble in a square pan, and press it firmly on the bottom. Place the cheesecake batter on it, and evenly place the mixed berry-sugar mixture. Lastly, add the remaining crumble.
9. Bake in a preheated oven for 25-30 minutes. After taking it out from the oven, cool it sufficiently in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours before slice.

1. Prepare parchment paper on the pan. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put the white chocolate and unsalted butter in a bowl and microwave until the chocolate is completely melted.
3. Add sugar and mix, then add earl grey tea and mix.
4. Add eggs and mix evenly.
5. Add the sifted cake flour and mix.
6. Pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper, and bake for 15 minutes in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Cover the top with foil and bake at the same temperature for 23-25 minutes.
7. Store baked brownies in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours.

1. Preheat the oven to 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare jam by putting it in a piping bag.
2. Mix unsalted butter and icing sugar together in a bowl. Add egg yolk, vanilla extract, and salt together and mix. Finally, add sifted cake flour and mix together.
3. Divide the dough into 1/2~1 Tbsp and roll it into a ball shape. Use your palms to flatten the top, and use your fingers or other cutlery to make a heart shape. Fill the heart shape with jam.
4. Bake in an oven preheated to 160 degrees Celsius (320 degrees Fahrenheit) for 14 ~16 minutes.

/ BANANA PUDDING ë°”ë‚˜ë‚˜ í‘¸ë”© /

1. Pour the milk into the pot, and heat up the milk in medium heat.
2. Put sugar, salt, starch, vanilla extract, and egg yolks into the bowl, whisk until well combined. While mixing, pour the hot milk slowly.
3. Put the egg yolk mixture back into the pot, and gently stir for 1~2min in medium heat. lower the heat to low, and stir an additional 1~2min. Turn off the heat, add unsalted butter and mix well.
4. Transfer the custard cream into the bowl, and wrap the custard. Make sure the plastic wrap can touch the surface of the custard cream (It prevents harden the surface). Keep it in the fridge for at least 1 hour.
5. When the custard cream is fully chilled, In a pudding container, place custard cream, 00, and chopped bananas as much as you want. Refrigerate up to 2 hours.

1. Using an electronic mixer, whip the heavy cream, for 2min at high speed. Add biscoff spread, and whip for 30sec~1min. And add condensed milk, fold with a spatula until well combined.
2. Cover the pan with plastic wrap. Spread the cream in the bottom and side of the pan. Place the cookies vertically. Spread the cream on each of the cookies, and repeat until thereâ€™s no gap inside the pan. When it filled, cover the top of the cookies with cream. Refrigerate for 2 hours at least. Store the leftover cream in the fridge.
3. Take out from the pan, decorate with leftover cream.


/ COOKIE MACARONS ì¿ í‚¤ë§ˆì¹´ë¡± /

ë¼ë©”ë¥´í’€ë¼ë¥´ ì˜¬ì´ˆì½œë¦¿ ì¿ í‚¤ LA MÃ‰RE POULARD tout chocolat 

1. Put egg whites in a bowl and whip. When the egg white starts to foam, add sugar divided into 3 times while whipping. Whisk until the meringue turns shiny and doesnâ€™t fell off when you turn upside down the bowl. 
2. In meringue, add sieved almond flour and icing sugar, and mix gently. Divide the batter in half, add the red and green food coloring each of the batter. Fold gently until falls into a stair shape and the stair-shaped mark lasts 6~8sec when you dropped the batter from the spatula.
3. Transfer the batter into the piping bag, and squeeze it onto the baking sheet. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius(355 degrees Fahrenheit), and bake at 150 degrees Celsius(300 degrees Fahrenheit) for 15min. When itâ€™s come out the oven cools down completely.
4. Crush the cookies into small pieces. Place your favorite buttercream (I used Creme Anglais) on the flat side of the macaron, place the crushed cookies on top of that, and cover with another macaron

snippet.title: I Tried DoubleTree's Secret Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
12~13 cookies

115g(1 stick) unsalted butter(softened)
91g(1/2cup minus 1Tbsp) white sugar
92g(1/3cup plus 1Tbsp) light brown sugar
1 egg
3g(2/3tsp) vanilla extract
Dash of lemon juice
158g(1cup plus 1Tbsp) all-purpose flour
20g(1/4cup) rolled oats
3g(1/2tsp) baking soda
4g(1/2tsp) salt
Pinch of cinnamon
233g(1 1/3cups) semi-sweet chocolate chips
80g(2/3cup) chopped walnuts

1. Cream butter, sugar and brown sugar in the bowl. Using an electric mixer, whip for about 2 min at medium speed.
2. Add eggs, vanilla, and lemon juice, blending with mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, then medium speed for about 2 minutes, or until light and fluffy, scraping down bowl. 
3. With the mixer on low speed, add flour, oats, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon, blending for about 45 seconds. Donâ€™t overmix.
4. Remove bowl from mixer and stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.
5. Portion dough with a scoop (about 3 tablespoons) onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper about 2 inches apart.
6. Preheat oven to 325Â°F / 160Â°C. Bake for 20 to 23 minutes, or until edges are golden brown and center is still soft.
7. Remove from oven and cool on baking sheet for about 1 hour.
*Cookâ€™s note: You can freeze the unbaked cookies, and thereâ€™s no need to thaw. Preheat oven to 300Â°F and place frozen cookies on parchment paper-lined baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake until edges are golden brown and center is still soft.

snippet.title: BEST EVER! Ham Cheese Scones | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
8 scones

310g(2 1/2cups) all-purpose flour
6g(3/4tsp) salt
1g(1/4tsp) ground black pepper
6g(1 1/2tsp) baking powder
70g(1/3cup) light brown sugar
115g(1 stick / 4oz) unsalted butter (cold)
1 egg
120g(1/2cup) plain yogurt
30g(2Tbsp) milk

130g(4.5oz) mild cheddar cheese*
100g(3.5oz) sliced ham
100g(3.5oz) scallions ìª½íŒŒ
(You can add ~50g(1~2oz) more or less)

1. Grate the mild cheddar cheese, chop sliced ham and scallions.
2. Put the all-purpose flour, salt, ground black pepper, baking powder, light brown sugar, and unsalted butter in a bowl. Combine with using a scraper / fork / or your fingers until the mixture comes together in pea-sized crumbs, the texture is like wet sand.
3. Add egg, plain yogurt, and milk, then mix together until half of the dry ingredients are moistened.
4. Put grated cheddar cheese, chopped ham, and scallions. But donâ€™t put all of them, save 1~2Tbsps each for the last touching. Using hand or spatula, fold until no flour is seen. Mix less as you can. Chill in the fridge about 30min ~ up to 24 hours.
5. Preheat the oven for 200C / 395F. Flatten the dough, about 3~5cm(1~2inch) thickness. Using a knife or scraper, cut the dough into 8 slices. Place scones on a lined baking sheet. Sprinkle some saved cheddar cheese, ham, and scallions. Bake for 18~20min, until golden brown. Eat before completely chilled.

*If you're using normal cheddar cheese, reduce the salt to 1/2 tsp.
*More fold you do, gluten disturbs crispness of scone.

snippet.title: Soft & Creamy Chocolate Covered Marshmallow Recipe : Homemade Mallomars | SweetHailey
snippet.description:
/ INGREDIENTS /
35-40 marshmallow biscuits

-Biscuit
90g(6Tbsp and 1tsp) unsalted butter (room temp)
80g(1/4cup plus 2Tbsp) sugar
1 egg
190g(1 1/3cup) pastry flour
Pinch of salt
5g(1tsp) vanilla extract

-Marshmallow fluff
4 egg whites (150g / 5oz approx.)
45g(3Tbsp) sugar
90ml(1/3cup plus 2tsp) water
180g(3/4cup plus 2Tbsp) sugar
120g(1/3cup plus 2Tbsp) corn syrup / oligosaccharide syrup

-Chocolate cover
200-300g(7~10oz) dark / semi-sweet chocolate
5g(1tsp) coconut oil (or cooking oil)

1. For make biscuit: cream the butter, and slowly add sugar and mix. Crack the egg, mix until well combined.
2. Add the sieved pastry flour, salt, and vanilla extract. Fold until no flour seen. Refrigerate at least 1 hour, up to 1 day.
3. Preheat the oven for 355F / 180C. Flour the surface, and roll the dough. Cut with a cookie cutter, about 2inch / 4.5cm. Bake for 8~10min. After bake, chill it on a cooling rack.
4.  For make marshmallow: Beat the egg white until bubbly and fluffy, add 45g of sugar, 1Tbsp at a time. Whip until stiff peak.
5. In a pot, put 180g of sugar, corn syrup, and water. Bring it to boil until 240F / 115C (I took 7min, if you donâ€™t have a thermometer, boil 2min after all sugar melted).
6. Slowly pour the syrup into the meringue(whipped egg white). Whip until fully mixed and fluffy enough. Transfer into the piping bag, with a large tip on immediately. 
7. Piping onto the biscuit. And let it set for 10~15min.
8. Meanwhile, In a microwavable bowl, put dark or semi-sweet chocolate and coconut oil. Microwave until all melted. While microwave, make sure mix every 10~20 sec.
9. Pour the chocolate onto the marshmallow. Leave until solid.
10. Store in an airtight container, up to 5 days in the refrigerator.

*I use only egg white to make marshmallow, so it wasnâ€™t that airy texture like make with gelatin.
*With the same reason - make only with egg white -, you should store in the fridge for safety.

1. Place parchment paper on the pound cake pan. Preheat the oven to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put room temp butter in a bowl and use a whipper to gently beat it at low speed.
3. Add sugar and whip on medium speed for about 1 min 30 sec. Add eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Sift in the cake flour, add baking powder, salt, coconut powder, and coconut milk and mix with a spatula. Use a spatula to mix until no raw flour is visible.
5. Pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper. Fill the batter into a boat-shaped, U-shape. Use a knife to draw a vertical line in the middle of the batter. Bake in a preheated oven for 45-50 minutes. (Until the dough no longer sticks when you insert a toothpick into the batter).
6. After the baked pound cake is sufficiently cooled to room temperature, remove it from the pan.
7. Put icing powder and coconut milk in a bowl and mix well. (Coconut Icing)
8. Apply coconut icing on coconut pound cake and sprinkle coconut long. Garnish with cherries.

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare a 15cm(6-inch) round pan with parchment paper.
2. Put white chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I stir and microwave every 30 sec - 30 sec - 20 sec)
3. When the white chocolate is completely melted, add the sifted cake flour and cheddar cheese powder and mix evenly.
4. Whip the eggs in a bowl. When the eggs start to bubble, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until ivory-colored (about 3 min 30 sec).
5. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Pour in all remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly.
6. Pour the finished batter into a pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
7. Put the white chocolate in a microwaved bowl and melt the chocolate. Add cheddar cheese powder to the melted chocolate and mix, then add room temperature heavy cream and mix evenly. Pour the finished cheddar cheese ganache over the yellow cheese gateau chocolat.
8. Put whipped cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until it gets soft peak. Put the whipped cream on top of the finished cheddar cheese gateau chocolat.

ğŸ‹ sponge cake
1. Prepare 2 cake pans with parchment paper or butter. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Sift the cake flour and baking powder.
2. Put soft unsalted butter in a bowl and whip until soft like mayonnaise texture.
3. Add sugar and mix. Then add the eggs one at a time and whip.
4. Add the sifted dry ingredients and milk and mix evenly.
5. Transfer the batter to each cake pan and bake in a preheated oven for 25~30 minutes until the inside is completely cooked.

ğŸ‹  lemon curd
1. Prepare zest by grinding the peel of 1 lemon that has been washed. Cut the lemon in half and squeeze the lemon juice.
2. Mix lemon zest, sugar, egg and lemon juice in a bowl.
3. Mix the lemon mixture with double boiler until it feels lumpy (about 7 minutes).
4. When it gets lumpy texture, remove from the double boiler and mix with unsalted butter.
5. Cover the finished lemon curd with cling film and refrigerate until completely cooled.

ğŸ‹ Whipped cream & finishing victoria sponge cake
1. Put heavy cream and sugar together in a bowl and whip at high speed until it gets stiff peak.
2. Flatten the top of the sponge cake.
3. Place lemon curd and whipped cream on the sponge cake, then place the sponge cake on top. On top of that, put lemon curd and whipped cream again, and put strawberries and decorative thyme (herb) on top to complete it.

7. ì™„ì„±í•œ ë°˜ì£½ì„ ì›í˜• íŒ¬ì— ë¶€ì–´ì¤€ë‹¤. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  ì„­ì”¨ 170ë„(í™”ì”¨ 340ë„)ë¡œ ì˜ˆì—´í•œ ì˜¤ë¸ì—ì„œ 27~30ë¶„ê°„ êµ½ëŠ”ë‹¤. êµ¬ìš´ í›„ ì‹¤ì˜¨ì—ì„œ 30ë¶„~50ë¶„ê°„ ì‹íŒ ë‹¤ìŒ, ëƒ‰ì¥ê³ ì—ì„œ í•˜ë£»ë°¤ë™ì•ˆ(6ì‹œê°„ ì´ìƒ) ë³´ê´€í•œë‹¤.

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit). Prepare 15cm round pan with parchment paper.
2. Sift the cake flour and cocoa powder.
3. Put dark chocolate, unsalted butter, and milk in a microwaveable bowl and melt it using a microwave. (I mixed every 40-30 sec I microwaved, 1000w)
4. When the chocolate is completely melted, add the cake flour and cocoa powder and mix evenly.
5. Whip the eggs in another bowl. When the eggs start to foamy, add half the sugar. After whipping for 30 sec, add half of the remaining sugar and whip. Whip the eggs until they are fluffy and get ivory-colored.
6. Add 1/3 of the whipped egg to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Then pour the chocolate mixture over the remaining whipped eggs and mix evenly to complete.
7. Pour the batter into a round pan. Then, bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Fahrenheit) for 27~30 minutes. After baking, cool at room temperature for 30~50 minutes, then store in the refrigerator overnight (more than 6 hours).
8. Put heavy cream and sugar in a bowl and whip until gets soft peak.
9. Put whipped cream and strawberries on top of the Gateau au chocolat.

1. Prepare a 15Â cm (6-inch) round pan with parchment paper. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Put cream cheese in a bowl and mix lightly. Add instant coffee and sugar and mix well.
3. Add eggs one by one and mix.
4. Add fresh cream and mix, and finally, add cornstarch and mix well.
5. After sieving the batter once, transfer it to the pan.
6. Bake in a preheated oven for 25 minutes, cool at room temperature for at least 1 hour, and then refrigerate overnight (more than 6 hours).
7. In a bowl, add whipped cream and sugar and whip at high speed until soft peak (about 2 minutes), then add mascarpone cheese and whip once more (about 30 seconds).
8. Icing mascarpone cream on top of cooled coffee basque cheesecake. Sprinkle with cocoa powder to finish.

11. ë¶ˆì„ ë„ê³ , ì„¤íƒ•ê³¼ ì ¤ë¼í‹´ê°€ë£¨ë¥¼ ë„£ê³  ì ¤ë¼í‹´ì´ ë…¹ì„ ë•Œê¹Œì§€ ì €ì–´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”. ê·¸ë¦¬ê³  10~15ë¶„ ê°„ ì‹¤ì˜¨ì—ì„œ ì‹í˜€ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

âœï¸ Earl Grey Genoise
1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Place the parchment paper on the cake pan. Add earl grey tea to warm milk and brew.
2. Put eggs and sugar in a bowl. Put it on a pot of hot water, and whip the batter for 5-7 minutes until it becomes a thin ribbon. Then add the sifted cake flour and mix slowly and gently.
3. In another bowl, add earl grey milk, melted unsalted butter, and a lump of batter and mix evenly. And mix evenly with the original batter.
4. Pour the batter into the cake pan, then tap the bottom a few times to remove air bubbles. Bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit) for 25-30 minutes. Bake until the batter doesn't come out when the toothpick is inserted in the middle. Immediately after coming out of the oven, remove it from the pan. Slice into thirds after cooling completely at room temperature for at least 1~2 hours.

âœï¸ Prepare peaches, simple syrup, whipped cream
5. Prepare peaches by removing the skins and cutting them into appropriate thicknesses. Save the skins to make peach jelly.
6. Prepare simple syrup. Put sugar and water in a bowl and microwave for 40 sec~1 min to melt the sugar. Use it when it reaches room temperature.
7. Next, prepare whipped cream. Place the whipped cream and sugar in a bowl and whip at high speed until stiff peak. When the whipping is almost finished, whip at low speed for 30 seconds to 1 minute to clear air bubbles.

âœï¸ Cake Icing
8. Place a sheet of genoise on the turn table and apply simple syrup. Spread a little whipped cream on top, then place peaches on top. Add whipped cream to completely cover the peaches. Put the next sheet of genoise on top and repeat the same. Lastly, place the remaining genoise, then apply simple syrup and icing again. Icing using a spatula and scraper.
9. Put the remaining whipped cream in a piping bag and decorate the top. Make the decoration in a tight circle shape so that the peach jelly does not overflow on top. After icing, let the cake harden in the refrigerator.

âœï¸ Peach Jelly
10. Add water and peach peel and bring to a boil. Remove the skin when the color on the skin has gone and the water has turned pink.
11. Turn off the heat, add sugar and gelatin powder, and stir until the gelatin is dissolved. Then let cool at room temperature for 10~15 minutes.
10. Pour peach jelly over the cake. And refrigerate for at least 1 hour until the peach jelly is completely hardened.

snippet.title: 3 Types Birthday Teddy Bear Mini Lunch Box Cake Ideas ğŸ‚
snippet.description:
ğŸ“¸ @sweethailey_     http://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
âœ‰ï¸ sweethiley@gmail.com

/ INGREDIENTS /
-American Butter Cream ì•„ë©”ë¦¬ì¹¸ ë²„í„°í¬í‚´
220g(1cup minus 2tsp) unsalted butter(softened) ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„°(ì‹¤ì˜¨)
450g(2+3/4cups) icing sugar ìŠˆê°€íŒŒìš°ë”
Pinch of salt ì†Œê¸ˆ í•œê¼¬ì§‘
20g(4tsp) heavy cream ìƒí¬ë¦¼
6g(1+1/4sp) vanilla extract ë°”ë‹ë¼ ìµìŠ¤íŠ¸ë™
Food coloring ì‹ìš©ìƒ‰ì†Œ

-Simple syrup ì‹¬í”Œì‹œëŸ½
60g(2Tbsp) sugar ì„¤íƒ•
60g(2Tbsp) water ë¬¼

3 mini genoises ë¯¸ë‹ˆ ì œëˆ„ì™€ì¦ˆ (https://youtu.be/V9rQsJKkuIg)
Mango jam ë§ê³ ì¼

1. Put unsalted butter and salt in a bowl and beat it. Add vanilla extract, heavy cream, and icing powder and mix.
2. After mixing well, whip for 5-7 minutes, until it gets thick and fluffy texture.
3. Divide the buttercream into 3 main colors, 3 sub colors, and black and white for the eyes, nose and mouth, a total of 8 parts. Prepare 2 tablespoons for the sub color, and 2 tablespoons for the black and white colors. With remaining buttercream, use all for main colors.
4. Spread a little buttercream (main color) on the turntable, and then place a cake sheet on top. Apply simple syrup to make it moist, icing with a small amount of buttercream, and then put jam on top.
5. Put another cake sheet on top and apply simple syrup. And apply a thin layer of the crumb coat. Let it harden in the refrigerator for 15~20 minutes.
6. Transfer the remaining buttercream to a piping bag with a tip on.
7. Transfer the hardened mini cake to a lunch box, and piping the remaining main color buttercream on the top to form a teddy bear. Make the ears, eyes, nose, and mouth with white and black buttercream, and complete it by adding points with sub-color buttercream.
8. Let the cake harden in the refrigerator and decorate with cones and candles.

*To make simple syrup: Put sugar and water into a microwavable cup or bowl, and microwave until all sugars are dissolved.

snippet.title: Milky Teddy Bear Cream Cake Recipe (w. French Cream)
snippet.description:
ğŸ“¸ @sweethailey_     http://bit.ly/2zdyjxf 
âœ‰ï¸ sweethiley@gmail.com

ìœ ëŸ½ì—°í•©(EU)ê³¼ í”„ë‘ìŠ¤ êµ­ë¦½ë‚™ë†í˜‘ì˜íšŒ(CNIEL)ê°€ ì£¼ìµœí•˜ëŠ” 'Ceram of Europe'ì˜ ìº í˜ì¸ ì°¸ì—¬ ì»¨í…ì¸ ì´ë©°, í”„ë‘ìŠ¤ êµ­ë¦½ë‚™ë†í˜‘ì˜íšŒ(CNIEL)ë¡œ ë¶€í„° ì œí’ˆ ë° ì›ê³ ë£Œë¥¼ ì œê³µ ë°›ì•˜ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.
This is the content of the 'Cream of Europe' campaign hosted by the European Union(EU) and the French Dairy Interbranch Organization(CNIEL). Products and manuscript fees are provided from CNIEL.

/ INGREDIENTS /
15cm/6inch (7cm height) round pan ì›í˜•íŒ¬ = 18cm/7inch (4.5cm height) round pan ì›í˜•íŒ¬

-vanilla genoise / cake sheet  ë°”ë‹ë¼ ì œëˆ„ì•„ì¦ˆ / ì¼€ì´í¬ ì‹œíŠ¸
3 eggs, room temp ê³„ë€, ì‹¤ì˜¨
85g(1/3cup plus 1 1/2Tbsp) sugar ì„¤íƒ•
95g(2/3cup) cake flour ë°•ë ¥ë¶„
5g(1tsp) vanilla extract ë°”ë‹ë¼ ìµìŠ¤íŠ¸ë™
30g(2Tbsp) unsalted butter, melted ë…¹ì¸ ë¬´ì—¼ë²„í„°
30g(2Tbsp) milk, warm ë”°ëœ»í•œ ìš°ìœ 

-simple syrup ì‹¬í”Œì‹œëŸ½
30g(2Tbsp) sugar ì„¤íƒ•
30g(2Tbsp) water ë¬¼

-whipped cream íœ˜í•‘í¬ë¦¼
500ml(2cups plus 1Tbsp) French cream í”„ë‘ìŠ¤ ìœ í¬ë¦¼
25g(5tsp) sugar ì„¤íƒ•
60g(3Tbsp) condensed milk ì—°ìœ 

1. Preheat the oven to 180C / 355F.
2. In a bowl, put eggs and sugar. Place a bowl over a hot water-pot. Put eggs and sugar, and whip 8~10min until fluffy, and consistency of batter doesn't smooth out quickly.
3. Add the sieved cake flour, and fold gently until no flour is seen.
4. In another bowl, put milk and melted unsalted water. With a dollop of batter, mix until well combined. Pour back the mixture into the batter, and mix gently.
5. Transfer into the lined pan. Tap a few times to get out air pockets. Bake for 30~35min until a toothpick came out clean when poking a center. After came out of the oven, remove right away from the pan.
6. When completely cooled, cut the cake into 1cm or 1.5cm pieces. And slice it for the shape of the teddy bear.
7. To make a simple syrup to serve on the cake sheet, put the sugar and water in a microwavable bowl and microwave until all the sugar crystals are dissolved.
8. Put the whipped cream and sugar in a bowl and whip at high speed until soft peak. Then add the condensed milk and whip until silky smooth and hard peak.
9. Place one cake sheet on the turntable and apply simple syrup to make it moist. Icing it with whipped cream. Repeat with the remaining cake sheets. And finally, clean the edges. Let it chill in the fridge for about 20 minutes.
10. Stand the chilled cake vertically. And icing with whipped cream. And let it chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
11. Put some remaining whipped cream in a piping bag, dye the remaining whipped cream with black food coloring, and put it in a piping bag. Make the ears with the white whipped cream and the face of the bear with the black whipped cream.

1. ì˜¤ë¸ì„ 180C / 355Fë¡œ ì˜ˆì—´í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.
2. ê·¸ë¦‡ì— ê³„ë€ê³¼ ì„¤íƒ•ì„ ë„£ì–´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ëœ¨ê±°ìš´ ë¬¼ì„ ë‹´ì€ ëƒ„ë¹„ìœ„ì— ë†“ì•„ ì¤‘íƒ•ì„ í•˜ë©° 8~10ë¶„ê°„ íœ˜í•‘í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë°˜ì£½ì´ ì˜…ì€ ë¦¬ë³¸í˜•íƒœë¥¼ ë³´ì¼ ë•Œê¹Œì§€ íœ˜í•‘í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”.

5. ìš°í”¼íŒŒì´ë¥¼ ì „ìë ˆì¸ì§€ ì‚¬ìš©í•œ ê·¸ë¦‡ì— ë†“ê³ , ê·¸ ìœ„ì— ë§ˆì‹œë©œë¡œ í•˜ë‚˜ë¥¼ ì˜¬ë ¤ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë§ˆì‹œë©œë¡œê°€ ì ë‹¹íˆ ë§ë‘í•´ì§€ë„ë¡ 10~20ì´ˆ ê°„ ì „ìë ˆì¸ì§€ì— ëŒë ¤ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë§ë‘í•´ì§„ ë§ˆì‹œë©œë¡œ ìœ„ì— ìš°í”¼íŒŒì´ í•˜ë‚˜ë¥¼ ì˜¬ë ¤ ìš°í”¼íŒŒì´ë¥¼ ì™„ì„±í•´ì¤ë‹ˆë‹¤. (ì·¨í–¥ê» ìŠ¤í”„ë§í´ì„ ë¿Œë ¤ ì™„ì„±í•´ì£¼ì„¸ìš”)

1. Preheat the oven to 170 degrees Celsius (325 degrees Fahrenheit). Sift the cake flour, baking soda, and salt to prepare.
2. Put the butter in a bowl and use a whipper to gently beat it. Add sugar and mix well, then add eggs one at a time. When adding the last egg, add vanilla extract and mix well.
3. Pour half of the sifted flour mixture into the dough and mix. When it is half mixed, add half of the milk and mix well. Pour in the remaining flour mixture and milk and mix thoroughly. Add sprinkles to the finished batter and fold lightly to finish.
4. Use an ice cream scoop or spoon, placing the batter into the pan. Bake in an oven preheated to 170 degrees Celsius (325 degrees Fahrenheit) for 14~15 minutes. Chill the whoopie pie after bake. 
5. Place the whoopie pie on a microwavable plate, and place a marshmallow on top. Microwave them for 10~20sec until the marshmallows are getting soft. Place a whoopie pie on top of the soft marshmallow to complete the whoopie pie. (Sprinkle sprinkles onto the marshmallow if you prefer)

Before making: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius (355 degrees Fahrenheit). Place parchment paper on the cake pan.
1. First, to make Earl Grey Whipped Cream, add Earl Grey Tea to heavy cream and mix well. If tyou don't like eating tea leaves, put the tea bag into the heavy cream. Leave it in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour so that Earl Grey tea can be extracted into the heavy cream.
2. Genoise/Cake Sheet: Put eggs and sugar in a bowl. Place it on a pot with hot water and whip it for 5~7 minutes until it is fluffy. Then, add the sifted flour and mix slowly and gently.
3. Put milk and melted unsalted butter in another bowl. Add a dollop of batter and mix evenly. And add earl grey tea and mix again. Pour it back to the egg-flour batter and mix evenly.
4. Pour the batter into a pan with parchment paper on it. Tap a few times to remove air bubbles. Bake in a preheated oven for 25~30 minutes. Bake when you put the toothpick in the middle, the batter doesn't come out. Immediately after came out of the oven, remove it from the pan. Allow it to cool completely at room temperature for at least 1~2 hours.
5. Remove the outer skin and white parts of grapefruit with a knife or hand. Slice the cake sheet into 3 layers.
6. Prepare simple syrup to sprinkle on the Genoise/cake sheet. Put sugar and water in a bowl and microwave for 40 seconds~1 minute to dissolve the sugar. Use when it reaches room temperature.
7. Next, prepare the whipped cream. Put the heavy cream with Earl Grey tea and sugar in a bowl, and whip at high speed until stiff peak. When whipping is almost finished, whip at a low speed for 30 seconds ~ 1 minute to stabilize.
8. Put one layer of Genoise on the turning plate and apply simple syrup. Spread a bit of Earl Grey whipped cream on it, and then place grapefruit on it. And spread whipped cream so that the grapefruit is completely covered. Put another layer of Genoise on top and repeat the same. Lastly, put on the remaining Genoise, then apply simple syrup and icing with all the remaining whipped cream. Do the icing using a spatula and scraper. After when it's done, let the cake harden in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
9. When it's hardened, decorated with grapefruit and herbs (thyme) on the top.

1. Put the biscuits in a zipper bag and crush them with a rolling pin. Transfer the crushed biscuits to a bowl, then add unsalted butter and mix well. Pour cookie crumbs on a cake pan lined with parchment paper or cake collar. Press firmly with the tip of the rolling pin or a spoon. Refrigerate the cookie crumble until the raspberry cheesecake is complete.
2. Add gelatin powder to water and bloom for 5 minutes. Microwave the bloomed gelatin before use.
3. Put the whipped cream in a bowl and whip until stiff peak.
4. Put the cream cheese and sugar in another bowl, and whip the cream cheese until it dissolves with the mayo-like texture. Then, add the melted gelatin to the microwave and mix again. Add the raspberry purÃ©e and mix evenly. Add the whipped cream and mix evenly with a spatula.
5. Pour the raspberry cheesecake mixture into a cake pan with cookie crumble. Tap lightly to even out the top. Store in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
6. When the raspberry cheesecake is completely hardened, decorate the top with whipped cream and raspberry.

1. Prepare parchment paper on a square pan. The oven preheats to 175 degrees Celsius (350 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. Crumble: Put the cake flour, almond flour, sugar, and unsalted butter in one bowl and knead with a spatula or hand until lumps form. When the butter is completely soaked in the dry ingredients, keep it at room temperature until use.
3. Corn Cheesecake: Put the cream cheese and sugar in a separate bowl and mix well until it gets a creamy texture. Add eggs, cake flour, heavy cream, lemon juice, and half of the canned corn to the cream cheese mixture, and thoroughly blend it with a blender/mixer/food processor.
4. Add the remaining canned corn, parmesan cheese, and dried parsley and mix evenly with a spatula. (You can add more canned corn according to your taste)
5. Pour the corn cheesecake batter into a square pan lined with parchment paper. Then, bake in a preheated oven for 45-50 minutes until the crumbs turn golden brown. Do not remove the baked corn cheesecake crumble from the pan right away, let it cool at room temperature for at least 30 minutes, then cool in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours. And after that, removing the pan and parchment paper before eating.
